finding: Variant rs35658696 (Asp563Gly) had shown evidence of a small effect on T2D risk with an SLP of 5.68 and an odds ratio of 1.15, suggesting that it may slightly increase risk.
title: Weighted burden analysis in 200,000 exome-sequenced subjects characterises rare variant effects on risk of type 2 diabetes

finding: The variant rs78408340 was reported to have a small effect on T2D risk, with an SLP of 6.92 and an odds ratio of 1.20, indicating an association with increased risk.
title: Weighted burden analysis in 200,000 exome-sequenced subjects characterises rare variant effects on risk of type 2 diabetes

finding: The SNP rs1837253 in the TSLP locus was linked to asthma. It exhibited a higher odds ratio of 1.17 in the top quartile of sensory-related disease (SRD) topic weight than 1.05 in the bottom quartile, with a P-value of 1×10^-4 for the difference.
title: Age-dependent topic modelling of comorbidities in UK Biobank identifies disease subtypes with differential genetic risk

finding: The SNP rs2909950 was noted to be associated with TLA in the early evening hours.
title: Genome-wide association studies of 27 accelerometry-derived physical activity measurements identifies novel loci and genetic mechanisms

finding: This SNP was linked with LIPA, providing insights into the genetic factors influencing physical activity patterns.
title: Genome-wide association studies of 27 accelerometry-derived physical activity measurements identifies novel loci and genetic mechanisms

finding: The intronic SNP rs7733410 in HTR4 presented a larger effect on FEV1 in ever-smokers compared to never-smokers, showing a 76.2% increase with a P value of 4.09×10^-5, suggesting its specific relevance in smoking-related lung function impairment.
title: Multi-ancestry genome-wide association study improves resolution of genes, pathways and pleiotropy for lung function and chronic obstructive pulmonary disease

finding: In ADRB2, the variant rs1800888, associated with lower FEV1 and FEV1/FVC ratios, indicated a strong relationship with increased eosinophil counts, linking respiratory function and inflammation.
title: Multi-ancestry genome-wide association study improves resolution of genes, pathways and pleiotropy for lung function and chronic obstructive pulmonary disease

finding: The C allele of rs12522114 in ITGA2 was associated with higher FEV1 and FEV1/FVC ratios, which may point towards a potential therapeutic repurposing of drugs targeting this gene in COPD.
title: Multi-ancestry genome-wide association study improves resolution of genes, pathways and pleiotropy for lung function and chronic obstructive pulmonary disease

finding: The SNP rs11956411 at 5q31.3 was identified as an eQTL for PCDHGA3 in the brain cortex, and was linked to chronic diseases and SCZ traits, showcasing its potential role in psychiatric disorders.
title: Multi-trait genetic analysis identifies novel pleiotropic loci for depression and schizophrenia in East Asians

finding: The variant rs871269 was reported as a protective variant for Alzheimer’s disease (AD) with an odds ratio for AD case status of 0.96 for the T allele. This finding suggested that the T allele was associated with a lower risk of developing AD.
title: Post-GWAS multiomic functional investigation of the TNIP1 locus in Alzheimer’s disease implicates mediation through GPX3

finding: The rs34294852 variant was studied for its association with reduced levels of CSF GPX3 in individuals labeled as A+T+ in AD progression. A significant decrease in GPX3 levels per copy of the rs34294852 minor allele was observed in relation to the worsening clinical profile, particularly among homozygous recessive carriers.
title: Post-GWAS multiomic functional investigation of the TNIP1 locus in Alzheimer’s disease implicates mediation through GPX3

finding: The SNP rs13167486 was associated with increased COVID-19 severity in segments of African ancestry, located on chromosome 5 (5:34675449-35163719) with a p-value of 0.03 after multiple test correction. This region was part of an admixture mapping analysis that demonstrated regions of high disease severity linked to African ancestry.
title: Deconvoluting complex correlates of COVID19 severity with local ancestry inference and viral phylodynamics: Results of a multiomic pandemic tracking strategy

finding: The minor A allele of rs373863828 was associated with a 30-40% reduction in risk of type 2 diabetes (T2D) among Polynesian populations, despite an increase in body mass index (BMI) by 1.36-1.45 kg/m2 per allele. The A allele correlated with increased postprandial plasma insulin levels without affecting insulin sensitivity, suggesting that this allele enhances the insulin secretory capacity of pancreatic beta cells, thereby potentially protecting against diabetes.
title: The CREBRF diabetes-protective rs373863828-A allele is associated with enhanced early insulin release in men of Māori and Pacific ancestry

finding: The SNP rs5744672 was significantly associated with increased expression levels of HMGCR in skeletal muscle, with a normalized effect size of 0.14 and a p-value of 2.9 x 10^-6. This finding supported the role of HMGCR in lipid metabolism.
title: Multi-ancestry Polygenic Mechanisms of Type 2 Diabetes Elucidate Disease Processes and Clinical Heterogeneity

finding: The SNP rs2861761 was significantly associated with obesity-related traits in published GWASs and was nearest to the gene TENM2, which is enriched in white adipocytes.
title: The genetic architecture of changes in adiposity during adulthood

finding: The rs17443704 variant was discovered as one of two novel loci associated with accelerometer-measured moderate to vigorous PA (MVPA), demonstrating a genome-wide significant association with a p-value of 3.8×10⁻⁹.
title: Association of Sedentary and Physical Activity Behaviors with Body Composition: a Genome-Wide Association and Mendelian Randomization Study

finding: Associated with <italic>CLPTM1L</italic> at 5p15.33, this SNP displayed a strong association with a <italic>P</italic>=7.0 10<sup>−54</sup> and marked its importance for prostate cancer concerns.
title: Leveraging Genetic Determinants of Prostate-Specific Antigen Levels Towards Improving Prostate Cancer Screening

finding: Identified in the 5q15 region, this variant demonstrated substantial connections with PSA analysis.
title: Leveraging Genetic Determinants of Prostate-Specific Antigen Levels Towards Improving Prostate Cancer Screening

finding: This SNP associated with <italic>TLR4</italic> exhibited significant relevance to PSA.
title: Leveraging Genetic Determinants of Prostate-Specific Antigen Levels Towards Improving Prostate Cancer Screening

finding: The rs2853677 variant at the TERT locus was associated with an increased risk of overall clonal haematopoiesis (CH), with an odds ratio (OR) of 1.31 [1.24-1.37], P = 1.69 x 10^-24. This finding was consistent with previous associations reported in European populations.
title: Comparative analysis of 136,401 Admixed Americans and 419,228 Europeans reveals ancestry-specific genetic determinants of clonal haematopoiesis

finding: The SNP rs7715383 tagged the ADAMTS16 gene, which is located in the multi-variant locus on chromosome 5p15.32, and was identified as an important variant in the context of hernia research.
title: Comprehensive genome-wide association study of different forms of hernia identifies more than 80 associated loci

finding: The SNP rs3835066, which tagged the LOX gene on 5q23.2, was associated with the cross-linking of collagen and elastin, highlighting its role in the connective tissue mechanisms underlying hernias.
title: Comprehensive genome-wide association study of different forms of hernia identifies more than 80 associated loci

finding: this significant SNP was associated with substance use disorder risk linked to genetic mechanisms.
title: Multivariate genome-wide association meta-analysis of over 1 million subjects identifies loci underlying multiple substance use disorders

finding: This SNP was linked to cervical dysplasia (p=2.1 × 10⁻⁹), marking its importance downstream of CLPTM1L, a gene implicated in cancer susceptibility.
title: GWAS meta-analysis and gene expression data link reproductive tract development, immune response and cellular proliferation/apoptosis with cervical cancer and clarify overlap with other cervical phenotypes

finding: Associated with cervical cancer (p=1.3 × 10⁻¹⁴), this SNP is upstream of CLPTM1L, which affects apoptosis and cancer susceptibility.
title: GWAS meta-analysis and gene expression data link reproductive tract development, immune response and cellular proliferation/apoptosis with cervical cancer and clarify overlap with other cervical phenotypes

finding: The SNP rs11739167 was identified as the most significant paternally transmitted ASD-SV, showing a 17.6-fold greater transmission than expected. It was located in the MSNP1 pseudogene, which is linked to ASDs.
title: Structural Variants Are a Major Component of the Missing Heritability of Autism Spectrum Disorder

finding: The SNP rs4307059 was reported as associated with ASD in previous studies, and expression levels of the MSNP1 gene were shown to significantly differ in ASD individuals homozygous for the T allele at this SNP.
title: Structural Variants Are a Major Component of the Missing Heritability of Autism Spectrum Disorder

finding: The SNP rs888783 associated with SLIT2 was detected in 23% of ASD cases, underscoring its relevance in the axon guidance pathway relevant to ASD.
title: Structural Variants Are a Major Component of the Missing Heritability of Autism Spectrum Disorder

finding: The study found significant interaction evidence at rs764985249 of EFNA5 for PP under STST conditions (P_GxE=4.1×10^-9).
title: A Large-Scale Genome-Wide Study of Gene-Sleep Duration Interactions for Blood Pressure in 811,405 Individuals from Diverse Populations

finding: The rs540041583 variant was shown to significantly influence PP in the context of LTST interaction (P_GxE=8.9×10^-5), associated with PAM.
title: A Large-Scale Genome-Wide Study of Gene-Sleep Duration Interactions for Blood Pressure in 811,405 Individuals from Diverse Populations

finding: The variant rs544452250 (5-154268943-C-G; E144Q) was identified as a predicted deleterious variant shared by three individuals with schizophrenia, bipolar affective disorder (BPAD), and substance use disorder within the same family. This finding contributes to the understanding of its role in neurodevelopmental disorders, specifically those involving cerebellar atrophy and motor dysfunction.
title: Whole Exome Sequencing in dense families suggests genetic pleiotropy amongst Mendelian and complex neuropsychiatric syndromes

finding: The SNP rs7702187, found at SEMA5A, also contributed to the elevated risk of 'moderate' progression in PD, making it one of the relevant genetic variants for this subgroup.
title: Artificial Intelligence-Based Clustering and Characterization of Parkinson’s Disease Trajectories

finding: The SNP rs1073548 was linked to the gene UGT3A1, another glucuronosyltransferase involved in the elimination of estradiol, further supporting the significance of these enzymes in affecting estradiol levels.
title: Genome-Wide Association Study of Estradiol Levels, and the Causal Effect of Estradiol on Bone Mineral Density

finding: Associated with both hypothyroidism and TSH levels, this lead signal was also linked to excess menstrual issues in women.
title: Uncovering the Shared Genetic Components of Thyroid Disorders and Reproductive Health

finding: This SNP was connected to thyroid characteristics and reproductive health, specifically addressing TSH levels.
title: Uncovering the Shared Genetic Components of Thyroid Disorders and Reproductive Health

finding: The association of SNP rs62355902 was identified alongside a burden of protein-truncating variants (PTVs) in the context of breast cancer susceptibility. In the evaluation of logistic regression models, when considering both the PTV burden and the lead GWAS SNPs, the odds ratio (OR) for carrying a PTV was found to be 8.54, indicating a significant risk factor that operates independently from the regulatory effect of rs62355902.
title: Exome sequencing identifies novel susceptibility genes and defines the contribution of coding variants to breast cancer risk

finding: Similar to rs62355902, the SNP rs984113 was part of a logistic regression analysis that considered both the SNPs and the PTV burden. The odds ratios for rs984113 remained consistent even when adjusting for PTVs, indicating that it had a distinct and independent association with breast cancer risk.
title: Exome sequencing identifies novel susceptibility genes and defines the contribution of coding variants to breast cancer risk

finding: The SNP rs112497245 also demonstrated an independent effect in the analysis alongside PTVs. The ORs for this SNP were notably similar to the unadjusted ORs, which further supports the notion that the association of this SNP with breast cancer susceptibility operates independently of the PTV burden.
title: Exome sequencing identifies novel susceptibility genes and defines the contribution of coding variants to breast cancer risk

finding: This variant was genome-wide significantly associated with benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH) indicating its role in related conditions from the discovery cohort.
title: Genome-wide association study of prostate-specific antigen levels in 392,522 men identifies new loci and improves cross-ancestry prediction

finding: This SNP was identified as genome-wide significant for prostate-specific antigen levels in the analysis, contributing to understanding prostate cancer risk.
title: Genome-wide association study of prostate-specific antigen levels in 392,522 men identifies new loci and improves cross-ancestry prediction

finding: rs6883598 was associated with FBN2, a gene important in elastic fiber assembly and linked to aortic aneurysms and Beals Syndrome, marking a new finding in CAD research.
title: Discovery and systematic characterization of risk variants and genes for coronary artery disease in over a million participants

finding: This variant was reported as more common in East Asians and exhibited stronger effects in Biobank Japan, illustrating ethnic-specific variations in CAD associations.
title: Discovery and systematic characterization of risk variants and genes for coronary artery disease in over a million participants

finding: Identified as likely causal in the ITGA1 gene, this variant was associated with raised levels of CAD risk, emphasizing its functional significance.
title: Discovery and systematic characterization of risk variants and genes for coronary artery disease in over a million participants

finding: The minor allele of rs373863828 in CREBRF was associated with higher BMI (1.36 kg/m^2 per copy of the A allele), lower odds of type 2 diabetes (0.586 OR), and lower fasting glucose levels (−1.65 mg/dL per copy of the A allele). These associations were observed in Polynesians from Samoa, American Samoa, and Aotearoa New Zealand.
title: CREBRF missense variant rs373863828 has both direct and indirect effects on type 2 diabetes and fasting glucose in Polynesians living in Samoa and Aotearoa New Zealand

finding: The rs3812036 SNP at SLC34A1 was found to be significantly associated with activated partial thromboplastin time (aPTT) levels with a P-value of 3.54×10^-6, supporting earlier findings of its association with aPTT as reported by Tang et al. (P=2.88×10^-18).
title: Systematic mediation and interaction analyses of kidney function genetic loci in a general population study

finding: The SNP <italic>rs35390</italic> in the <italic>SLC45A2</italic> gene was associated with hair color, specifically black hair, showing a trans-ancestry effect size of beta=-0.456 and a significant heterogeneity p-value of 6.49×10<sup>-192</sup>. This SNP exhibited a much larger effect size in European participants (beta=-1.928) compared to those from other ancestries.
title: Inter-population differences of allele frequency and regulome tagging are associated with the heterogeneity of loci identified by cross-ancestry genome-wide association studies

finding: The SNP <italic>rs55810502</italic> was found associated with low-density lipoprotein (LDL) cholesterol, contributing to cross-ancestry heterogeneous associations with blood biomarkers.
title: Inter-population differences of allele frequency and regulome tagging are associated with the heterogeneity of loci identified by cross-ancestry genome-wide association studies

finding: The T allele of rs2549794 had a minor allele frequency of 0.4-0.5 and was associated with increased odds of respiratory infection, with an odds ratio (OR) of 1.03 for pneumonia (95% CI 1.01-1.05, p = 0.014). This association was more pronounced in bacterial infections and more severe phenotypes of pneumonia. For Crohn's disease and type 1 diabetes, the T allele was found to be protective with ORs of 0.86 (95% CI 0.82-0.90, p = 8.6 x 10^-9) and 0.95 (95% CI 0.90-0.99, p = 0.02), respectively. There was also a positive association with increased parental longevity, with a beta of 0.01 (95% CI 0.004-0.017, p = 0.002) indicating increased age at parental death.
title: Variation in ERAP2 has opposing effects on severe respiratory infection and autoimmune disease

finding: Variation at rs2248374, which is in strong linkage disequilibrium with rs2549794, showed similar effects as noted in rs2549794. This SNP was associated with the same outcomes: it corroborated the findings of increased respiratory infection odds and the protective nature against Crohn's disease and type 1 diabetes, suggesting ongoing balancing selection at the locus.
title: Variation in ERAP2 has opposing effects on severe respiratory infection and autoimmune disease

finding: The SNP rs147450666 was identified as being proximal to FBN2 and SLC27A6, both of which were associated with protective effects against Alzheimer's disease, contributing to the identification of new common loci.
title: Identification of 16 novel Alzheimer’s disease susceptibility loci using multi-ancestry meta-analyses of clinical Alzheimer’s disease and AD-by-proxy cases from four whole genome sequencing datasets

finding: The variant c.859G>C was associated with a less severe phenotype of Spinal Muscular Atrophy (SMA) and showed consistent results with PCR/Nanopore genotyping methods across tested samples.
title: A dual-mode targeted Nanopore sequencing assay for comprehensive SMN1 and SMN2 variant analysis

finding: The NM_000344.3:c.*3+80T>G variant was linked with SMN1 duplication haplotypes, aiding in the identification of silent carriers and increasing detection rates of carrier status when 2 SMN1 copies occurred on the same chromosome.
title: A dual-mode targeted Nanopore sequencing assay for comprehensive SMN1 and SMN2 variant analysis

finding: The NM_000344.3:c.*211_*212del variant was likewise associated with SMN1 duplications, contributing to the capability of flagging silent carriers and enhancing carrier detection rates.
title: A dual-mode targeted Nanopore sequencing assay for comprehensive SMN1 and SMN2 variant analysis

finding: The SNP rs72831309, located in the intron of the TENM2 gene, was associated with a lower risk of chronic kidney disease (CKD) and diabetic kidney disease (DKD). The odds ratio was 2.08 (p=9.8x10^-9), indicating a significant correlation with the CKD-DKD phenotype.
title: Genome-wide meta-analysis and omics integration identifies novel genes associated with diabetic kidney disease

finding: The FNIP1 p.R518Q variant (rs115209326) was significant in women for fat distribution, marking it as a notable original finding.
title: Identification of rare loss of function variation regulating body fat distribution

finding: The SNP rs12519880 identified in the LINC02123-ADCY2 locus was a novel finding related to coffee consumption.
title: Habitual Coffee Consumption Increases Risks for Metabolic Diseases: Genome-wide Association Studies and a Phenotype-wide Two Sample Mendelian Randomization Analysis

finding: The SNP rs2067919 associated with LINC02060 was identified as associated with non-caffeine substances consumption.
title: Habitual Coffee Consumption Increases Risks for Metabolic Diseases: Genome-wide Association Studies and a Phenotype-wide Two Sample Mendelian Randomization Analysis

finding: This variant was grouped with rs2303720, indicating a potential negative relationship with blood pressure (BP) traits as part of the same cluster with an effect size of -0.0438.
title: CLUSTERING OF RARE VARIANTS FOR CAUSAL VARIANTS IDENTIFICATION AND EFFECT DIRECTION CLASSIFICATION

finding: Similarly, rs189429890 was included in the cluster with an effect size of -0.0438, suggesting a negative association with blood pressure (BP) traits.
title: CLUSTERING OF RARE VARIANTS FOR CAUSAL VARIANTS IDENTIFICATION AND EFFECT DIRECTION CLASSIFICATION

finding: This SNP was part of a signal cluster displaying a moderate positive effect size of 0.173, indicating a potential positive relationship with blood pressure (BP) traits.
title: CLUSTERING OF RARE VARIANTS FOR CAUSAL VARIANTS IDENTIFICATION AND EFFECT DIRECTION CLASSIFICATION

finding: Demonstrated suggestive significance in both the 'both-controls' and 'external-controls' scenarios in connection with psoriatic arthritis, highlighting its role in disease susceptibility.
title: Accurate cross-platform GWAS analysis via two-stage imputation

finding: This SNP showed consistency in findings associated with psoriatic arthritis across different cohorts, including replication in both the 'both-controls' and the 'external-controls' GWAS.

finding: It was highlighted in the context of psoriatic arthritis, showing substantial significance within the TSIM framework and contributing to the replication of known loci.
title: Accurate cross-platform GWAS analysis via two-stage imputation

finding: Signaled strong replication effects in the 'both-controls' GWAS concerning psoriatic arthritis, indicating its significant role.
title: Accurate cross-platform GWAS analysis via two-stage imputation

finding: Observed to have suggestive significance in relation to psoriatic arthritis within the 'both-controls' analysis, reinforcing its potential association.
title: Accurate cross-platform GWAS analysis via two-stage imputation

finding: The rs1173773 variant was significantly associated with time to remission of COVID-19 symptoms, demonstrating a strong P-value of 4.94 × 10⁻⁸. The C allele of this SNP was linked to a higher remission rate, with survival analysis predicting that by day 15, 44%, 54%, and 59% of individuals with TT, CT, and CC genotypes respectively had symptom remission. The hazard ratio was calculated at 1.25 (95% CI 1.15-1.35), indicating an acceleration factor of 0.84 for symptom remission relative to the T allele.
title: Genetics of symptom remission in outpatients with COVID-19

finding: The variant rs35972942 was identified as genome-wide significant for gastric cancer through the TAPE and TAPE-LTFH analyses in the Korean cohort. Like rs760077, this variant had associations reported in Chinese or Japanese populations, suggesting a broader role in gastric cancer susceptibility.
title: Incorporating family disease history and controlling case-control imbalance for population based genetic association studies

finding: The SNP rs6866783 was shown to exhibit strong colocalization with cervical cancer, indicating its potential relevance in cancer susceptibility.
title: Enhancer RNA transcriptome-wide association study reveals an atlas of pan-cancer susceptibility eRNAs

finding: Previously reported in GWAS for unipolar depression (EFO ID EFO_0003761), this SNP was associated with a common genetic factor of major depressive symptoms, indicating its relevance to depressive disorders.
title: Genetic structure of major depression symptoms across clinical and community cohorts

finding: The variant rs76300969 on gene AACSL was associated with SB-AUD at a significance level of p<10^-6. It contributed to the broader association of several genetic loci with emotional and behavioral traits, primarily focusing on the combination of SB and AUD.
title: Genetic Factors Associated with Suicidal Behaviors and Alcohol Use Disorders in an American Indian Population

finding: Identified on chromosome 5, the SNP rs4916723 was linked to the non-SU externalizing factor. This association highlighted the potential genetic contributions of externalizing traits to increased risk for PSU, independent of effects related to other forms of substance use.
title: Genetic associations among internalizing and externalizing traits with polysubstance use among young adults

finding: The SNP rs79107704 showed the largest association with BAG, indicating that one copy of the A allele was linked to an increase in brain age of 0.63 years. This SNP was located 3,405bp downstream of the BHMT2 gene, involved in choline metabolism.
title: Genetic architecture of brain age and its casual relations with brain and mental disorders

finding: The findings indicated that rs4543289 was one of the genetic variants that distinguished a cluster showing a reduced risk of self-harm behavior in response to light-intensity physical activity (LIPA), suggesting a complex interaction influencing these outcomes. Additionally, this SNP was associated with the severity and symptoms of depression, contributing to the understanding of how physical activity could impact depressive patients.
title: Associations between physical activities and self-harm behavior in depression across the genotype: findings from the UK Biobank

finding: The intergenic SNP rs2431697 was shown to affect the expression of various genes by associating with the promoter of miRNA-146a, recognized as an SLE biomarker and potent immune regulator.
title: A multilayered post-GWAS analysis pipeline defines functional variants and target genes for systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE)

finding: SNP rs2853677 in TERT was negatively associated with PACER, suggesting it played a role in the clonal expansion process identified in the GWAS.
title: Determinants of mosaic chromosomal alteration fitness

finding: The rs1043358053 SNP in TERT was linked to reduced lifespan with a hazard ratio of 11.9 and a p-value of 7.4 x 10^-5.
title: Genetic associations with human longevity are enriched for oncogenic genes

finding: The SNP rs57221529 (CHR5:586,509; A>G) was identified as the top SNP from the GWAS peak 5' of SLC9A3 and was an expression quantitative trait locus (eQTL) for multiple genes. It was associated with reduced TPPP expression and increased SLC9A3 expression in CF nasal epithelia, explaining 2% and 3% of the variation in these expressions, respectively. Notably, a longer length of VNTR #45 was found to occur more frequently with the minor allele (G) of this SNP.
title: A cystic fibrosis lung disease modifier locus harbors tandem repeats associated with gene expression

finding: The SNP rs72711364 (CHR5:415,208; A>G) served as the top SNP from the GWAS peak 3' of SLC9A3. It was not significantly associated with SLC9A3 expression in CF nasal epithelia and explained a lower proportion of variance compared to the VNTR #11, with the long VNTR length being more frequently in cis with the major allele (A). Despite its lack of direct association with gene expression, VNTR #11 was associated with greater SLC9A3 expression, suggesting that the VNTR might be the causal variation affecting lung function.
title: A cystic fibrosis lung disease modifier locus harbors tandem repeats associated with gene expression

finding: This variant in ALDH7A1 was associated with 6-oxopiperidine-2-carboxylate levels, linking it to lysine catabolism.
title: Genome-wide association study of 1,391 plasma metabolites in 6,136 Finnish men identifies 303 novel signals and provides biological insights into human diseases

finding: The CDO1 variant was linked to hypotaurine, implicating its function in cysteine metabolism.
title: Genome-wide association study of 1,391 plasma metabolites in 6,136 Finnish men identifies 303 novel signals and provides biological insights into human diseases

finding: The SLC23A1 variant was associated with ascorbic acid 3-sulfate, relevant for vitamin C metabolism.
title: Genome-wide association study of 1,391 plasma metabolites in 6,136 Finnish men identifies 303 novel signals and provides biological insights into human diseases

finding: Found a significant association (p=4.90E-09) near the TMEM161B and MEF2C genes, with implications for BMI and other behavioral traits.
title: CADM2 is implicated in impulsive personality and numerous other traits by genome- and phenome-wide association studies in humans, with further support from studies of Cadm2 mutant mice

finding: The SNP rs373863828 was identified as a missense variant in the CREBRF gene and was positively associated with fat-free mass in Samoan infants, rather than with fat mass. This finding provided insight into the genetic factors affecting body composition in the specific demographic of Samoan infants.
title: Characterization of Per- and Polyfluoroalkyl Substance (PFAS) concentrations in a community-based sample of infants from Samoa

finding: The intergenic variant rs114969851, positioned 18K away from the ARL2BPP6 gene, was significantly associated with the combined cohort labeled as 'all DGBI'.
title: Combined GWAS and single cell transcriptomics uncover the underlying genes and cell types in disorders of gut-brain interaction

finding: An association was found between the intergenic variant rs60111579 on chromosome 5 and functional dyspepsia, marking it as a significant signal within this study.
title: Combined GWAS and single cell transcriptomics uncover the underlying genes and cell types in disorders of gut-brain interaction

finding: The intergenic variant rs185001252 on chromosome 5 was significantly associated with functional diarrhea, indicating its relevance to this condition.
title: Combined GWAS and single cell transcriptomics uncover the underlying genes and cell types in disorders of gut-brain interaction

finding: The SNP rs72801474 exhibited a significant association with hypertension in the context of gene expression for the gene HSPA4. In the analysis for the hypertension trait, without adjusting for DNA methylation (DNAm), the expression levels of multiple genes showed significant effects, with a false discovery rate (FDR) of less than 0.05. However, after taking DNAm into account, only HSPA4 remained significant. Furthermore, rs72801474 was identified as the top significant eQTL variant within the HSPA4 locus, showing high colocalization probability with GWAS signals for hypertension.
title: An integrative multi-context Mendelian randomization method for identifying risk genes across human tissues

finding: The SNP rs55920409, found in the 5p13.1 locus, was significantly associated with endometriosis with a P-value of 2.66E-08, marking it as an original finding.
title: Expanding the genetic landscape of endometriosis: Integrative -omics analyses uncover key pathways from a multi-ancestry study of over 900,000 women

finding: SNP rs12916, related to HMGCR, showed associations with lipid traits that resembled the effects of statin therapy, indicating its potential role in lipid metabolism and cardiovascular disease risk.
title: Genome-wide characterization of circulating metabolic biomarkers reveals substantial pleiotropy and novel disease pathways

finding: The SNP rs12916, located near HMGCR, was found to be associated with VLDL lipid content, supporting its role as a target for lowering lipid levels in cardiovascular disease.
title: Lipo-proteomic and metabolic fine-mapping of genetic lipid risk loci

finding: Located at the ANKRD55 locus, this SNP had a PIP greater than 0.99, confirming its potential role in the pathogenesis of RA, especially within CD4+ T cell-specific open chromatin regions.
title: Trans-ancestry genome-wide association study identifies novel genetic mechanisms in rheumatoid arthritis

finding: The genotype of the 5-HT<sub>1A</sub> receptor promoter region polymorphism (rs6295) influenced the outcome of high-frequency transcranial magnetic stimulation (HF TMS) in patients suffering from major depressive episodes. It was suggested that a greater load of G alleles in this polymorphism was associated with lower serotonin release, leading to post-synaptic upregulation of the 5-HT<sub>1A</sub> receptor. This association emphasized the relevance of the 5-HT<sub>1A</sub> receptor in the context of TMS treatment.
title: Effects of bilateral sequential theta-burst stimulation on 5-HT1A receptors on dorsolateral prefrontal cortex in treatment resistant depression

finding: Related to the gene Slit3, SNP rs142753275 was found to be associated with the cortical thickness of the left pars opercularis and was linked to major depressive disorder (MDD) with a p-value of 2.75×10^−9.
title: Common and Disorders-Specific Cortical Thickness Alterations in Internalizing, Externalizing and Thought Disorders over a 2-year Period in the Preadolescents of the ABCD Study

finding: The study found that rs258760, a C>T transversion located in an intron of ARHGAP26, is associated with asthma risk by eliminating an active aryl hydrocarbon receptor (AHR) response element. This SNP influences the transcriptional regulation of the glucocorticoid receptor gene NR3C1 in response to AHR ligands, thus linking air pollution and asthma.
title: Glucocorticoid-regulated bidirectional enhancer RNA transcription pinpoints functional genetic variants linked to asthma

finding: The SNP rs274567, which maps to the carnitine transporter gene SLC22A5, was positively associated with acetyl-carnitine levels. It showed a significant protective effect with regards to reducing the risk of severe Covid19 and was linked to an increased risk of muscle weakness by approximately 70% (OR=1.68, 95% CI 1.30 to 2.16, p=0.00007). This suggests a complex role where heightened acetyl-carnitine could inhibit carnitine uptake in tissues.
title: Mendelian randomization analyses show that higher acetyl-carnitine and carnitine levels in blood protect against severe Covid19

finding: SNP rs1848553, located in an intron of the RGS7BP gene on chromosome 5, was identified as GWAS significant with a meta-analysis p-value of 2.97×10-8. The T allele was associated with nearly a 1-point reduction in the TBScore relating to TB severity, indicating a clinically meaningful impact on the disease.
title: Tuberculosis severity associates with variants and eQTLs related to vascular biology and infection-induced inflammation

finding: The SNP rs61175833 was found to have a genome-wide significant association with AD, recorded with a p-value of 1.947e-05. It was located in an intergenic region near the SLC1A3 gene, suggesting a potential genetic influence on the disease.
title: An Integrated Genomic and Transcriptomic Analysis Reveals Distinct Molecular Features Associated with Mild-to-moderate Atopic Dermatitis

finding: The SNP rs2910164 demonstrated a sex-specific effect related to melanoma skin cancer susceptibility, particularly in interaction with rs486907, suggesting its role in conferring differential risk based on sex.
title: Systematic review reveals multiple sexually antagonistic polymorphisms affecting human disease and complex traits

finding: The presence of rs2910164 located within <italic>MIR146A</italic> resulted in decreased levels of miR-146a-5p, which correlated with increased levels of TLR-2, a critical microglial receptor mediating neuroinflammation following its binding to Aβ42. This relationship has implications for Alzheimer's disease (AD) pathology.
title: A multi-omics approach identifies a blood-based miRNA signature of cognitive decline in two large observational trials

finding: The variant rs34358 was linked with a stop gained mutation and was in high linkage disequilibrium (LD) with the lead variant rs42854 (r² = 0.85) in the gene ANKDD1B. This indicates a high impact on protein function, which suggests it may play a role in migraine pathophysiology.
title: Genome-wide analysis of 102,084 migraine cases identifies 123 risk loci and subtype-specific risk alleles

finding: The lead variant rs42854 was identified as significant in the context of migraine, with a stop gained mutation influencing the gene ANKDD1B, linking it to potential migraine mechanisms.
title: Genome-wide analysis of 102,084 migraine cases identifies 123 risk loci and subtype-specific risk alleles

finding: The SNP rs147625068 was identified as a significant variant associated with early ischemic stroke in individuals with sickle cell disease (SCD). It was linked to the gene ADAMTS2 and had a p-value of 3.7 x 10^-9. This finding replicated the association of ADAMTS2 with non-SCD early onset stroke.
title: Genome-wide association study of ischemic stroke risk in Sickle Cell confirms ADAMTS2, CDK18, uncovers 12 novel loci

finding: While primarily associated with ADAMTS12, the variant rs534089428 was also highlighted in the study with a p-value of 2.43 x 10^-5, contributing to the understanding of genetic risk factors for stroke.
title: Genome-wide association study of ischemic stroke risk in Sickle Cell confirms ADAMTS2, CDK18, uncovers 12 novel loci

finding: The SNP rs55744247, located in FST, showed an association with ASATadjBMI (P = 5.1 x 10^-10) but not with VATadjBMI or GFATadjBMI.
title: Inherited basis of visceral, abdominal subcutaneous and gluteofemoral fat depots

finding: This SNP, rs273913, was found to have a significant association with omega-3 fatty acids, with a MAF of 0.3867, and was confirmed in replication studies.
title: Fifty-one novel, replicated loci identified in genome-wide association study of polyunsaturated and monounsaturated fatty acids in 124,024 European individuals

finding: The SNP rs166635 was associated with DHA levels, exhibiting significant results with a MAF of 0.3079, and was supported by external replication.
title: Fifty-one novel, replicated loci identified in genome-wide association study of polyunsaturated and monounsaturated fatty acids in 124,024 European individuals

finding: The SNP rs11745324 was nominally associated with the AF-related heart failure subtype, indicating a potential link in the gene region associated with PITX2/FAM241A.
title: Identifying subtypes of heart failure with machine learning: external, prognostic and genetic validation in three electronic health record sources with 320,863 individuals

finding: In sleep studies, rs16903122 had implications for genetic connections within various brain areas.
title: Mapping sleep’s phenotypic and genetic links to the brain and heart: a systematic analysis of multimodal brain and cardiac images in the UK Biobank

finding: In 5q14.3, this variant was associated with brain regions, highlighting its importance in sleep genetics.
title: Mapping sleep’s phenotypic and genetic links to the brain and heart: a systematic analysis of multimodal brain and cardiac images in the UK Biobank

finding: The variant rs2099810 was found relevant in discussions about genetic influences on sleep.
title: Mapping sleep’s phenotypic and genetic links to the brain and heart: a systematic analysis of multimodal brain and cardiac images in the UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs10040104 was associated with findings reported by Craver et al. (2018), who discussed the critical role of inflammation in the pathogenesis and progression of myeloid malignancies. This highlighted the relevance of CCGs, potentially linked to rs10040104, in the context of cancer progression.
title: Blood cytokine analysis suggests that SARS-CoV-2 infection results in a sustained tumour promoting environment in cancer patients

finding: The SNP rs7732130 was identified as the likely causal variant associated with type 2 diabetes (T2D), HbA1c, and glucose levels. The G allele was found to increase the probability of the region acting as an enhancer. The T2D risk allele was associated with increased binding affinity for both ZNF143 and RFX7, leading to enhanced expression of PDE8B and ZBED3 in pancreatic islets.
title: Modeling islet enhancers using deep learning identifies candidate causal variants at loci associated with T2D and glycemic traits

finding: The missense variant rs373863828 in the CREB3 Regulatory Factor gene (CREBRF) was found to be associated with higher body mass index (BMI) in Samoan adults, where each copy of the minor allele corresponded to a 1.4 kg/m2 increase in BMI. This finding was supported by significant associations in a cohort from Samoa and suggestive associations in a cohort from Aotearoa New Zealand, indicating its pleiotropic effects on obesity-related phenotypes. The analyses showed a strong direct effect of this variant on weight, while also displaying associations with fat mass, abdominal circumference, and hip circumference among others.
title: Multivariate analysis of a missense variant in CREBRF reveals associations with measures of adiposity in people of Polynesian ancestries

finding: This SNP in the JADE2 gene reached the more conservative significance threshold, indicating its association with lung cancer and previous links to smoking behavior.
title: Multi-ancestry meta-analyses of lung cancer in the Million Veteran Program reveal novel risk loci and elucidate smoking-independent genetic risk

finding: The minor allele A of rs373863828 in the CREBRF gene was originally found to be associated with higher body mass index (BMI) and increased weight among adult Samoans, while also being paradoxically linked to lower fasting blood glucose levels and reduced odds of developing type 2 diabetes. In this study, the association with higher average weight and BMI was confirmed, primarily significant in women. Further analysis indicated that individuals carrying the A allele exhibited greater total fat mass as well as greater lean mass, suggesting that the protective effect of this allele against type 2 diabetes could be due to more effective regulation of blood glucose levels through increased lean body mass.
title: The association of CREBRF variant rs373863828 with body composition in adult Samoans

finding: The non-coding variant rs12916 in the HMG-CoA reductase (HMGCR) gene was associated with 27 out of 56 selected metabolites and 180 out of 249 tested metabolite traits, highlighting its extensive pleiotropic effects and its known link to cardiovascular disease.
title: Genome-wide association study for circulating metabolites in 619,372 individuals

finding: Located near RGS14, this SNP was linked to atopic dermatitis and suggests involvement in G-protein signaling pathways related to immune regulation.
title: European and multi-ancestry genome-wide association meta-analysis of atopic dermatitis highlights importance of systemic immune regulation

finding: This SNP was identified as part of a significant association with various immune cell phenotypes and corroborated by earlier studies on immune function.
title: Genome-wide association study reveals different T cell distributions in peripheral blood of healthy individuals at high genetic risk of type 1 diabetes and long COVID

finding: This finding confirmed its association with immune cell distributions and was mentioned in previous immunological research.
title: Genome-wide association study reveals different T cell distributions in peripheral blood of healthy individuals at high genetic risk of type 1 diabetes and long COVID

finding: SNP rs62376947 was identified as the sentinel variant within an intronic region of SLIT3 on chromosome 5q35.1, reaching genome-wide significance with a p-value of 2.49 x 10^-8. Its specific role in TN was not elaborated upon, yet it suggests a genetic risk factor for TN.
title: Genome-wide association study reveals genetic risk factors for trigeminal neuralgia

finding: Genetic variation in rs12916, located within the <italic>HMGCR</italic> gene, was associated with lower levels of low-density lipoprotein (LDL). This SNP represented the leading variant for LDL in conjunction with a wider analysis linking LDL to the risk of Parkinson's Disease (PD). The findings indicated that there were no high probabilities of shared causal variants within the coding regions of <italic>HMGCR</italic> and <italic>PCSK9</italic>.
title: Genetic Associations of Lipid-Lowering Drugs and Parkinson’s Disease: A Mendelian Randomization Study

finding: The SNP rs10942735, also found within the <italic>HMGCR</italic> region, was identified as the leading variant associated with an increased risk of Parkinson's Disease (PD). This variant revealed a significant role in the overall risk of PD despite the lack of shared causal variants with LDL. The results suggested a specific association where rs10942735 correlated with PD while rs12916 was more closely tied to changes in LDL levels.
title: Genetic Associations of Lipid-Lowering Drugs and Parkinson’s Disease: A Mendelian Randomization Study

finding: The rs27432 SNP in the ERAP1 gene was associated with an increased risk for Birdshot Chorioretinopathy (BSCR), with an odds ratio (OR) of 2.46, 95% confidence interval (CI) 1.85-3.26, and a p-value of 4.07e-10. This SNP was demonstrated to decrease ERAP1 expression, impacting peptide trimming activity, which plays a vital role in presenting peptides to the immune system.
title: ERAP1, ERAP2, and two copies of HLA-Aw19 alleles increase the risk for Birdshot Chorioretinopathy in HLA-A29 carriers

finding: The rs10044354 SNP in the ERAP2 gene was linked to an increased risk of BSCR with an odds ratio of 1.95, 95% CI 1.55-2.44, and a p-value of 6.2e-09. The variant showed a strong association with increased ERAP2 expression, contributing to the overall risk of developing the disease.
title: ERAP1, ERAP2, and two copies of HLA-Aw19 alleles increase the risk for Birdshot Chorioretinopathy in HLA-A29 carriers

finding: The rs2248374 SNP in the ERAP2 gene was found to be protective against BSCR, with a reported odds ratio of 0.56, 95% CI 0.45-0.70, and a p-value of 2.39e-07. This SNP disrupted ERAP2 expression, leading to reduced protein levels and potentially diminishing the risk of BSCR.
title: ERAP1, ERAP2, and two copies of HLA-Aw19 alleles increase the risk for Birdshot Chorioretinopathy in HLA-A29 carriers

finding: The study established that the common genetic variant rs7705526 in the TERT promoter was associated with clonal hematopoiesis of indeterminate potential (CHIP). Variants not significantly associated with age or the rs7705526 variant were filtered out, reinforcing the credibility of the finding. This SNP thus served as a crucial control for differentiating true CHIP variants from potential artifacts. Its significant correlation with age provided insights into the epidemiological associations of CHIP outcomes.
title: A practical approach to curate clonal hematopoiesis of indeterminate potential in human genetic datasets

finding: Significant associations with anti-MCPyV IgG levels were found for rs7444313, with a P-value of 5.95e-15, and this SNP was characterized as a strong eQTL for STING1, suggesting its critical role in the immune response against MCPyV.
title: Human genomics of the humoral immune response against polyomaviruses

finding: The association of rs55792153 with MCPyV IgG levels underscored genetic variants affecting humoral responses, linking it to STING1 and the innate immune response mechanisms.
title: Human genomics of the humoral immune response against polyomaviruses

finding: This SNP, which was correlated with the expression levels of the STING1 protein, affected the immune response intensity, with implications for antiviral efficacy.
title: Human genomics of the humoral immune response against polyomaviruses

finding: The rs16891982 SNP, a missense mutation in the SLC45A2 gene, was significantly associated with retinal pigmentation. This gene encodes a membrane protein involved in the transport of solutes including tyrosine, a precursor to melanin synthesis. The SNP was linked to skin pigmentation traits and was associated with an elevated risk for cutaneous malignant melanoma. Both rs12913832 and rs16891982 reached genome-wide significance in the replication analysis.
title: Ethnicity is not biology: retinal pigment score to evaluate biological variability from ophthalmic imaging using machine learning

finding: The recipient C6 rs9200 genotype was associated with hepatocellular carcinoma recurrence after orthotopic liver transplantation in a Han Chinese population, linking it to liver cancer prognosis.
title: Identification of potential core genes in hepatoblastoma via bioinformatics analysis

finding: The SNP rs2307111 located in the POC5 gene was found to have a significant association with type 2 diabetes in the liability method, which was not detected in the binary approach, supporting findings from existing literature.
title: Genetic association studies using disease liabilities from deep neural networks

finding: Part of a super variant on Chromosome 5 associated with COVID-19 mortality (OR=1.353, p=2.87×10−8), indicating its role in susceptibility to severe disease outcomes.
title: Deep learning identified genetic variants associated with COVID-19 related mortality

finding: This SNP was part of a super variant on Chromosome 5 linked to increased risk of COVID-19 mortality (OR=1.353, p=2.87×10−8).
title: Deep learning identified genetic variants associated with COVID-19 related mortality

finding: Included in a super variant on Chromosome 5 associated with mortality from COVID-19 (OR=1.353, p=2.87×10−8). This implicates it in the genetics underlying severity of COVID-19.
title: Deep learning identified genetic variants associated with COVID-19 related mortality

finding: This SNP was part of a COVID-19 mortality risk super variant on Chromosome 5 (OR=1.353, p=2.87×10−8). Its association underlines its importance in the context of severe outcomes.
title: Deep learning identified genetic variants associated with COVID-19 related mortality

finding: Included in a super variant on Chromosome 5 associated with risk for COVID-19 related mortality (OR=1.353, p=2.87×10−8).
title: Deep learning identified genetic variants associated with COVID-19 related mortality

finding: This SNP was part of a super variant on Chromosome 5 that conferred increased mortality risk for COVID-19 (OR=1.353, p=2.87×10−8). It is linked to COVID-19 susceptibility.
title: Deep learning identified genetic variants associated with COVID-19 related mortality

finding: This SNP was reported associated with COVID-19 susceptibility and severity. It is near the TAS2R gene where significant responses to COVID-19 were observed.
title: Deep learning identified genetic variants associated with COVID-19 related mortality

finding: This SNP was part of super variant ch5_138 (OR=1.306, p=5.71×10−7) and is upstream of gene HSPA9, which affects COVID-19 immune response.
title: Deep learning identified genetic variants associated with COVID-19 related mortality

finding: This SNP displayed association with COVID-19 mortality (p=2.66×10−8) and is linked to the JAKMIP2 gene.
title: Deep learning identified genetic variants associated with COVID-19 related mortality

finding: This SNP was associated with testing positive for COVID-19, primarily through GWAS analysis, affirming the interactive role in susceptibility.
title: Deep learning identified genetic variants associated with COVID-19 related mortality

finding: The A allele of rs9687138, identified as an eQTL for ANKH, was associated with increased ANKH expression and aortic strain. This finding was aligned with known biology indicating that ANKH inhibits vascular calcification.
title: The Genetic Determinants of Aortic Distension

finding: The variant rs4449583 was identified as the shared causal variant for ovarian cancer (OC) and seborrheic keratosis, suggesting a genetic link between these conditions.
title: Phenome-wide association study of ovarian cancer identifies common comorbidities and reveals shared genetics with complex diseases and biomarkers

finding: The variant rs10069690 from the TERT locus was associated with a lower risk of seborrheic keratosis in female participants.
title: Phenome-wide association study of ovarian cancer identifies common comorbidities and reveals shared genetics with complex diseases and biomarkers

finding: The rs7705526 variant was shown to be in linkage disequilibrium (LD) with rs4449583, which is associated with OC.
title: Phenome-wide association study of ovarian cancer identifies common comorbidities and reveals shared genetics with complex diseases and biomarkers

finding: The genetic variant rs373863828 located in the CREB3 Regulatory Factor (CREBRF) was identified as an obesity-risk allele correlated with increased body mass index (BMI) in Pacific Islander individuals. Despite this association with higher BMI, the variant had a paradoxical relationship with lower odds of type 2 diabetes mellitus (T2DM). This finding contributed to understanding metabolic traits in Samoan adults and highlighted the complex interplay between genetic factors and obesity-related health outcomes.
title: Characterization of sleep apnea among a sample of adults from Samoa

finding: The SNP rs200884524, located on chromosome 5 and associated with atherogenic lipid profiles, demonstrated imputation quality ranging from r² = 0.89 to 0.95 when using reference panels that included Samoan haplotypes. Its minor allele frequency (MAF) in the imputed Samoan cohort (1,834 individuals who were not part of the reference panel) was found to be between 0.207 and 0.222, which closely aligned with the targeted genotyping results from separate cohorts of similar ancestry, indicating an expected MAF of 0.202-0.233. This finding highlighted the importance of including population-specific variants in improving imputation accuracy and suggested that existing imputation panels like TOPMed and 1000G were less effective for this specific variant.
title: Improving imputation quality in Samoans through the integration of population-specific sequences into existing reference panels

finding: Previously associated with several traits, identified again but needed cautious interpretation.
title: CADM2 is implicated in impulsive personality traits by genome- and phenome-wide association studies in humans, with further support from studies of Cadm2 mutant mice

finding: The SNP rs6868292 was identified as a lead variant in a unique locus on chromosome 5, associated with endophenotype T2:93. This association included significant impacts on brain regions such as the planum polare and subcortical structures like the pallidum, putamen, and thalamus. Previously, this SNP had not been reported in relation to any brain-related traits.
title: New phenotype discovery method by unsupervised deep representation learning empowers genetic association studies of brain imaging

finding: The A allele of rs60200309 located at the DOCK2 locus was associated with severe COVID-19, particularly in younger patients (<65 years), demonstrating a genome-wide significant p-value of 1.2 x 10^-8 with an odds ratio of 2.01 (95% CI = 1.58-2.55). This variant was prevalent in East Asians and notably higher in the Japanese population.
title: Japan COVID-19 Task Force: a nation-wide consortium to elucidate host genetics of COVID-19 pandemic in Japan

finding: This SNP was associated with decreased performance on the digit symbol coding cognitive task in a small subset of carriers, indicating its potential link to cognitive deficits in mood disorders.
title: Genome-wide significant risk loci for mood disorders in the Old Order Amish founder population

finding: This SNP was suggested to be related to processing speed, a cognitive function domain where differential methylation in CTNND2 was detected in this study. Previous studies indicated that polymorphisms in CTNND2 may influence cognitive ability.
title: Associations between DNA methylation and cognitive function in early-stage hormone receptor-positive breast cancer patients

finding: This SNP was associated with general cognitive performance in a multivariate GWAS, highlighting its relevance in cognitive function research.
title: Associations between DNA methylation and cognitive function in early-stage hormone receptor-positive breast cancer patients

finding: This SNP was linked with cognitive performance when jointly analyzed with education-related variables and personality phenotype, reinforcing its relationship with cognitive function.
title: Associations between DNA methylation and cognitive function in early-stage hormone receptor-positive breast cancer patients

finding: This SNP was associated with lung cancer at the 5p15.33 locus, identified as a low-frequency variant. It contributed to the understanding of susceptibility to lung cancer.
title: Genetic analysis of lung cancer reveals novel susceptibility loci and germline impact on somatic mutation burden

finding: Variant rs7706161 was identified as an intergenic variant associated with Raynaud's syndrome. It is closest to the IRX1 gene, which is involved in developmental processes, particularly finger development, suggesting a potential relationship between this genetic factor and the phenotype of disturbed peripheral circulation seen in RS.
title: The α2A-adrenergic receptor (ADRA2A) modulates susceptibility to Raynaud’s syndrome

finding: The SNP rs7705526-A at the TERT locus showed a positive original finding with an odds ratio (OR) of 1.26 (95% CI: 1.23-1.29), indicating an increased risk for clonal hematopoiesis of indeterminate potential (CHIP). This strong signal was consistent with previous reports.
title: Germline genomic and phenomic landscape of clonal hematopoiesis in 323,112 individuals

finding: The rs17823744 SNP was negatively associated with insulin-like growth factor 1 (IGF-1), linking it to metabolic functions.
title: New insights into the genetic etiology of 57 essential and non-essential trace elements in humans

finding: The rs117579809 SNP served as a <italic>cis</italic>-pQTL for the protein HARS1 in the CKB study, marking it as a significant finding that was not supported by data from the UKB-PPP, indicating a specific genetic influence on this protein expression in the study population.
title: Ancestry diversity in the genetic determinants of the human plasma proteome and associated new drug targets

finding: The variant rs17689879 was recognized for its impact on the classification performance metrics of TGFBI, improving accuracy in identifying significant fibrosis stages when integrated with genotype information.
title: Plasma Proteome Variation and its Genetic Determinants in Children and Adolescents

finding: This SNP participated in the significant causal associations with PCOS, linked across both central (WC, HC) and general (BMI) obesity, demonstrating its relevance in understanding obesity-related PCOS risks.
title: Both general- and central- obesity are causally associated with polycystic ovarian syndrome: Findings of a Mendelian randomization study

finding: The lead variant rs10066378:T>C, located upstream of IRF1, was associated with increased risk for critical illness and hospitalization (OR = 1.09 and 1.07, P = 2.7 × 10^-9 and 3.74 × 10^-10).
title: A second update on mapping the human genetic architecture of COVID-19

finding: The SNP rs272889 was identified as the most strongly associated variant in a genome-wide association study (GWAS) related to dietary intake patterns and the metabolite 5-aminovaleric acid betaine (5-AVAB). The finding indicated a significant association with increased intake of dairy and highlighted the involvement of the SLC22A5 gene, which encodes a transmembrane carnitine transporter, thus suggesting a potential role of carnitine homeostasis in relation to autism.
title: Unraveling the metabolomic architecture of autism in a large Danish population-based cohort

finding: The lead variant rs4704210 at the HMGCR locus was found in individuals taking HMG CoA reductase inhibitors, with an Odds Ratio (OR=1.11) and a significant p-value of 2.0×10−27.
title: A global atlas of genetic associations of 220 deep phenotypes

finding: The T allele of rs10380 in the MTRR gene was associated with an improvement in positive symptoms in patients with treatment for schizophrenia.
title: Pharmacogenomic diversity in psychiatry: Challenges and Opportunities in Africa

finding: The CRHBP variant rs10473984 was linked with treatment outcomes for citalopram, particularly in patients with anxious depression, where the T allele was associated with poorer outcomes.
title: Pharmacogenomic diversity in psychiatry: Challenges and Opportunities in Africa

finding: The rs12187334 variant was shown to affect multiple brain shape features along with white matter structures, supporting its previous findings related to brain traits.
title: Genetic influences on the shape of brain ventricular and subcortical structures

finding: Associated with neuroticism, this SNP demonstrated relevance in the realm of cognitive and psychological traits.
title: Genetic influences on the shape of brain ventricular and subcortical structures

finding: The rs2431697 SNP in the microRNA-146a gene was found to be significantly associated with an increased risk of Psoriasis Vulgaris (PsV) in a cohort of Southern Chinese subjects. The dominant model genotype (CC+CT) and allele (C) displayed notable p-values (0.019 and 0.027 respectively) and an odds ratio of 1.463 and 1.496, indicating a higher prevalence of this SNP in PsV cases compared to controls.
title: MicroRNA-146a polymorphisms are Associated with Psoriasis Vulgaris

finding: The rs2910164 SNP in the microRNA-146a gene was also significantly associated with an increased risk of PsV, exhibiting a GG genotype association with a p-value of 0.027 and an odds ratio of 1.582, in addition to significant differences in allele frequencies. This SNP's G allele was observed in 43.75% of patients and 36.90% of controls, indicating its potential role in genetic susceptibility to PsV.
title: MicroRNA-146a polymorphisms are Associated with Psoriasis Vulgaris

finding: The rs4143335 variant associated with IRF1 was noted in analyses and linked to immune response mechanisms relevant to Covid-19.
title: A year of Covid-19 GWAS results from the GRASP portal reveals potential SARS-CoV-2 modifiers

finding: The rs517339 variant was associated with ERGIC1, also prioritized as a relevant gene through regulatory effect analyses for ALS risk.
title: Common and rare variant association analyses in Amyotrophic Lateral Sclerosis identify 15 risk loci with distinct genetic architectures and neuron-specific biology

finding: The rs10463311 SNP showed associations with GPX3 and TNIP1 through SMR analyses, highlighting their potential roles in the risk of ALS.
title: Common and rare variant association analyses in Amyotrophic Lateral Sclerosis identify 15 risk loci with distinct genetic architectures and neuron-specific biology

finding: The rs12657665 SNP was associated with the ADAMTS19 protein, which plays a vital role in extracellular matrix formation and remodeling. It harbored multiple regulatory signals and eQTLs suggesting an influence on dystrophic muscular tissue, highlighting the importance of extracellular matrix interactions.
title: Candidate gene modifiers of dystrophinopathy identified by the uniform application of genome-wide datasets to novel GWAS-identified loci

finding: The SNP rs114248865 at the 5q33.2 locus was linked to greater (more positive) ΔNIHSS and indicated a potential effect of the gene GRIA1, highlighting its role in synaptic activities.
title: Multi-ancestry genetic study in 5,876 patients identifies an association between excitotoxic genes and early outcomes after acute ischemic stroke

finding: Similar to rs12328675, this SNP was also associated with circulating leptin and was part of the positive effect cluster correlating with reproductive conditions influenced by obesity.
title: The role of obesity in female reproductive conditions: A Mendelian Randomisation study

finding: The rs871269 SNP at the TNIP1 locus was newly identified as a significant risk factor for FTLD-TDP, marking it as an important locus for future exploration.
title: Deciphering Distinct Genetic Risk Factors for FTLD-TDP Pathological Subtypes via Whole-Genome Sequencing

finding: The SNP rs4150197 was associated with various traits, including anthropometric traits such as hip circumference and weight, as well as several image-derived phenotypes from diffuse MRI. This SNP was considered as a potential biomarker for glioma, particularly through its association with the gene HBEGF, which is involved in critical pathways related to cell growth and proliferation.
title: Multi-omics Mendelian randomisation using expression, splicing and protein quantitative trait loci: identification of novel drug targets for gliomagenesis

finding: The SNP rs6882088 was also recognized for its high credibility in regulatory functions among the studied SNPs, suggesting its role in influencing the relationship between blood cell metrics and cardiovascular health.
title: Unveiling Shared Genetic Links between Blood Cell Traits and Cardiovascular Diseases

finding: This variant affected protein-coding sequences and was located in a new locus linked to heart failure, marking its significance in HF genetics.
title: Common- and rare-variant genetic architecture of heart failure across the allele frequency spectrum

finding: The protein-increasing A-allele of rs351855 was associated with an increased risk for T2D (beta=0.05, p-value=1.1×10^-7). This association was related to the FGFR4 gene, implicating it in T2D-related pathways.
title: From genome to phenome via the proteome: broad capture, antibody-based proteomics to explore disease mechanisms

finding: The protein-decreasing T-allele of rs58198139 showed association with moderate effects on LDL-cholesterol (beta=0.03, p-value=7×10^-44), correlating with TIMD4's role in lipoprotein metabolism.
title: From genome to phenome via the proteome: broad capture, antibody-based proteomics to explore disease mechanisms

finding: The SNP rs57262206, noted as c.-149G>A, was identified as one of the disease-causing variants in the study related to primary carnitine deficiency (PCD). This variant was included among the pathogenic/likely pathogenic variants according to American College of Medical Genetics and Genomics (ACMG) standards, highlighting its involvement in the genetic mechanisms underlying PCD.
title: The global prevalence and genetic spectrum of primary carnitine deficiency

finding: The variant rs2731672 was linked to coagulation factor expression and was associated with several continuous traits like standing height.
title: Using human genetics to understand the causes and consequences of circulating cardiac troponin I in the general population

finding: The variant rs1801020, located in the 5' UTR of F12, showed close association with coagulation factor XII deficiency and impacted cTnI concentration.
title: Using human genetics to understand the causes and consequences of circulating cardiac troponin I in the general population

finding: In the context of colorectal cancer (CRC) metastasis, rs16889360 was discovered to be a bone-specific risk variant. Its -log10 p-value for association testing dramatically increased from 2.06 in the overall analysis to 7.97 in the bone-metastasis-specific analysis, indicating a stronger association as a result of excluding other metastatic locations.
title: Functional annotation with expression validation identifies novel metastasis-relevant genes from post-GWAS risk loci in sporadic colorectal carcinomas

finding: Located at chromosome 5q34, rs7711080 was noted to tag all stages of CRC (Stage I-IV). This SNP showed increased significance in pooled analyses indicating its relevance across various cases of metastatic CRC, further underscoring its potential as a marker for metastasis risk.
title: Functional annotation with expression validation identifies novel metastasis-relevant genes from post-GWAS risk loci in sporadic colorectal carcinomas

finding: This SNP was associated with the 5q22.3 region. It was found to have a significant MTAG-CES association (p-value=4.76x10^-7) which was more significant compared to the MEGASTROKE-CES cohort's finding (p-value=6.13x10^-3).
title: MULTITRAIT ANALYSIS EXPANDS GENETIC RISK FACTORS IN CARDIOEMBOLIC STROKE

finding: As an index SNP for NKX2-5, rs6891790 was part of the proven association for CES, yet it was not a novel finding in the context of this MTAG analysis.
title: MULTITRAIT ANALYSIS EXPANDS GENETIC RISK FACTORS IN CARDIOEMBOLIC STROKE

finding: Found at 5q35.3, the lead variant rs13153019 is located near FGFR4. It was highlighted for regulating keratinocyte proliferation in psoriasis skin, especially through its interaction with FGF19, thus indicating a significant novel association for psoriasis.
title: Genetic study of psoriasis highlights its close link with socio-economic status and affective symptoms

finding: The NRG2 variant (rs148371256) was found exclusively in the B1 NPC line and was designated as 'rare' (ExAC_SAS score of 0.0005). It was deemed 'deleterious' by three of the analysis tools employed, linking it to the abnormal cellular migration which may be involved in the pathogenesis of bipolar disorder.
title: Dysregulation in EGF/ERBB signaling pathway may explain abnormalities in cellular migration in bipolar disorder in patient-derived neural precursors

finding: The SNP rs12916 was identified as a previously validated instrument for HMGCR inhibition and was associated with a very strong eQTL for HMGCR expression in blood (p = 1.5E-36). This finding provided significant evidence for the on-target effect of statins related to cholesterol metabolism and its potential impact on depressive symptoms.
title: Statins and antidepressants induce similar in vitro gene expression responses

finding: The SNP rs17671591 was recognized as a strong eQTL (p = 2.5E-05) for HMGCR expression in the brain prefrontal cortex. Its moderate linkage disequilibrium (LD) with rs12916 (r2 = 0.6) underscored its relevance to studying the effects of statins and HMGCR inhibition in relation to depression.
title: Statins and antidepressants induce similar in vitro gene expression responses

finding: The SNP rs11748327 had previously been reported as a cis-eQTL for the gene IRX1 in skeletal muscle and was shown to be associated with RP. Higher expression of IRX1 in skeletal muscle and arterial tibial was linked to a higher risk of RP, with an OR of 1.20.
title: Genome-wide association study identifies ADRA2A and IRX1 as novel risk genes for Raynaud’s phenomenon

finding: The SNP rs1997583 at the 5q34 locus was significantly associated with febrile seizures (P = 5.48 × 10^-14, OR = 1.26). It was intronic in the GABRG2 gene, which is critical for GABA receptor function, highlighting its relation to seizure activity.
title: Genome-wide association study of febrile seizures identifies seven new loci implicating fever response and neuronal excitability genes

finding: The SNP rs2112653 was involved in five gene-tissue pairs associated with the HMGCR gene and was noted for its contribution to LDL-C. Although it was not selected under the criteria of individual PIP > 0.5, it formed part of a high CS-Pratt credible set.
title: Uncovering causal gene-tissue pairs and variants: A multivariable TWAS method controlling for infinitesimal effects

finding: The SNP rs13164128 was associated with DNA methylation changes in response to exercise duration and intensity, which was particularly relevant in the context of breast cancer-related alterations. This finding highlighted significant interactions between physical fitness and genomic expression, demonstrating the potential of exercise to influence molecular markers of health.
title: DNAmFitAge: Biological Age Indicator Incorporating Physical Fitness

finding: The variant rs7707921 was previously associated with breast cancer risk (OR for alternative A allele = 1.07, 95% CI = [1.05-1.1], p=5e-11) across two meta-analyses, indicating its significance as a candidate risk variant.
title: Mapping of cis-regulatory variants by differential allelic expression analysis identifies candidate risk variants and target genes of 27 breast cancer risk loci

finding: The variant rs3738 was identified as a strong candidate to cis-regulate RPS23, being linked to decreased expression of RPS23 mediated by hsa-miR-6813-5p binding to the 3'UTR of its transcript.
title: Mapping of cis-regulatory variants by differential allelic expression analysis identifies candidate risk variants and target genes of 27 breast cancer risk loci

finding: This variant was proposed as a risk-daeQTL for ATG10, enhancing the binding of POL2 to the ATG10 promoter, thus potentially increasing its expression.
title: Mapping of cis-regulatory variants by differential allelic expression analysis identifies candidate risk variants and target genes of 27 breast cancer risk loci

finding: The variant rs226198 was identified as impacting alternative transcription and showed preferential binding by MYC and MAX transcription factors, thus suggesting a role in enhancing RPS23 and ATP6AP1L transcript expression.
title: Mapping of cis-regulatory variants by differential allelic expression analysis identifies candidate risk variants and target genes of 27 breast cancer risk loci

finding: This SNP was implicated as a candidate risk variant impacting the shared promoter of RPS23 and ATP6AP1L, showing preferential binding by transcription factors and a potential role in their expression.
title: Mapping of cis-regulatory variants by differential allelic expression analysis identifies candidate risk variants and target genes of 27 breast cancer risk loci

finding: The rs2453763 SNP, located at chr5:92376460:T/A, was identified as a genome-wide significant locus associated with decreased risk for Tourette Syndrome (TS) in a cohort of 6,133 TS individuals. This SNP was the strongest signal in the TS-EUROTRAIN GWAS, with an odds ratio of 0.7512 and a p-value of 2.62e-08, indicating its significant role in TS susceptibility.
title: Genome-wide Association Study identifies two novel loci for Gilles de la Tourette Syndrome

finding: The AA genotype of rs1042713 (G>A) in the ADRB2 gene was associated with a protective effect against congenital malformations of the tracheobronchial tree, presenting a lower occurrence in genotype AA carriers (40% with malformations vs 11% without). It also indicated lower risk of aggravated allergy history in carriers of the A allele.
title: Association of Polymorphic Variants of HHIP, ADRB2 and IL-33 Genes with Clinical Manifestations of Bronchial Asthma in Children

finding: The rs37369 variant within the AGXT2 gene was associated with urinary and plasma 3-aminoisobutyrate levels, representing a positive finding in the context of urinary metabolites.
title: Genome-wide characterization of 54 urinary metabolites reveals molecular impact of kidney function

finding: The rs11133665 variant was associated with multiple amino acids, including tryptophan and tyrosine, and showed evidence of eQTL for the SLC6A19 gene, linking it to both metabolic and expression contexts.
title: Genome-wide characterization of 54 urinary metabolites reveals molecular impact of kidney function

finding: The SNP rs12653958 was linked to an increased risk for RP, with an OR of 1.17. It was highlighted as the lead SNP in the second strongest genomic signal and was previously reported to elevate the risk for myocardial infarction, establishing a possible connection between cardiovascular risk and RP.
title: ADRA2A and IRX1 are putative risk genes for Raynaud’s phenomenon

finding: This SNP was identified as one of the novel loci that became significant with increased sample size, contributing to the understanding of genetic pleiotropy in ocular diseases.
title: Genome-wide analysis of genetic pleiotropy and causal genes across three age-related ocular disorders

finding: The rs71636247-G variant in MSH3 was found to be associated with decreased survival in glioma patients receiving temozolomide (HR=1.93, 95% CI: 1.14-3.27, p=0.015), whereas it showed no survival effect in the non-temozolomide group.
title: The impact of germline variants in DNA repair pathways on survival and temozolomide toxicity in adults with glioma

finding: The rs146901049-A in MSH3 was linked to poor survival outcomes (HR=3.28, 95% CI: 1.70-6.33, p=0.0029), with A/G carriers having a median survival of only 4.7 years.
title: The impact of germline variants in DNA repair pathways on survival and temozolomide toxicity in adults with glioma

finding: The rs6151863-A variant in MSH3 was associated with improved survival (HR=0.67, 95% CI: 0.50-0.89, p=0.00093) for A allele carriers, who had a longer median survival of 20.5 months.
title: The impact of germline variants in DNA repair pathways on survival and temozolomide toxicity in adults with glioma

finding: The rs34799825-T SNP in MSH3 was associated with improved survival for temozolomide cases (HR=0.52, 95% CI: 0.27-1.01, p=0.053) showing a significant impact on survival.
title: The impact of germline variants in DNA repair pathways on survival and temozolomide toxicity in adults with glioma

finding: This lead SNP was associated with the A3 ("classical ASD") dimension, which is marked by enlarged cortical volume and high non-verbal cognitive performance, and it was previously linked to sex hormone-binding globulin levels.
title: Three Imaging Endophenotypes Characterize Neuroanatomical Heterogeneity of Autism Spectrum Disorder

finding: The SNP rs1173727 located near the NPR3 gene was identified as contributing to an increase in NPR3 expression, which was associated with increased blood pressure and left atrial volume maximum (LAVmax). This SNP also showed a nominally significant increase in risk of heart failure, indicating it had implications in cardiovascular health.
title: Genetic and environmental determinants of diastolic heart function

finding: The SNP rs3815768 in the ELL2 gene was found in linkage disequilibrium with the lead SNP rs3777175. It exhibited a strong association with serum IgA levels with a P-value of 2.9×10^-27.
title: Genetic regulation of serum IgA levels and susceptibility to common immune, infectious, kidney, and cardio-metabolic traits

finding: The SNP rs3777175 at the ELL2 locus associated with serum IgA levels exhibited a Beta of 0.08 and a P-value of 7.81×10^-30, indicating its potential role in the regulation of IgA production.
title: Genetic regulation of serum IgA levels and susceptibility to common immune, infectious, kidney, and cardio-metabolic traits

finding: This SNP, found within the ANKRD55 locus, exhibited significant association with IgA levels (Beta=0.07, P=1.41×10^-20), underscoring its role in immune-mediated disorders.
title: Genetic regulation of serum IgA levels and susceptibility to common immune, infectious, kidney, and cardio-metabolic traits

finding: rs115018790 was identified as a novel recessive variant associated with type 2 diabetes, having a minor allele frequency (MAF) of 0.04 and an odds ratio (OR) of 2.63 for homozygous carriers.
