This variant was linked to reduced expression of the PELO gene and was associated with significant changes in lipid levels, specifically a 10% decrease in LDL and a 20% increase in triglycerides.
title: Genome-Wide Association Meta-Analysis Using a Recessive Model Illuminates Genetic Architecture of Type 2 Diabetes

finding: rs77704739 was previously identified in the GERA cohort as a lead variant with connections to type 2 diabetes. It exhibited strong linkage disequilibrium with rs115018790 (r² = 1), confirming its relevance in the recessive model analysis for diabetes.
title: Genome-Wide Association Meta-Analysis Using a Recessive Model Illuminates Genetic Architecture of Type 2 Diabetes

finding: This low-frequency variant (MAF = 0.01) identified on chromosome 5 showed a significant association with type 2 diabetes risk (OR = 6.94). Its strong effect was corroborated by evidence of a significant dominance deviation (P = 5 × 10⁻⁹).
title: Genome-Wide Association Meta-Analysis Using a Recessive Model Illuminates Genetic Architecture of Type 2 Diabetes

finding: The rs7730971 variant was significantly associated with the inclusion of a 158 bp cryptic exon in the FBXO38 gene in whole blood, and this association was corroborated with colocalization to COPD GWAS findings. The G allele was found to be associated with increased risk of COPD and was linked to increased inclusion of the cryptic exon, which contains a premature stop codon and is likely subject to nonsense mediated decay.
title: Overlap between COPD genetic association results and transcriptional quantitative trait loci

finding: The rs10037493 variant was identified as the most significant COPD GWAS SNP in the FBXO38 locus, which was associated with shorter isoforms of FBXO38 that lack the protective F-box domain. This suggests a loss of protective function against COPD linked to this SNP.
title: Overlap between COPD genetic association results and transcriptional quantitative trait loci

finding: The SNP rs2061770, found intronic of SNX24 at the SNCAIP locus, was associated with heart rate response to exercise.
title: Deep representation learning of electrocardiogram reveals novel insights in cardiac structure and functions and connections to cardiovascular diseases

finding: Identified downstream of <italic>PCSK1</italic>, rs6899303 peaked at six months, establishing its relevance in early BMI development.
title: Characterization of the genetic architecture of BMI in infancy and early childhood reveals age-specific effects and implicates pathways involved in Mendelian obesity

finding: As a variant associated with multiple traits including fat-free body mass, rs263377 showed significance around one year, linking it to early obesity mechanisms.
title: Characterization of the genetic architecture of BMI in infancy and early childhood reveals age-specific effects and implicates pathways involved in Mendelian obesity

finding: The rare intergenic variant rs528577783 was associated with a significant risk of HGSOC, indicating its potential involvement in cancer susceptibility mechanisms.
title: Large-scale genome-wide association study of 398,238 women unveils seven novel loci associated with high-grade serous epithelial ovarian cancer risk

finding: The SNP rs7701440 was associated with schizophrenia (SCZ) through the isoform ENST00000511382 of the gene PDE4D, with an imputed fetal expression showing a significance of P = 2.4 × 10⁻⁸. This variant was located within the gene body of PDE4D, which has been implicated in previous GWAS related to SCZ risk.
title: Isoform-level transcriptome-wide association uncovers extensive novel genetic risk mechanisms for neuropsychiatric disorders in the human brain

finding: The SNP rs1756167317, located in an intron of PRR7 on chromosome 5, was associated with increased risk of IPF in females (OR 2.18) and decreased risk in males (OR 0.63). This finding was consistent with the previously undiscovered sex-specific effects on IPF susceptibility and had not been reported in earlier studies.
title: Genome-wide SNP-sex interaction analysis of susceptibility to idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis

finding: The SNP rs16891982, mapped to the SLC45A2 gene, was linked to eye colour and was also associated with the risk of chronic hepatitis, revealing a beta of -0.35 and a p-value of 2.8×10^-88. This highlighted the pleiotropic nature of certain genetic variants influencing both eye characteristics and systemic health conditions.
title: A predictive atlas of disease onset from retinal fundus photographs

finding: At the AGXT2 locus (lead SNP rs191495), a negative association with valine levels was noted, which contributes to understanding of amino acid metabolism.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide association study in 34,394 Chinese women reveals the genetic architecture of plasma metabolites during pregnancy

finding: The BHMT2 locus (lead SNP rs2909855) showed a known association with selenium levels.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide association study in 34,394 Chinese women reveals the genetic architecture of plasma metabolites during pregnancy

finding: This SNP was involved as a cis-eQTL signal for GDNF, located specifically in skeletal muscle.
title: Mapping pQTLs of circulating inflammatory proteins identifies drivers of immune-related disease risk and novel therapeutic targets

finding: The rs17057880 variant was identified specifically in males associated with POAG, elucidating its potential role in male-specific genetic risk profiles.
title: Genome-wide association meta-analysis identifies novel ancestry-specific primary open-angle glaucoma loci and shared biology with vascular mechanisms and cell proliferation

finding: The SNP rs7063 was associated with the expression level of the differentially used 3' UTR variant of the gene ERAP1, which plays a role in immune response by trimming peptides for MHC class I presentation. The minor allele of rs7063 disrupted a canonical poly(A) motif at the proximal poly(A) site, resulting in increased usage of a distal poly(A) site. This led to an isoform switch from a shorter isoform to a longer isoform with extended 3' UTR, indicating a significant link between smoking, alternative polyadenylation, and posttranscriptional modulation of gene expression.
title: Cigarette Smoking-Associated Isoform Switching and 3’ UTR Lengthening Via Alternative Polyadenylation

finding: The TT genotype of rs1065407 exhibited a significant synergistic effect on the risk of developing Behçet's disease, indicating that the presence of this allele increased the disease risk.
title: Understanding the role and adoption of artificial intelligence techniques in rheumatology research: an in-depth review of the literature

finding: The TT genotype of rs30187 demonstrated significant antagonistic effects on Behçet's disease, suggesting that this allele may decrease the susceptibility to the disease.
title: Understanding the role and adoption of artificial intelligence techniques in rheumatology research: an in-depth review of the literature

finding: The AA genotype of rs469876 was found to have significant antagonistic effects on Behçet's disease, implying that this genotype may provide some protective effects against the disease.
title: Understanding the role and adoption of artificial intelligence techniques in rheumatology research: an in-depth review of the literature

finding: Associated with ascending aortic distensibility, this SNP was located within a lncRNA (CTD-2337A12.1), which is 119 kilobases 3’ of the PCSK1 gene, linking it to cardiovascular traits.
title: GENOME-WIDE ASSOCIATIONS OF AORTIC DISTENSIBILITY SUGGEST CAUSAL RELATIONSHIPS WITH AORTIC ANEURYSMS AND BRAIN WHITE MATTER HYPERINTENSITIES

finding: This SNP, prioritized on locus 5q35.3, associated with multiple genes including COL23A1. It mapped to an eQTL and was noted for its involvement in age-dependent cognitive decline, suggesting a role in longevity mechanisms.
title: Polygenic prediction of human longevity on the supposition of pervasive pleiotropy

finding: The lead variant rs9291768 achieved a P-value of 1.48×10⁻³ and an odds ratio of 1.62, successfully replicating the previously reported association with bladder exstrophy.
title: Whole-genome sequencing reveals contribution of rare and common variation to structural kidney and urinary tract malformations

finding: The rare indel variant rs550737686 showed the strongest association at its locus with a P-value of 2.35×10⁻⁵ and an odds ratio of 6.11, indicating its potential impact in the context of bladder exstrophy.
title: Whole-genome sequencing reveals contribution of rare and common variation to structural kidney and urinary tract malformations

finding: The variant rs115201978 exhibited a high posterior probability in Bayesian fine mapping and a significant P-value of 1.28×10⁻⁴ with an odds ratio of 6.26, suggesting it may be a causal variant related to bladder exstrophy.
title: Whole-genome sequencing reveals contribution of rare and common variation to structural kidney and urinary tract malformations

finding: Included in the 18 novel SNPs that contribute to shared genetic risk for BMI and MS.
title: Investigating shared genetic architecture between obesity and multiple sclerosis

finding: The rs373863828 A allele, associated with increased body mass index (BMI), showed a statistically significant lower plasma concentration of myostatin in both human participants and mouse models. It was found to be linked to increased relative lean mass, not adiposity, thereby indicating its role in reducing the risk of type-2 diabetes (T2D) despite the associated increase in BMI. Furthermore, in young Māori and Pacific men, the A allele was related to a trend of increased lean mass (p=0.06) and a significant reduction in fat mass (p=0.031), highlighting its potential evolutionary adaptation for lean mass maintenance in these populations.
title: The minor allele of the CREBRF rs373863828 p.R457Q coding variant is associated with reduced levels of myostatin in males: Implications for body composition

finding: The study identified SNP rs2973744 in the COL23A1 gene as a significant genetic risk factor for eczema herpeticum (EH), observed in 5% of ADEH+ patients compared to 1.6% of healthy donors and 0% of ADEH- patients (p=0.034). This SNP manifested as a thymine to cytosine substitution at a splice donor site, which led to increased COL23A1 expression in keratinocytes. Higher expression levels correlated with increased susceptibility to HSV-1 infection, thus implicating this variant in the pathogenesis of EH in atopic dermatitis patients.
title: Identification and characterization of collagen XXIII alpha 1 as a novel risk factor for eczema herpeticum

finding: The association of rs1801020 in the F12 gene with activated partial thromboplastin time (APTT) was reported with a genome-wide significance level (p-value = 4.13E-16). This SNP had previously been identified in GWAS analysis from the BioBank Japan Project.
title: A Chinese host genetic study discovered type I interferons and causality of cholesterol levels and WBC counts on COVID-19 severity

finding: The lead SNP rs335189 at 5q23.2 was previously known for its association with dense area (DA) and percent density (PD). It showed significant association with V, supporting the link between breast density and texture features in mammograms.
title: A genome-wide association study of mammographic texture variation

finding: SNP rs11168036 located within the HBEGF gene on chromosome 5 showed significant association with Alzheimer's disease in stage 1 analyses, contributing to the understanding of genetic risk factors.
The missense variant rs116483731 (p.Arg20Gln) in SPDL1 was identified as having the highest PIP in non-suspicious loci related to idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis (IPF).
title: Meta-analysis fine-mapping is often miscalibrated at single-variant resolution

finding: The missense variant rs16903574 (p.Phe319Leu) in OTULINL had a high PIP and was relevant to asthma within the GBMI meta-analysis.
title: Meta-analysis fine-mapping is often miscalibrated at single-variant resolution

finding: This SNP had been previously discovered and was associated with IBD and/or PBC, and contributed to the shared genetic architecture between these conditions.
title: Rare Comorbidity between Inflammatory Bowel Disease and Primary Biliary Cholangitis: Evidence from Causality, Shared Genetic Architecture and Transcriptomics

finding: The SNP rs6889076, associated with the gene CCNO, was linked to eosinophil counts and had implications for respiratory conditions, particularly since CCNO mutations are tied to primary ciliary dyskinesia, which can manifest as obstructive lung disease in COPD cases.
title: Leveraging deep-learning on raw spirograms to improve genetic understanding and risk scoring of COPD despite noisy labels

finding: The SNP rs7705526 located at the TERT-CLPTM1L locus showed associations with various cancers including ovarian and prostate cancer, emphasizing its relevance in the broader context of gynecological malignancies in relation to FGT polyps.
title: Large-scale genome-wide association study to determine the genetic underpinnings of female genital tract polyps

finding: The variant rs2853677 was associated with clonal hematopoiesis (CH) risk at genome-wide significance (P=2.4x10^-50) and represented one of the lead variants at the 5p15.33 region, contributing to associations found with the overall CH phenotypes.
title: Genome-wide analyses of 200,453 individuals yields new insights into the causes and consequences of clonal hematopoiesis

finding: The variant rs7705526 was identified as a lead variant associated with overall CH risk, continuing to remain significant even after conditioning on three other lead variants in the 5p15.33 region, indicating its role in the predisposition to CH.
title: Genome-wide analyses of 200,453 individuals yields new insights into the causes and consequences of clonal hematopoiesis

finding: The variant rs13156167 served as one of the lead variants linked to CH at 5p15.33 and contributed to the overall genetic architecture of susceptibility to this condition.
title: Genome-wide analyses of 200,453 individuals yields new insights into the causes and consequences of clonal hematopoiesis

finding: As a new signal at 5p15.33, the variant rs2086132 was recognized as another lead variant associated with the risk of CH, enhancing the understanding of this region's involvement in CH pathogenesis.
title: Genome-wide analyses of 200,453 individuals yields new insights into the causes and consequences of clonal hematopoiesis

finding: The previously published variant rs13167280 was noted for its contribution to the risk of developing CH, playing a role in the overall genetic architecture in the 5p15.33 region.
title: Genome-wide analyses of 200,453 individuals yields new insights into the causes and consequences of clonal hematopoiesis

finding: Located approximately 776 kb from TERT, rs13356700 was identified as a fifth independent signal associated with CH at 5p15.33, indicating the complexity of genetic variants contributing to CH risk.
title: Genome-wide analyses of 200,453 individuals yields new insights into the causes and consequences of clonal hematopoiesis

finding: The variant rs10072668 was found in strong linkage disequilibrium with the variant rs13356700 at 5p15.33, relating it to hemoglobin and hypertension traits.
title: Genome-wide analyses of 200,453 individuals yields new insights into the causes and consequences of clonal hematopoiesis

finding: The variant rs2736100 at 5p15.33-<italic>TERT</italic> showed significant correlation with TET2-CH, indicating its multifaceted roles in different CH subtypes.
title: Genome-wide analyses of 200,453 individuals yields new insights into the causes and consequences of clonal hematopoiesis

finding: This previously unreported locus at 5p13.3 was associated with small clone CH and the requirement for further study in the context of related lincRNA.
title: Genome-wide analyses of 200,453 individuals yields new insights into the causes and consequences of clonal hematopoiesis

finding: At locus 5p15.33, the ncRNA intronic variant rs56397275 in LINC01511 was found to be associated with lung cancer risk, independent of prior findings in the region associated with TERT and CLPTM1L genes.
title: Trans-ethnic genome-wide meta-analysis of 35,732 cases and 34,424 controls identifies novel genomic cross-ancestry loci contributing to lung cancer susceptibility

finding: The SNP rs150464151 near KCNN2 was identified as associated with all types of lung cancer, notably squamous cell carcinoma (SQC) primarily in Asian populations, demonstrating significant ethnic-specific effects.
title: Trans-ethnic genome-wide meta-analysis of 35,732 cases and 34,424 controls identifies novel genomic cross-ancestry loci contributing to lung cancer susceptibility

finding: Associated with lung cancer risk, particularly non-small cell lung cancer, this SNP is located in ANKRD33B.
title: Trans-ethnic genome-wide meta-analysis of 35,732 cases and 34,424 controls identifies novel genomic cross-ancestry loci contributing to lung cancer susceptibility

finding: This SNP was associated with adenocarcinoma risk, highlighting genetic contributions to lung cancer.
title: Trans-ethnic genome-wide meta-analysis of 35,732 cases and 34,424 controls identifies novel genomic cross-ancestry loci contributing to lung cancer susceptibility

finding: Identified as an additional independent variant associated with lung cancer risk within the genomic region.
title: Trans-ethnic genome-wide meta-analysis of 35,732 cases and 34,424 controls identifies novel genomic cross-ancestry loci contributing to lung cancer susceptibility

finding: Located at a cancer-related locus, this SNP was associated with lung cancer alongside TERT.
title: Trans-ethnic genome-wide meta-analysis of 35,732 cases and 34,424 controls identifies novel genomic cross-ancestry loci contributing to lung cancer susceptibility

finding: Another significant SNP located near CLPTM1L, associated with increased risk of lung cancer.
title: Trans-ethnic genome-wide meta-analysis of 35,732 cases and 34,424 controls identifies novel genomic cross-ancestry loci contributing to lung cancer susceptibility

finding: The SNP rs986391, with a CADD score of 18.9 and p-value of 3.08E-14, was found in the TENM2 gene, recently implicated in smoking initiation and cessation behaviors.
title: Multi-ancestry meta-analysis of tobacco use disorder prioritizes novel candidate risk genes and reveals associations with numerous health outcomes

finding: This SNP is located in an intron of ACSL6, and was significantly associated with critical illness, though additional context on its role was not elaborated.
title: Whole genome sequencing identifies multiple loci for critical illness caused by COVID-19

finding: The rs72810983-A variant found in CPEB4 was associated with an increased risk of NMSC, with an odds ratio indicating a positive finding within the context of the study.
title: Inflammatory Bowel Disease Risk Variants Are Associated with an Increased Risk of Skin Cancer

finding: The SNP rs10040118 was associated with the presence of non-proliferating polyaneuploid cancer cells (PACCs) in the study, which indicated that these cells were statistically significant prognostic factors for metastasis-free survival. The analysis established that increasing numbers of PACCs correlated significantly with higher Gleason scores and CAPRA-S scores in a cohort of prostate cancer patients.
title: Presence of cells in the polyaneuploid cancer cell (PACC) state predicts risk of recurrence in prostate cancer

finding: The SNP rs2307111 was validated as a likely causal variant in the POC5 locus, identified through fine-mapping as part of a significant BMI association.
title: WHOLE GENOME SEQUENCING ANALYSIS OF BODY MASS INDEX IDENTIFIES NOVEL AFRICAN ANCESTRY-SPECIFIC RISK ALLELE

finding: The SNP rs871269 located in the TNIP1 gene was associated with Alzheimer's disease (AD) risk and its potential influence on hippocampal volume. The association reached suggestive genome-wide significance with a p-value of 3.7×10^-5 in the Bellenguez study, indicating its protective role in AD.
title: Identification of novel associations of candidate loci with Alzheimer’s disease by leveraging the shared genetic basis with hippocampal volume

finding: SNP rs156092 was located in the IGIP gene, which had been previously reported in relation to AD. It presented significant new association with hippocampal volume, yet no QTL effects were observed for this variant.
title: Identification of novel associations of candidate loci with Alzheimer’s disease by leveraging the shared genetic basis with hippocampal volume

finding: Although not highlighted in the primary results, SNP rs34294852 associated with TNIP1 was mentioned in context with CSF GPX3 levels influencing oxidative stress in AD, emphasizing its role in the disease progression.
title: Identification of novel associations of candidate loci with Alzheimer’s disease by leveraging the shared genetic basis with hippocampal volume

finding: The intergenic signal on chromosome 5 (rs80101740) was identified as the lead sentinel variant for ACO in the study. It had not been previously associated with asthma, COPD, or lung function. The odds ratio was 1.42 with a p-value of 3.72×10<sup>–8</sup>, indicating a significant association. Furthermore, it demonstrated the largest posterior probability in the credible set at 0.77, suggesting a high likelihood of being a true causal variant.
title: Genetic associations and architecture of asthma-chronic obstructive pulmonary disease overlap

finding: SNP rs3749833, located at the C5orf56 locus, was also identified as significantly associated with ACO, showing an odds ratio of 1.12 and a p-value of 9.37×10<sup>–12</sup>. This locus had previous associations with asthma and described phenotypic traits related to inflammation.
title: Genetic associations and architecture of asthma-chronic obstructive pulmonary disease overlap

finding: The missense variant rs16903574 in FAM105A was associated with ACO with an odds ratio of 1.20 and had a highly significant p-value of 3.8×10<sup>–10</sup>. Its deleterious impact was emphasized by its CADD score of 22.6, suggesting it could be a critical driver variant in ACO pathogenesis.
title: Genetic associations and architecture of asthma-chronic obstructive pulmonary disease overlap

finding: SNP rs1837253 was associated with ACO, with a significant odds ratio of 1.16 and a p-value of 1.53×10<sup>–18</sup>. This SNP was situated near TSLP, a gene implicated in asthma, underscoring its relevance in allergic and inflammatory pathways.
title: Genetic associations and architecture of asthma-chronic obstructive pulmonary disease overlap

finding: The SNP rs26653 was identified as a missense variant in the ERAP1 gene, changing amino acid arginine to proline. It was associated with severe PUUV infection, with a p-value of 2.93×10-8, indicating a significant genetic factor contributing to disease severity.
title: Genetic analysis implicates ERAP1 and HLA as risk factors for severe Puumala virus infection

finding: The SNP rs78408340 corresponded to the hypomorphic allele p.S539W in the PAM gene, which was associated with a 44% relative loss of glucose lowering effect when treated with GLP-1 receptor agonists. This finding indicated that carriers of this allele had decreased response to T2D medications, highlighting its role in incretin signaling.
title: Type 2 Diabetes risk alleles in Peptidyl-glycine Alpha-amidating Monooxygenase influence GLP-1 levels and response to GLP-1 Receptor Agonists

finding: The SNP rs35658696 corresponded to the hypomorphic allele p.D563G in the PAM gene, which was linked to a 20% relative loss of glucose lowering effect in response to GLP-1 receptor agonists. This result underscored the impact of this genetic variation on T2D treatment responses.
title: Type 2 Diabetes risk alleles in Peptidyl-glycine Alpha-amidating Monooxygenase influence GLP-1 levels and response to GLP-1 Receptor Agonists

finding: The genetic variant rs1472215 was found to be shared between <italic>F2R</italic> expression in blood from eQTLGen and tubulointerstitial tissue from NEPTUNE, demonstrating a high posterior probability of 89.1%. This finding suggests a potential link in the expression of <italic>F2R</italic> between these two tissue types.
title: Genetically-proxied lower PAR1 and renal phenotypes: a drug-target Mendelian Randomization study

finding: The genetic variant rs250753 showed colocalization between <italic>F2R</italic> expression in blood from GTEx and tubulointerstitial tissue from NEPTUNE, with a posterior probability of 95.4%. This indicates a strong shared genetic influence on <italic>F2R</italic> expression in these contexts.
title: Genetically-proxied lower PAR1 and renal phenotypes: a drug-target Mendelian Randomization study

finding: This SNP was associated with the ABLIM3 locus and had a p-value of 2.87×10^-14, correlated with expression changes in the macula, suggesting its role in ERM.
title: Genomewide association study of epiretinal membrane: discovery of significant risk loci in each of three American populations

finding: Involved as a proxy for rs2277066, it demonstrated significant associations with Cyclin I Family Member 2 (CCNI2) expression alterations.
title: Genomewide association study of epiretinal membrane: discovery of significant risk loci in each of three American populations

finding: Linkage to SEPT8 expression changes strengthened its relevance to retinal tissue and potential implications for ERM.
title: Genomewide association study of epiretinal membrane: discovery of significant risk loci in each of three American populations

finding: The TERT rs2853669 polymorphism was identified in 40% of the patients in the extension FFPE cohort, which included 8 PCNSL and 6 SCNSL patients. This polymorphism has been associated with increased cancer risk.
title: The genomic and transcriptional landscape of primary central nervous system lymphoma

finding: The C9 variant P167S (rs34882957) was associated with a raised risk of progression to advanced AMD, as indicated in the study results.
title: Rare Dysfunctional Complement Factor I Genetic Variants and Progression to Advanced Age-Related Macular Degeneration

finding: This SNP was identified at 5q35.2 and displayed suggestive association with any type of congenital heart defects (CHD), with a discovery p-value of 7.67×10^-8 and OR of 1.97. It remained suggestive when meta-analyzed (p=7.46×10^-7).
title: Genome-wide association studies of Down syndrome associated congenital heart defects

finding: As the lead SNP at 5q33.1, it showed a discovery p-value of 8.74×10^-7 and OR=1.98, being located approximately 1.08 Mb from HAND1.
title: Genome-wide association studies of Down syndrome associated congenital heart defects

finding: The SNP rs7705526 was associated with an increased risk for IDH<sub>wt</sub> gliomas and showed significant colocalization with blood traits like neutrophils and platelets, having a posterior probability (PP) of 0.994. This highlighted the multi-faceted role of the 5p15.33 region in glioma susceptibility.
title: Genetic predisposition to altered blood cell homeostasis is associated with glioma risk and survival

finding: The SNP rs325500 was mentioned as a significant genetic connection between PTSD and heart-related metrics.
title: Genetics of posttraumatic stress disorder and cardiovascular conditions using Life’s Essential 8, Electronic Health Records, and Heart Imaging

finding: The SNP rs75002042 was discovered in a 2017 study involving Caribbean Hispanic individuals, where it was noted as a novel and population-specific locus near FBXL7. This lead SNP had a minor allele frequency of around 20% in individuals with African ancestry, contrasting sharply with a frequency of 0.009% in individuals of European ancestry. The study also managed to replicate six loci that had been previously reported in European populations, reinforcing the significance of diverse ancestry in genetic research.
title: Assessing the lack of diversity in genetics research across neurodegenerative diseases: a systematic review of the GWAS Catalog and literature

finding: The SNP rs12522573 was classified as a novel locus associated with CBC setpoints, which enhances insights into genetic influences on blood count indices.
title: Hematologic setpoints are a stable and patient-specific deep phenotype

finding: The SNP rs10043270 was discovered as a novel locus in the analysis of CBC setpoints, contributing to the understanding of individual variations in blood count measures.
title: Hematologic setpoints are a stable and patient-specific deep phenotype

finding: The main signal rs2937516 located on chr5:18748431 between the genes LINC02100 and UBE2V1P12 was identified with a P-value of 1.62×10−8 and an odds ratio (OR) of 0.68, suggesting a protective effect against ulcerative colitis (UC). This marker was part of a locus that had been previously reported as strongly associated with UC.
title: Genome-wide analysis of individual coding variants and HLA-II-associated self-immunopeptidomes in ulcerative colitis

finding: This SNP was linked to decreased expression of IRF1, which related to increased ER-positive breast cancer risk and higher susceptibility for autoimmune diseases such as ulcerative colitis, demonstrating how IRF1 influences both cancer and immune responses.
title: Mapping inherited genetic variation with opposite effects on autoimmune disease and cancer identifies candidate drug targets associated with the anti-tumor immune response

finding: Associated with height and was fine-mapped upstream of FGFR4, though not significant in all populations.
title: Insights from complex trait fine-mapping across diverse populations

finding: This missense variant was identified in relation to height but showed partial correlation with rs244711.
title: Insights from complex trait fine-mapping across diverse populations

finding: The intronic SNP rs28363070 in the SLC6A3 gene was associated with progression to dementia in PD with a significant HR of 4.42, suggesting its relevance in cognitive impairment connected to dopamine regulation.
title: Association between the LRP1B and APOE loci and the development of Parkinson’s disease dementia

finding: This SNP was linked to hair color variations and therefore implicated in skin cancer susceptibility through pigmentation pathways.
title: A multi-phenotype analysis reveals 19 novel susceptibility loci for basal cell carcinoma and 15 for squamous cell carcinoma

finding: Variant rs4976692 was among three associated with significant protein levels across both ancestries, suggesting a role in mediating pQTLs.
title: Ancestrally diverse genome-wide association analysis highlights ancestry-specific differences in genetic regulation of plasma protein levels

finding: The SNP rs3815768-T was linked to increased serum IgA levels. This finding was significant in the context of lower multiple myeloma risk, underscoring its potential role in modifying immune response.
title: The genetics and epidemiology of N- and O- IgA glycomics

finding: Rs56219066-C was associated with lower multiple myeloma risk and linked to the ELL2 locus, which influenced secretory-specific Ig production and potentially impacted IgA N-glycan sialylation.
title: The genetics and epidemiology of N- and O- IgA glycomics

finding: The lead SNP rs11744881-T at the ELL2 locus was associated with lower IgA N-glycan sialylation. This SNP underscored the relationship between IgA levels and risk of multiple myeloma.
title: The genetics and epidemiology of N- and O- IgA glycomics

finding: SNP rs112403360 showed strong enrichment in centenarians, associated with hippocampal health and linked to reduced risk of cognitive decline, emphasizing its protective role in maintaining brain integrity.
title: Cognitively Healthy Centenarians are genetically protected against Alzheimer’s disease specifically in immune and endo-lysosomal systems

finding: The eQTL rs2927608 was associated with the gene ERAP2, with an effect size of beta = 1.06 and p = 5.60e-32. This SNP has previously been shown to predict psoriasis risk in an HLA-dependent manner.
title: Immunosuppression causes dynamic changes in expression QTLs in psoriatic skin

finding: The SNP rs4532 in the DRD1 gene was part of a cumulative dopamine genetic risk score (DGRS) that was associated with impulsive-compulsive behaviors (ICBs) in Parkinson's disease patients. Previous work indicated that lower DGRS correlated with higher incidences of ICBs as measured by the Questionnaire for Impulsive-Compulsive Disorders in Parkinson's Disease, with these behaviors decreasing over time on dopamine agonist medication.
title: Performance on the Balloon Analogue Risk Task and Anticipatory Response Inhibition Task is Associated with Severity of Impulse Control Behaviours in People with Parkinson’s Disease

finding: The VNTR variant rs28363170 in the DAT gene was analyzed as part of the genetic assessment correlating with ICB severity. It formed part of the DGRS, indicating its role in dopamine transporter function, which was associated with the regulation of ICBs under dopamine agonist treatment.
title: Performance on the Balloon Analogue Risk Task and Anticipatory Response Inhibition Task is Associated with Severity of Impulse Control Behaviours in People with Parkinson’s Disease

finding: The rs2242652-A allele was fully explained by the linked VNTR6-1-Long allele, associated with a reduced risk of bladder and prostate cancer, but has no individual functional properties.
title: Genetic regulation of TERT splicing contributes to reduced or elevated cancer risk by altering cellular longevity and replicative potential

finding: The rs10069690-T allele was shown to decrease TERT expression in Burkitt lymphoma tumors and was associated with alternative splicing that produced telomerase-nonfunctional isoforms. It was linked with an elevated risk of glioma and breast cancer but reduced risk for bladder and prostate cancer.
title: Genetic regulation of TERT splicing contributes to reduced or elevated cancer risk by altering cellular longevity and replicative potential

finding: The rs17656349 locus connected with CD74 and TNIP1 genes, with the DAP matching e-genes involved in the disease process. The finding indicated that both gene expressions were perturbed in relation to ulcerative colitis (UC) and CD.
title: Integrated cell type-specific analysis of blood and gut identifies matching eQTL for 140 IBD risk loci and entrectinib as possible repurposing candidate

finding: This SNP was associated with CD74 and IRGM gene expressions. The DAP matching e-genes suggested that their expression alterations were significant in the context of CD and UC.
title: Integrated cell type-specific analysis of blood and gut identifies matching eQTL for 140 IBD risk loci and entrectinib as possible repurposing candidate

finding: The rs10051765 SNP, an intergenic variant located approximately 6kb upstream of SLC34A1, showed a significant association with a 13.83 odds ratio for increased risk of kidney stone disease due to a 1 standard deviation decrease in serum phosphate.
title: Genetic variants predisposing to increased risk of kidney stone disease

finding: As the lead eQTL for IL5, rs7719499 was strongly associated with expression in STARNET arterial tissues and had significant implications in CAD mechanisms, particularly through its involvement in inflammatory responses.
title: Integrative multi-ancestry genetic analysis of gene regulation in coronary arteries prioritizes disease risk loci

finding: This SNP was found to be significant (p=4.4E-03) and demonstrated replication in the FinnGen cohort pertaining to tuberculosis.
title: Large Registry Based Analysis of Genetic Predisposition to Tuberculosis Identifies Genetic Risk Factors at HLA

finding: The rs2248374 SNP was associated with an increased risk of non-small cell lung cancer as suggested by prior studies, indicating its relevance in cancer pathology.
title: Pan-cancer analyses reveal genomics and clinical characteristics of the down regulated genes for recurrent myocardial infarction in cancer

finding: The rs2549782 SNP was noted for its protective haplotype against non-small cell lung cancer, highlighting its potential as a factor in cancer risk modulation.
title: Pan-cancer analyses reveal genomics and clinical characteristics of the down regulated genes for recurrent myocardial infarction in cancer

finding: The c.695G>A (R232H) variant was identified as having a loss-of-function effect, which significantly reduced the SLE risk in an autosomal recessive pattern with an odds ratio of 0.2515, indicating protective effects against SLE.
title: Role of STING/TMEM173 mutation in systemic lupus erythematosus: from animal model to intrinsic human genetics

finding: The SNP rs16891982 was associated with multiple cancer types, showing an odds ratio (OR) of 1.42 to 1.46. This missense variant was located in the SLC45A2 gene.
title: Exome-wide association studies discover germline mutation patterns and identify high-risk populations in human cancers

finding: This SNP showed strong associations with the injury/inflammation component (PC3) in males (-1.23SD, SE=0.22, p=1.7*10^-8) but did not exhibit significance in females.
title: Multivariate GWAS of Alzheimer’s disease CSF biomarker profiles implies GRIN2D in synaptic functioning

finding: The SNP rs2034244 was categorized as potentially deleterious, thus providing insight into its association with pain intensity in chronic pain conditions.
title: The genetic architecture of pain intensity in a sample of 598,339 U.S. veterans

finding: The SNP rs12916 was identified as having a high posterior probability (98.7%) for being a shared variant associated with both plasma LDL-cholesterol and gallstone disease. This finding provided strong evidence that genetic mimics of statins, which are linked to lower LDL-cholesterol levels, are associated with a reduced risk of gallstone disease.
title: Trans-biobank Mendelian randomization analyses identify opposing pathways in plasma low-density lipoprotein-cholesterol lowering and gallstone disease

finding: The rs3792783 SNP was identified at the TNIP1 locus and was associated with lower TNIP1 mRNA levels in lung tissues from patients with systemic sclerosis-associated interstitial lung disease (SSC-ILD) according to eQTL analysis in GTEx.
title: Integrative single-cell analysis of epigenomic and transcriptomic states in patients with systemic sclerosis-associated interstitial lung disease

finding: The alternative allele of rs6897932 (T) decreased the excision of the IL7R transmembrane domain, resulting in lower plasma levels of IL7R and a reduced risk of dermatitis and eczema, corroborating its association with decreased lymphocyte count and lower multiple sclerosis risk.
title: Genetic determinants of blood gene expression and splicing and their contribution to molecular phenotypes and health outcomes

finding: The rs6897932 variant was associated with splicing impacts in the IL7R transcript, influencing the production of different isoforms and linked to increased AD risk, given its protective role for eczema.
title: Triangulating molecular evidence to prioritise candidate causal genes at established atopic dermatitis loci

finding: Located in 5q15, rs114468556 had associations with cognitive performance and education, particularly affecting areas in the posterior multimodal network.
title: Genetic influences on the intrinsic and extrinsic functional organizations of the cerebral cortex

finding: The intron variant rs17421627-G in LINC00461, linked to MEF2C, was associated with increased thickness of the inner nuclear layer (INL) (Beta 0.41 SD, P=7.5x10^-193) and a significant increase in retinal vascular caliber by 3um (P=7.0x10^-16).
title: Insights into human health from phenome- and genome-wide analyses of UK Biobank retinal optical coherence tomography phenotypes

finding: The SNP rs17421627 at locus 5q14.3 was associated with significant MacTel risk (P=4.7×10^-17) and influenced retinal vascular calibre. It was linked to expression modulation of miR-9-5, highlighting its potential role in structural vascular defects.
title: Identification of genetic factors influencing metabolic dysregulation and retinal support for MacTel, a retinal disorder

finding: Located in the 5q14.3 locus, this SNP was associated with AMD risk (OR=1.16), strengthening the connection between vascular pathology in MacTel and AMD.
title: Identification of genetic factors influencing metabolic dysregulation and retinal support for MacTel, a retinal disorder

finding: The SNP rs414965 showed a strong association with lung cancer (LUNG) risk and was identified as the lead isoQTL for the isoform ENST00000511268.6 of the gene CLPTM1L. It colocalized with GWAS signals, demonstrating that isoform-level expression is critical in understanding the genetic risk for lung cancer; despite many significant SNPs in the region, gene-level associations were not detected.
title: Isoform-level analyses of 6 cancers uncover extensive genetic risk mechanisms undetected at the gene-level

finding: The SNP rs2937573 was highly significant (p= 2.58 × 10^{-43}) and was found to be intronic to the TENM2 gene, which is associated with cell adhesion and neuronal expression. It was reported in Fayzullina et al. (2015) as significantly associated with sensitivity to chewing sounds, a common symptom of misophonia.
title: Genetic evidence for the link of misophonia with psychiatric disorders and personality

finding: SNP rs2915860 was identified within the LD block of rs2937573 and was significantly associated with misophonia in the main GWAS, with a p-value of less than or equal to 1.28 × 10^{-11} and a CADD score above 15.36.
title: Genetic evidence for the link of misophonia with psychiatric disorders and personality

finding: This SNP, rs7728595, was also present in the LD block with rs2937573 and showed a significant association with misophonia (p≤1.28 × 10^{-11}; CADD>15.36) in the analysis outlined in the GWAS.
title: Genetic evidence for the link of misophonia with psychiatric disorders and personality

finding: The SNP rs2915858 was another significant finding from the main GWAS associated with misophonia (p≤1.28 × 10^{-11}; CADD>15.36), alongside rs2937573.
title: Genetic evidence for the link of misophonia with psychiatric disorders and personality

finding: SNP rs609659 at locus 5p13.2 showed a significant association with cleft lip (CL) and was identified as having the largest effect size for the CL subtype, highlighting its role as a risk factor in the development of CL.
title: Genome-wide association study of multiethnic non-syndromic orofacial cleft families identifies novel loci specific to family and phenotypic subtypes

finding: The SNP rs76067074 in the SLC6A19 gene was associated with severe COVID-19 phenotype definitions, including hospitalized COVID-19 (p=2.52E-4) and COVID-19 with very severe respiratory confirmed (p=2.65E-3), suggesting significant implications for severe cases.
title: ACE2 Netlas: In-silico functional characterization and drug-gene interactions of ACE2 gene network to understand its potential involvement in COVID-19 susceptibility

finding: The study identified the SNP rs10060180 within the gene KIAA0100, which was found to modulate cancer cell aggression behavior in the MDA-MB-231 cell line. This finding linked rs10060180 to cancer characteristics, specifically highlighting its role in modulating behavior associated with cancer cell aggressiveness.
title: Proteome-Wide Assessment of Clustering of Missense Variants in Neurodevelopmental Disorders Versus Cancer

finding: The common missense variant rs116483731 in the SPDL1 gene showed a link to IPF in the PROFILE cohort, particularly within the Finnish population, although clinical differences between carriers and non-carriers were not statistically significant.
title: Rare variants and survival of patients with idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis

finding: rs11741255 was significantly associated with ALL (P = 1.69 x 10^-4) though it was located 20kb from rs886285 and in low linkage disequilibrium, indicating it may represent a chance association.
title: Genome-wide trans-ethnic meta-analysis identifies novel susceptibility loci for childhood acute lymphoblastic leukemia

finding: This novel intronic variant in IL7R was found to be AUD-associated and is polymorphic in all populations.
title: Genetic underpinnings of the transition from alcohol consumption to alcohol use disorder: shared and unique genetic architectures in a cross-ancestry sample

finding: Identified as a common variant with both populations showing minor allele frequency of 0.44, it was linked to various cardiovascular traits, with particularly higher significance in AFR (MTAG p=3.8×10^-8) compared to EUR (p=8.3×10^-5).
title: Multitrait Genome-Wide Analysis in the UK Biobank Reveals Novel and Distinct Variants Influencing Cardiovascular Traits in Africans and Europeans

finding: Identified as associated with cardiometabolic traits, confirming its relevance.
title: Multitrait Genome-Wide Analysis in the UK Biobank Reveals Novel and Distinct Variants Influencing Cardiovascular Traits in Africans and Europeans

finding: The SNP rs2853677 was confirmed as part of the polycomb sequence class linked to repressive gene expression activity. This intronic SNP, located within the TERT region, was also associated with a maximum DIS greater than 2, highlighting its potential role in disease.
title: Novel discoveries and enhanced genomic prediction from modelling genetic risk of cancer age-at-onset

finding: The Thr164Ile variant (rs1800888) was associated with reduced lung function and also showed associations with increased eosinophil counts and various lipid measurements. Specifically, it was indicated that the minor allele was associated with increased cholesterol and reduced triglycerides and apolipoprotein A. This finding highlighted the variant's role in immune and lipid metabolism pathways.
title: The role of the ADRB2 Thr164Ile variant in lung function determination, plasma proteome variability and other phenotypes in UK Biobank

finding: The indel variant rs58970548, located in the intergenic region of NMUR2 and GRIA1, had an association with Long COVID (OR=0.94, p=4.27X10^-8), indicating potential relevance to psychiatric conditions.
title: Multi-ancestry GWAS of Long COVID identifies immune-related loci and etiological links to chronic fatigue syndrome, fibromyalgia and depression

finding: The rs1131769 variant in the DNAJC18 gene was significantly associated with oral mucositis (OM) following radiotherapy (RT) in head and neck cancer (HNC) patients. This finding suggested a role for chaperone molecules in protecting cellular proteins and indicated a genetic predisposition to OM.
title: Systematic Review of Genetic Polymorphisms Associated with Acute Pain and Relevant Acute Toxicities Induced by Radiotherapy for Head and Neck Cancer

finding: The SNP rs141408991 near KIAA0825 was identified as a novel GWS variant in non-Hispanic Whites with P=2.9×10^-8 and an odds ratio of 0.50, indicating reduced risk.
title: Multi-ancestry genome-wide meta-analysis of 56,241 individuals identifies LRRC4C, LHX5-AS1 and nominates ancestry-specific loci PTPRK, GRB14, and KIAA0825 as novel risk loci for Alzheimer’s disease: the Alzheimer’s Disease Genetics Consortium

finding: The SNP rs1878936 at the EBF1 locus (5q33.3) reached significance at a Bonferroni-corrected threshold with a p-value of 7.64x10^-4 regarding endometriosis.
title: Enhancing Genetic Association Power in Endometriosis through Unsupervised Clustering of Clinical Subtypes Identified from Electronic Health Records

finding: SNP rs77097530 was associated with BSA-indexed aortic valve regurgitation volume with a log10 p-value of 7.48, demonstrating its significance in evaluating aortic valve function.
title: Genetic architecture of cardiac dynamic flow volumes

finding: This SNP was found to have a genome-wide significant hit (p = 1.99 × 10^-8) in the analysis of the risk for developing depression, representing a significant main effect.
title: Genome-wide by environment interaction study of stressful life events and hospital-treated depression in the iPSYCH2012 sample

finding: The SNP rs549839389 was associated with an increased risk of Alzheimer disease (AD) as indicated by a statistical significance level of P=3.34×10⁻⁴. This finding related to the ADAMTS2 gene, which was noted for its differential expression between neuropathologically confirmed AD cases and cognitively resilient individuals. The findings underscored the potential relevance of ADAMTS2 in the context of AD pathology.
title: Transcriptome Signatures for Cognitive Resilience Among Individuals with Pathologically Confirmed Alzheimer Disease

finding: The SNP rs111299422 was significant in both male genome-wide analysis for CRF-vo2max and female analysis for CRF-slope; however, it exhibited evidence of heterogeneity in female assessments.
title: The genetic case for cardiorespiratory fitness as a clinical vital sign and the routine prescription of physical activity in healthcare

finding: The SNP rs11744756 was previously associated with Parkinson's disease through a meta-analysis of the PD Gene database. The analysis indicated a significant association with PD, showing a meta P-value of 9.27e-07 and an odds ratio of 1.15, with a 95% confidence interval of 1.08-1.21. This association was linked to the nucleotide excision repair gene ERCC8, suggesting that impaired DNA repair may play a role in the pathogenesis of PD.
title: Parkinson’s disease patients display a DNA damage signature in blood that is predictive of disease progression

finding: The variant rs72801474, with a MAF of 0.09, was identified as a pleiotropic variant near HSPA4. It has been implicated in previous GWAS relating to biomarkers and cardiometabolic risk factors. This SNP is situated in a candidate cis-regulatory element, indicating its potential role in gene regulation.
title: Unsupervised cardiac MRI phenotyping with 3D diffusion autoencoders reveals novel genetic insights

finding: The SNP rs12916 in the HMGCR gene was determined to have an association with hypercholesterolemia through the combined approach. This locus had been previously established in other GWAS, corroborating its importance in cholesterol metabolism.
title: Genetic association studies using disease liabilities from deep neural networks

finding: The SNP rs2736100 in the TERT gene indicated a protective association with IPF. The meta-analysis showed that the C allele conferred a lower risk for developing IPF with an OR of 0.70 (95% CI 0.61-0.79), and a stronger protective effect was observed in Asian populations compared to Europeans.
title: Genetic landscape of idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis: A systematic review, meta-analysis and epidemiological evidence of case-control studies

finding: The SNP rs104893941 was linked to Paget's disease through a p.Pro392Leu mutation in SQSTM1, showing a strong association with a P-value of 6×10^-11.
title: Leveraging large-scale multi-omics to identify therapeutic targets from genome-wide association studies

finding: The SNP rs7731626 was found within an intron of ANKRD55 and was associated with increased risk of autoimmune diseases including polymyalgia rheumatica, marking it as a new association.
title: Leveraging large-scale multi-omics to identify therapeutic targets from genome-wide association studies

finding: Identified as a novel variant related to increased risk of hospitalization; located near CCNG1, it had a MAF of 2%, OR of 1.54, and P-value of 2×10^(-8). It was also correlated with worse outcomes in hospitalized cases.
title: Common genetic variants identify therapeutic targets for COVID-19 and individuals at high risk of severe disease

finding: rs6884232 was predicted to cause a structural alteration to a functional RNA in relation to ATG10, which may have implications for breast cancer risk.
title: Mapping of cis-regulatory variants by differential allelic expression analysis identifies candidate causal variants and target genes of 41 breast cancer risk loci

finding: rs10514231 was implicated in breast cancer predisposition by decreasing the binding affinity of TCF7L2, affecting ATP6AP1L gene expression.
title: Mapping of cis-regulatory variants by differential allelic expression analysis identifies candidate causal variants and target genes of 41 breast cancer risk loci

finding: The rs28645263 locus demonstrated significant association with COVID-19 BI at genome-wide level (p=9.46e-9). It mapped to the RETREG1 gene, which plays a critical role in reticulophagy. RETREG1 was recognized as an important mediator that may inhibit SARS-CoV-2 replication, presenting a potential mechanism influencing COVID-19 BI.
title: Genome-wide association study of COVID-19 Breakthrough Infections and genetic overlap with other diseases: A study of the UK Biobank

finding: rs4307059 was replicated in studies suggesting its association with autism in a Chinese Han population. This SNP was identified through a replication of previous GWAS hits, emphasizing its relevance to the autism phenotype.
title: An unbiased de novo network analysis uncovering causal genes and the developmental intersection between autism and co-occurring traits

finding: This SNP was identified as the top colocalization sQTL associated with the adenylate cyclase gene ADCY2 in bipolar disorder, implicating splicing dysregulation mechanisms tied to cAMP signaling alterations which are targets for lithium therapy.
title: Cross-ancestry, cell-type-informed atlas of gene, isoform, and splicing regulation in the developing human brain

finding: The SNP rs2853677 was associated with an increase in genetic risk of Clonal Hematopoiesis of Indeterminate Potential (CHIP) which, in turn, was linked to reduced odds of developing Alzheimer's disease (AD), with an odds ratio of 0.92 per 1 log-odds increase in risk of CHIP, based on Mendelian randomization analysis.
title: Clonal hematopoiesis is associated with protection from Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The SNP rs7726159 showed that an increase in genetic risk of CHIP correlated with lower risks for Alzheimer's disease (AD), with findings highlighting an odds ratio of 0.92 per 1 log-odds increase in risk of CHIP, indicating a protective effect of CHIP mutations on AD.
title: Clonal hematopoiesis is associated with protection from Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The intergenic variant rs28419191 at 5q31 was significantly associated with increased risk of oral cavity cancer (OC) with an odds ratio of 1.23 (95% CI: 1.15, 1.31) and a meta-analysis p-value of 3.16×10^-10.
title: Cross-ancestral GWAS identifies 29 novel variants across Head and Neck Cancer subsites

finding: The missense variant rs1131769 in STING1 was associated with increased risk of overall HNSCC (OR: 1.13, 95% CI: 1.09, 1.18; p=2.38×10^-10) and was found to correlate with expression of CTNNA1.
title: Cross-ancestral GWAS identifies 29 novel variants across Head and Neck Cancer subsites

finding: The rare variant rs138675130 on chromosome five was identified as significantly associated with reduced circulating plasma retinol per C allele, with an effect size of -0.441 SD. This SNP was noted for its statistical significance given its low frequency in certain populations.
title: Genetic influences on circulating retinol and its relationship to human health

finding: In the analysis, rs146886108 was identified as a novel protective type 2 diabetes variant. It showed strong associations with several molecules, notably heat shock protein 90 beta (p = 1.08e-13) and glucose 6 phosphate isomerase (p = 2.04e-15). A missense variant that encodes p.Arg187Gln in ANKH, rs146886108 also demonstrated a significant correlation with random glucose levels in the UK Biobank Mendelian trait GWAS study. This association suggested a potential mechanism through which rs146886108 influenced glucose regulation.
title: Novel subgroups of type 2 diabetes based on multi-Omics profiling: an IMI-RHAPSODY Study

finding: The rs2736098 SNP showed a significant association with bladder cancer and was identified among three polymorphisms located on chromosome 5p15.3.
title: A systematic review of genome-wide association studies on bladder cancer

finding: The rs401681 SNP appeared twice within the analysis—once on chromosome 5p15.33 and again on chromosome 5p15.3—contributing to its association with bladder cancer.
title: A systematic review of genome-wide association studies on bladder cancer

finding: At the GCNT4 locus, the common A allele at the rs3761743 variant was associated with decreased HDL levels in the 'current smokers' exposure group (P=6.9×10⁻⁴), which was attenuated in the non-smoker group (Interaction P=1.5×10⁻⁵). This finding emphasized how smoking modifies the impact of the genetic variant on HDL levels.
title: Multi-omics insights into the biological mechanisms underlying gene-by-lifestyle interactions with smoking and alcohol consumption detected by genome-wide trans-ancestry meta-analysis

finding: The variant rs9312937 was discovered as a common variant associated with PCOS, located 100 kb from the TSS of the MYO10 gene, identified in the meta-analysis. It showed a p-value of 1.7 x 10^-8 and an odds ratio (OR) of 1.16, with a MAF of 0.44, suggesting its potential role in the etiology of PCOS.
title: Leveraging Northern European population history; novel low frequency variants for polycystic ovary syndrome

finding: The SNP rs2099810 was indicated to have an association with reaction time, but following the detection of unbalanced horizontal pleiotropy, it was excluded from subsequent MR analyses, suggesting it had a significant influence on the original findings regarding cognitive function.
title: Is there an association between daytime napping, cognitive function and brain volume? A Mendelian randomisation study in the UK Biobank

finding: The exonic variant rs61749613 was associated with gene VCAN and showed a significant P-value of 3.62×10^-9 in relation to heart failure. This finding emphasized the importance of VCAN in the pathology of heart failure.
title: Exploring novel risk loci for heart failure and the shared genetic etiology with blood lipids, blood pressure, and blood glucose: a large-scale multi-trait association analysis

finding: The missense variant rs116483731 in SPDL1 was associated with increased risk for IPF (odds ratio for the A allele, 3.13; P=9.97×10-16) and showed protective effects against cancer (odds ratio, 0.81; P=2.05×10-15). It conferred a considerably lower number of chromosomal alterations, indicating antagonistic pleiotropy.
title: Genetic variant in SPDL1 reveals novel mechanism linking pulmonary fibrosis risk and cancer protection

finding: The extremely rare Loss-of-Function mutation rs770066110 in TERT showed a high odds ratio (9833.99; P=9.16×10-12) associated with IPF, indicating a significant contribution to disease risk.
title: Genetic variant in SPDL1 reveals novel mechanism linking pulmonary fibrosis risk and cancer protection

finding: The rare missense mutation rs776981958 in TERT had an odds ratio of 1029.96 (P=6.53×10-21) associated with IPF, suggesting it was a significant risk factor for the disease.
title: Genetic variant in SPDL1 reveals novel mechanism linking pulmonary fibrosis risk and cancer protection

finding: The variant rs1128450, associated with <italic>FBXO38</italic>, was evidenced to significantly enhance luciferase activity in both target cell lines, suggesting a role in cancer risk.
title: Large-scale alternative polyadenylation (APA)-wide association studies to identify putative susceptibility genes in human common cancers

finding: The SNP rs7731626 was associated with a range of autoimmune phenotypes such as rheumatoid arthritis, inflammatory disease, multiple sclerosis, and type 1 diabetes. This finding contributed to the identification of novel loci related to atopic diseases.
title: Multi-ancestry Genome-Wide Association Meta-Analysis Identifies Novel Loci in Atopic Dermatitis

finding: The study identified a rare coding variant in the CHSY3 gene, specifically rs145272862, which resulted in a non-synonymous substitution (c.G1885A:p.G629R). This mutation segregated dominantly in a family affected by thumb carpometacarpal joint osteoarthritis (CMCJ OA). The finding was significant as it suggested that alterations in chondroitin sulfate proteoglycans, specifically Aggrecan (ACAN), might be a major risk factor for the disease.
title: Familial Clustering and Genetic Analysis of Severe Thumb Carpometacarpal Joint Osteoarthritis in a Large Statewide Cohort

finding: The NSD1 gene hQTL and mQTL variant rs7724386 was associated with neutrophil count and exhibited a frequency of 0.58 in UKB-EUR versus 0.26 in UKB-AFR, indicating its relevance.
title: Mapping Epigenetic Gene Variant Dynamics: Comparative Analysis of Frequency, Functional Impact and Trait Associations in African and European Populations

finding: The SNP rs4916723 was shared among all methods and had the lowest p-value, with LINC00461 as the closest gene, which has also been linked to both educational attainment and ADHD.
title: ADuLT: An efficient and robust time-to-event GWAS

finding: SNP rs115325222 was linked to several transcriptional changes, specifically upregulating TMEM161B_AS1, MEF2C, and MEF2C-AS1 while downregulating LINC00461. These alterations were relevant to schizophrenia, indicating its association with neurodevelopment and synaptic dysfunction.
title: Single-cell multi-cohort dissection of the schizophrenia transcriptome

finding: SNP rs10117 was associated with the upregulation of FAM53C and downregulation of REEP2. This relationship suggested a potential role in the transcriptional pathology observed in schizophrenia, highlighting the genetic underpinnings of this mental disorder.
title: Single-cell multi-cohort dissection of the schizophrenia transcriptome

finding: The study found that the rs373863828 genotype was significantly associated with excessive daytime sleepiness (ESS scores) in bivariate analyses, with higher ESS scores in individuals carrying more copies of the minor allele (A). However, this association did not persist in the multivariable analysis, suggesting that the effects of this genetic variant on sleep health might be confounded by other factors such as BMI and abdominal circumference.
title: Correlates of Daytime Sleepiness and Insomnia among Adults in Samoa

finding: The SNP rs1808828 was identified within the ABLIM3 gene and showed sex-specific effects on hearing loss (HL) associations, implying a regulatory role of estrogen signaling.
title: Sex differences, cross-ancestry generalizability, and noise-smoking interactions in the polygenic architecture of hearing loss in adults

finding: The SNP rs11738813, located in ARHGEF28, was associated with HL and indicated differences between sexes in its effects, also linked with the estrogen signaling pathway.
title: Sex differences, cross-ancestry generalizability, and noise-smoking interactions in the polygenic architecture of hearing loss in adults

finding: At the 5p15.2 locus, this SNP showed a suggestive significance level (OR=10.19, 95% CI: 4.12-25.21; P=5.1x10^-7) specific to AFR survivors and was associated with further replicated findings in EUR samples (OR=2.47, 95% CI: 1.23-4.98; P=0.011). This highlighted its potential role as a critical DM risk variant.
title: Trans-ancestral genetic study of diabetes mellitus risk in survivors of childhood cancer: a report from the St. Jude Lifetime Cohort and the Childhood Cancer Survivor Study

finding: The lincRNA LINC01948 was proposed as a sole potential causal gene for the POAG cross-ancestry locus rs112142644 on chromosome 5.
title: Integrating genetic regulation and single-cell expression with GWAS prioritizes causal genes and cell types for glaucoma

finding: The SNP rs200884524 was identified as a stop-gain variant in the gene BTNL9, which was significantly associated with lower high-density lipoprotein cholesterol (HDL-C) and higher triglycerides (TG) in Polynesian populations, particularly in a cohort of 2,851 Samoan adults. The meta-analysis confirmed these associations with a beta of -1.60 mg/dL for HDL-C (p = 7.63 x 10^-10) and 12.00 mg/dL for TG (p = 3.82 x 10^-7). This variant displayed high specificity to Polynesian populations, showing strong evidence of positive selection within this demographic.
title: A stop-gain variant in BTNL9 is associated with atherogenic lipid profiles

finding: The rs10078721 variant was identified as a significant GWS SNP for anxiety, showing a p-value of 4.9×10^-8 in the EUR group and a p-value of 0.009 in the AFR group, which supports its relevance in anxiety phenotypes across ancestries.
title: Gene Discovery and Biological Insights into Anxiety Disorders from a Multi-Ancestry Genome-wide Association Study of >1.2 Million Participants

finding: The SNP rs34691025 was associated with widespread pain, located within the ARHGEF28 gene on chromosome 5q13.2, and exhibited a significant p-value of 1.76 x 10^-8. This locus played a role in pain perception and sensitivity, influencing neuronal plasticity and inflammation.
title: Genome-Wide Association Study Identifies Novel Genetic Variants Associated with Widespread Pain in the UK Biobank (N=172,230)

finding: The SNP rs326153 showed a positive association with plasma OT levels (β = 0.54, p-value < 10<sup>-3</sup>), located within ADCY2, implicating it further in OT signaling.
title: Genetic and epigenetic signatures associated with plasma oxytocin levels in children and adolescents with autism spectrum disorder

finding: Variant rs1073917 near SPOCK1 showed a strong association with testosterone levels in men (β = -0.0160, P = 4.69E-08), potentially influencing androgen receptor targets affecting male fertility.
title: Genome-wide analyses identify 21 infertility loci and over 400 reproductive hormone loci across the allele frequency spectrum

finding: This SNP was connected to the TNFAIP8 gene and exhibited enhancer or promoter activity, which contributes to the understanding of its role in cartilage-related gene regulation.
title: Investigation of the genetic architecture of cam morphology, and its relationship with hip osteoarthritis, using alpha angle as a proxy measure

finding: The rs17107315 variant in SPINK1 was associated with risks of both chronic and acute pancreatitis, indicating its involvement in pancreatic diseases.
title: Genetic associations of protein-coding variants in human disease

finding: Increased risk for renal stones was found associated with the deletion in SLC34A1, supporting links to hypercalciuric conditions.
title: Genetic associations of protein-coding variants in human disease

finding: Noted as one of the four functional SNPs with strong association to hypertension. Its higher ranking by IBI compared to GWAS underscored the effectiveness of IBI in identifying relevant variants.
title: An individualized Bayesian method for estimating genomic variants of hypertension

finding: The SNP rs1867598 located in the ELOVL7 gene at the NDUFAF2 locus was previously identified through Mendelian randomization as significantly associated with the risk of Parkinson's disease (PD). It showed a high linkage disequilibrium (LD) with an independent STR signal at the same locus, with a D' statistic of 0.94, suggesting close genetic relationship and caution in interpreting the independence of risk factors.
title: Genome-wide contribution of common Short-Tandem Repeats to Parkinson’s Disease genetic risk

finding: The SNP rs4074995 was associated with lower circulating levels of FGF23 and phosphorus in adults with chronic kidney disease (CKD). Its minor allele was linked to lower prevalence of hyperparathyroidism, and it influenced RGS14 gene expression, establishing strong correlations with circulating FGF23 and PTH levels.
title: Multi-trait Analysis of GWAS for circulating FGF23 Identifies Novel Network Interactions Between HRG-HMGB1 and Cardiac Disease in CKD

finding: Rs145715205 mapped within the CDH18 gene region emerged as the most likely causal variant for the albumin excretion trajectory phenotype. This SNP also displayed suggestive associations with the latest ACR phenotype and was linked to urinary sodium excretion, making it a significant finding despite being unconfirmed in the SUMMIT dataset.
title: Genome-wide association study of longitudinal urinary albumin excretion in patients with type 1 diabetes

finding: The variant rs32137 located in the CTNND2 gene on chromosome 5 was originally found to be nominally associated with forced expiratory volume in the first second (FEV1) decline in a GWAS of asthmatics, with a p-value of 6E-06. This finding was consistent across the ancestry-specific analyses in the current study.
title: Multi-ancestry genome-wide association study reveals novel genetic signals for lung function decline

finding: The SNP rs2431697 was identified as a cell-specific enhancer associated with systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE). It was found to disrupt regulatory elements and modulate the expression of miR-146a, which contributed to the pathogenesis of SLE.
title: Global research hotspots and frontier trends of epigenetic modifications in autoimmune diseases: a bibliometric analysis from 2012 to 2022

finding: The study identified a rare germline variant, c.4666 dup A, p. Thr1556fs, corresponding to SNP rs587783031, in the APC gene of a familial Gardner's syndrome patient. This variant caused alterations in the APC-related Wnt signaling pathway, highlighting its relevance to the development of features associated with Gardner's syndrome and its complications.
title: Sc-RNA seq in familiar Gardner syndrome combined left atrial appendage fibroma reveals APC-C-MYC signaling modulates fibrotic subpopulation remodeling

finding: Located upstream of ELL2, this variant associated with lower MCH shows a significant association confirmed in the present study.
title: Whole genome sequencing association analysis of quantitative red blood cell phenotypes: the NHLBI TOPMed program

finding: The missense variant rs2652098 in the VCAN gene was associated with 12 mean diffusivity traits. It contributed significantly to the analysis, with effects ranging from -0.48 to 0.42 s.d. units. The findings highlighted the role of VCAN in neural processes relevant to pathophysiology.
title: Mapping rare protein-coding variants on multi-organ imaging traits

finding: The variant rs143368552 in VCAN, like rs2652098, was associated with multiple mean diffusivity traits, demonstrating a similar effect range and contributing to the understanding of white matter characteristics in the brain.
title: Mapping rare protein-coding variants on multi-organ imaging traits

finding: The SNP rs6862071 showed a significant association with lower stroke risk as per Mendelian randomisation findings, affirming the relationship between vitamin K1 levels and the effectiveness of warfarin.
title: An Informatics Consult approach for generating clinical evidence for treatment decisions

finding: The A allele of rs78431233 showed weak association with chondrocalcinosis in EUR (OR = 1.14), previously identified as a risk allele in earlier studies related to CPPD disease.
title: Genome-wide association study in chondrocalcinosis reveals ENPP1 as a candidate therapeutic target in calcium pyrophosphate deposition disease

finding: This SNP was associated with chondrocalcinosis after correction for multiple testing, indicating its relevance in the genetic landscape of the disease.
title: Genome-wide association study in chondrocalcinosis reveals ENPP1 as a candidate therapeutic target in calcium pyrophosphate deposition disease

finding: Identified as a significant variant in the 3' UTR associated with chondrocalcinosis, showing relevance across both AFR and EUR cohorts.
title: Genome-wide association study in chondrocalcinosis reveals ENPP1 as a candidate therapeutic target in calcium pyrophosphate deposition disease

finding: The variant rs116390453, located in the long intergenic non-coding RNA LINC01021, was associated with increased AAA prevalence, showing a p-value of 4.26 x 10^-9 and an odds ratio of 2.505.
title: Analysis of UK Biobank Cohort Reveals Novel Insights for Thoracic and Abdominal Aortic Aneurysms

finding: Identified as the most significant SNP associated with cerebellar volume. It was shown to be an eQTL for the VCAN gene, linking its expression with total brain volume outcomes.
title: Identifying genetic variants associated with cerebellar volume in 33,265 individuals from the UK-Biobank

finding: This allergy-associated SNP rs7380290 interacted with the SIK1 gene, which was shown to be upregulated after T cell activation. Notably, the accessibility of this SNP and its connectivity with the SIK1 promoter decreased upon activation.
title: Chromatin conformation dynamics during CD4+ T cell activation implicates autoimmune disease-associated genes and regulatory elements

finding: The SNP rs3846662 was identified as a top sVariant influencing splicing in exon 16 of HMGCR, which is implicated in cholesterol metabolism. This exon showed significant structural alterations, potentially disrupting a Coenzyme A binding domain, and was linked to lower blood cholesterol levels.
title: The impact of genetically controlled splicing on exon inclusion and protein structure

finding: The SNP rs144596626, located at locus CDH18, was reported to significantly manipulate brain segregation with a p-value of 2.68e-10. CDH18 is a cadherin involved in calcium-dependent adhesion and is expressed in various parts of the brain, indicating its potential relevance in neuropsychiatric disorders and Alzheimer's disease.
title: Genome-Wide Association Study of Brain Connectivity Changes for Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: The SNP rs7445264, residing in the promoter of DNAJC18, was associated with reduced H3K27ac peak heights and significantly decreased DNAJC18 gene expression.
title: Disease and phenotype relevant genetic variants identified from histone acetylomes in human hearts

finding: Findings indicated that in the RPMI-8226 cell line, which was heterozygous for the A and G alleles of the rs2736098 SNP, only the A allele was expressed. This monoallelic expression correlated with a hypomethylated status of the A allele while the G allele was methylated and repressed. The investigation highlighted the association of TERT promoter DNA methylation with inactive alleles in cancer, providing evidence that selective expression was linked to the methylation patterns of the alleles.
title: Pervasive promoter hypermethylation of silenced TERT alleles in human cancers

finding: The variant rs35329108 in the SLC6A19 gene was identified as having frequencies that significantly differed between Ukrainians and neighboring populations, and it was associated with the medical condition hyperglycinuria/iminoglycinuria.
title: Genome Diversity in Ukraine

finding: The peak variant for maximum forced expiratory volume in 1 second (FEV1 max), this globally common downstream gene variant for CCL28 had an allele frequency of 42.8% in the 1000 Genomes dataset. It also showed a nominally significant association with peak expiratory flow in European populations.
title: Whole-genome Studies of Malagasy People Uncover Novel Body Composition Associations

finding: The SNP rs6295 was associated with an interaction effect between the 5-HTTLPR variant and the HTR1A gene polymorphism, indicating its relevance in modulating the connectivity of the frontoparietal network, which is critical for cognitive processing and network communication.
title: Mapping Consistent, Reproducible, and Transcriptionally Relevant Connectome Hubs of the Human Brain

finding: This SNP was associated with a delaying effect on age at motor onset, demonstrating significant modification based on the length of a quasi-tandem hexamer repeat encoding a glutamine/alanine tract in the TCERG1 gene (p=8.9E-14 for age at motor onset).
title: Genetic modifiers of somatic expansion and clinical phenotypes in Huntington’s disease reveal shared and tissue-specific effects

finding: Identified as part of a second modifier haplotype (5BM2) in the TCERG1 locus, it provided a notable genome-wide significant association for delayed age at TFC6 (p=3.3E-08), though it did not reach significant levels for age at motor onset (p=9.3E-05).
title: Genetic modifiers of somatic expansion and clinical phenotypes in Huntington’s disease reveal shared and tissue-specific effects

finding: This variant was found in the MSH3 region, showing significant effects both in clinical and somatic expansion analyses.
title: Genetic modifiers of somatic expansion and clinical phenotypes in Huntington’s disease reveal shared and tissue-specific effects

finding: Assessed in conjunction with rs245105, it showed significant correlation with the hastening effects in the MSH3 locus.
title: Genetic modifiers of somatic expansion and clinical phenotypes in Huntington’s disease reveal shared and tissue-specific effects

finding: This SNV is paired with rs245100 in the MSH3 region and corroborates significant findings regarding clinical modification.
title: Genetic modifiers of somatic expansion and clinical phenotypes in Huntington’s disease reveal shared and tissue-specific effects

finding: Contributed significantly to the overall landscape of adjustments noted in MSH3 with substantial results.
title: Genetic modifiers of somatic expansion and clinical phenotypes in Huntington’s disease reveal shared and tissue-specific effects

finding: The lead variant rs10709981 was associated with basophil percentage of granulocytes and was found within a homopolymer repeat that positively influenced the expression of SLC36A1 across 15 tissues.
title: Multi-tissue analysis reveals short tandem repeats as ubiquitous regulators of gene expression and complex traits

finding: The SNP rs113004948 was associated with CDKL3, a gene that encodes a cyclin-dependent kinase protein. This SNP had a previously known association with eosinophil counts, which are correlated with cardiac complications. The findings confirmed that Delta ECG shares a genetic basis with CVD correlates.
title: Genetic underpinnings of predicted changes in cardiovascular function using self supervised learning

finding: SNP rs17229943 was recognized as the lead signal within the RAD17 locus by both FiniMOM and SuSiE methods. Despite being identified as a credible set, no strong signal was observed for the variants in this credible set during the replication GWAS.
title: Genetic fine-mapping from summary data using a non-local prior improves detection of multiple causal variants

finding: The SNP rs2736098 was replicated in the analysis and is recognized as a significant GWAS hit for pancreatic cancer, validating previous findings.
title: A multilayered post-GWAS assessment on genetic susceptibility to pancreatic cancer
