finding: At the SLC22A4 locus (rs35260072), associated with itch intensity from mosquito bites, the derived allele was found to be rising in frequency since around 9,000 years ago, reflecting long-term selection pressures possibly due to environmental interactions.
title: The Selection Landscape and Genetic Legacy of Ancient Eurasians

finding: The SLC45A2 locus (rs35395), associated with lighter skin pigmentation, exhibited selection beginning around 13,000 years ago, highlighting the adaptation to varying UV radiation environments.
title: The Selection Landscape and Genetic Legacy of Ancient Eurasians

finding: SNP rs4538604 was predicted to act as a trans-eQTL in stomach tissue and was located in the inflammatory bowel disease (IBD) 5 locus, previously associated with Crohn's disease. The predicted target genes included C5AR1 and others linked to colorectal cancer and IBD, indicating its potential implications in inflammatory diseases.
title: Reverse regression increases power for detecting trans-eQTLs

finding: The rs27291 G>A SNP was highlighted for creating a decrease in PTBP1 binding affinity, with the A allele being associated with an effect size of 0.672, indicative of increased exon inclusion. The findings established a clear link between this SNP and its functional outcomes in splicing regulation.
title: Profiling genetically driven alternative splicing across the Indonesian Archipelago

finding: The SNP rs10060180 was identified in the study by Zhong et al. (2018) as modulating cancer cell aggression behavior specifically in MDA-MB-231 cells, a breast cancer cell line. This finding indicated that the SNP may influence cellular mechanisms involving microtubules and heat shock proteins, which are vital for cell proliferation and behavior in cancer contexts.
title: Bridge-like lipid transfer protein family member 2 suppresses ciliogenesis

finding: rs309587 was identified as a variant associated with changes in white matter microstructure, impacting multiple tract-specific FA parameters.
title: Common genetic variation influencing human white matter microstructure

finding: The SNP C99Y involved a mutation from Cysteine to Tyrosine at position 99, which resulted in a larger mutant residue compared to the wild-type. This change was predicted to disturb interactions with other molecules or protein parts due to differences in size and hydrophobicity.
title: Insilico Analysis Reveal Three novel nsSNPs May effect on GM2A protein Leading to AB variant of GM2 gangliosidosis

finding: The SNP C112F caused a mutation from Cysteine to Phenylalanine at position 112. The wild-type residue was reported to be larger and buried within a core domain, suggesting that this SNP could negatively impact the core structure of the protein.
title: Insilico Analysis Reveal Three novel nsSNPs May effect on GM2A protein Leading to AB variant of GM2 gangliosidosis

finding: The SNP C138R involved a mutation from Cysteine to Arginine at position 138, which introduced a positive charge contrasting with the neutral charge of the original residue. This change might lead to repulsion with neighboring residues and disrupt interactions on the protein surface.
title: Insilico Analysis Reveal Three novel nsSNPs May effect on GM2A protein Leading to AB variant of GM2 gangliosidosis

finding: The SNP C138S, which was also reported at position 138, involved a mutation from Cysteine to Serine. The wild-type residue was more hydrophobic than the mutant, indicating that the mutation could result in the loss of hydrophobic interactions on the protein surface.
title: Insilico Analysis Reveal Three novel nsSNPs May effect on GM2A protein Leading to AB variant of GM2 gangliosidosis

finding: This SNP was associated with lower expression of SNHG18 in both quiescent and proliferative SMCs, highlighting its role in regulating SMC proliferation and, consequently, CAD risk.
title: Genetic regulation of human aortic smooth muscle cell gene expression and splicing predict causal coronary artery disease genes

finding: It was identified as being in an accessible chromatin region and was shown to have allelic effects in SMCs, influencing the expression of SNHG18 and contributing to CAD susceptibility.
title: Genetic regulation of human aortic smooth muscle cell gene expression and splicing predict causal coronary artery disease genes

finding: This SNP was associated with the expression regulation of SNHG18, supporting the involvement of the 5p15 CAD locus in altering SMC characteristics relevant to CAD.
title: Genetic regulation of human aortic smooth muscle cell gene expression and splicing predict causal coronary artery disease genes

finding: The study identified rs11357450, a deletion located in the TMEM232 gene, as the strongest variant associated with atopic dermatitis (AD). This finding was part of a genome-wide association study conducted among the Chinese Han population, establishing TMEM232 as a possible susceptibility gene for AD.
title: Identification of theTMEM232 gene associated with atopic dermatitis through targeted capture sequencing

finding: The SNP rs10067777 was associated with AD in previous studies, contributing to the overall association identified in the 5q22.1 region alongside several other SNPs and deletions.
title: Identification of theTMEM232 gene associated with atopic dermatitis through targeted capture sequencing

finding: The SNP rs7701890 was also found to be associated with AD, highlighting its role in the susceptibility loci identified at 5q22.1.
title: Identification of theTMEM232 gene associated with atopic dermatitis through targeted capture sequencing

finding: The SNP rs13360927 was part of the significant findings related to AD susceptibility in the 5q22.1 region, as earlier genetic studies demonstrated its connection to the disease.
title: Identification of theTMEM232 gene associated with atopic dermatitis through targeted capture sequencing

finding: The association of SNP rs13361382 with AD was reported, reinforcing the importance of variants in the 5q22.1 region in the context of atopic dermatitis.
title: Identification of theTMEM232 gene associated with atopic dermatitis through targeted capture sequencing

finding: SNP rs5870408 was linked to AD as one of the six deletions assessed in the 5q22.1 region, contributing to the understanding of genetic susceptibility to the condition.
title: Identification of theTMEM232 gene associated with atopic dermatitis through targeted capture sequencing

finding: SNP rs35639206 was found to be associated with AD, further implicating the genetic factors located in the 5q22.1 region in the disease's etiology.
title: Identification of theTMEM232 gene associated with atopic dermatitis through targeted capture sequencing

finding: The association of rs137936676 with AD was confirmed, indicating its involvement within the susceptibility loci at 5q22.1.
title: Identification of theTMEM232 gene associated with atopic dermatitis through targeted capture sequencing

finding: This SNP was also linked to structural alterations in lncRNA, contributing to disruptions in RNA-protein binding affinities.
title: Effect of Single Nucleotide Polymorphisms on the structure of long noncoding RNAs and their interaction with RNA Binding Proteins

finding: The SNP rs16891982 had the highest loadings in both Principal Component 1 (PC1) and Principal Component 2 (PC2) and ranked as the third highest loading in Principal Component 4 (PC4). This SNP is located within the skin pigmentation gene SLC45A2, which is known to be under positive selection. This observation supported the feasibility of implementing a PCA-based selection method, highlighting its significance in understanding population structure and genetic selection patterns.
title: Fast and accurate out-of-core PCA framework for large scale biobank data

finding: This SNP co-localized with a meQTL (cg15557878) associated with the TSLP gene, which is pivotal in asthma pathogenesis. The rs1837253-C risk allele was linked to hypermethylation at cg15557878, suggesting an epigenetic mechanism that contributes to both adult and childhood onset asthma.
title: Multi-omics co-localization with genome-wide association studies reveals a context-specific genetic mechanism at a childhood onset asthma risk locus

finding: The study revealed an association between the TERT promoter polymorphism rs2853669 and an increased risk of cervical cancer in South Indian women. This finding highlighted the potential role of this SNP in cancer susceptibility, linking it to the mechanisms of mutagenesis observed in adult stem cells, specifically in relation to transcription factor binding and the accumulation of mutations.
title: Enhanced C/EBPs binding to C>T mismatches facilitates fixation of CpG mutations

finding: The SNP rs2277027 was identified to be associated with the regulation of multiple genes, specifically >4 genes including ADAM19, CTB-109A12.1, CTB-47B11.3, CYFIP2, and others. This connection highlighted its role in influencing gene expression related to chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD).
title: De novo discovery of traits co-occurring with chronic obstructive pulmonary disease

finding: The allele effects of rs34417617 were found to significantly influence chromatin accessibility at the regulatory element (WRE) on chromosome 5, alongside altering the expression of CLINT1. This effect was particularly noted in response to stimulation of the Wnt pathway, indicating a potential regulatory mechanism related to brain function.
title: Wnt activity reveals context-specific genetic effects on gene regulation in neural progenitors

finding: The SNP rs889312, associated with MAP3K1 expression, was found to increase the risk of breast cancer (OR=1.1) and showed association with broader height measures, such as standing and sitting height.
title: Heritable genetic variants in key cancer genes link cancer risk with anthropometric traits

finding: The variant rs1800888 (p.Thr164Ile) in ADRB2 was linked to eosinophil counts (p=5.6×10^-6), thus showing potential immune interaction effects.
title: Medical relevance of common protein-altering variants in GPCR genes across 337,205 individuals in the UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs1042713 (p.Gly16Arg) in ADRB2 was significantly associated with immune cell counts, suggesting a role in pulmonary function.
title: Medical relevance of common protein-altering variants in GPCR genes across 337,205 individuals in the UK Biobank

finding: The association of rs1042714 in ADRB2 was noted for immune cell counts, though its significance varied in models.
title: Medical relevance of common protein-altering variants in GPCR genes across 337,205 individuals in the UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs12189429 was discussed in relation to interactions with rs6881360, presumably regulating ADAMTS12 mRNA abundance, implicating its role in AD.
title: GenEpi: Gene-based Epistasis Discovery Using Machine Learning

finding: The SNP rs6881360 was noted for its interaction with rs12189429, suggesting effects on ADAMTS12 expression relevant to Alzheimer's disease.
title: GenEpi: Gene-based Epistasis Discovery Using Machine Learning

finding: The SNP rs12187423 was also implicated in interactions with rs6881360, likely associating it with ADAMTS12 expression in the context of Alzheimer's.
title: GenEpi: Gene-based Epistasis Discovery Using Machine Learning

finding: The SNP rs12653866 was associated with the gene TNFRSF14, which plays a critical role in inflammatory responses and has been implicated in various autoimmune diseases. This variant was located within a region that showed increased accessibility in response to PHA treatment in monocytes, and its reference allele had a much higher binding score for the transcription factor EBF3 than the alternative allele.
title: Functional characterization of eQTLs and asthma risk loci with scATAC-seq across immune cell types and contexts

finding: The SNP rs373863828 was identified with a strong association to adiposity phenotypes in Native Hawaiians. This finding is significant as it was not detectable in previous GWAS due to the SNP's absence in reference panels. It was shown to have a large effect on adiposity, with a frequency of 26% in Samoans, demonstrating its importance in BMI studies.
title: Tree-based QTL mapping with expected local genetic relatedness matrices

finding: The rs373863828 allele was identified as protective against gestational diabetes mellitus in Maori and Pacific women with obesity. This finding highlighted the SNP's potential role in modulating GDM risk in specific ethnic populations.
title: Integrated bioinformatics analysis reveals novel key biomarkers and potential candidate small molecule drugs in gestational diabetes mellitus

finding: The SNP rs13184678 was identified in the context of the tumor microenvironment of esophageal adenocarcinoma. The finding indicated a correlation with specific phenotypes related to cancer-associated fibroblasts (CAFs) and their influence on disease progression in EAC, as seen in the patient-derived tumor microenvironment models.
title: Patient-Derived Tumor Organoid and Fibroblast Assembloid Models for interrogation of the tumor microenvironment in Esophageal Adenocarcinoma

finding: The SNP rs10060932 was found to be significantly associated with leaf phenology metrics. This association was based on the work by Lu et al. (2018), which compared reflectance-based indices and solar-induced chlorophyll fluorescence in relation to gross primary production (GPP)-based phenology.
title: A general model for the seasonal to decadal dynamics of leaf area

finding: The SNP rs61748181 (TERT p.A279T) featured a C>T nucleotide substitution leading to a change from alanine to threonine. It was implicated in diseases such as bone marrow failure, lung cancer, and esophageal cancer. This SNP had a relatively high minor allele frequency of 3.58%.
title: Evaluations of short telomere risk-associated single nucleotide polymorphisms in telomerase reverse transcriptase gene on telomere length maintenance

finding: The SNP rs34094720 (TERT p.H412Y) involved an amino acid change from histidine to tyrosine. It was first identified in patients with aplastic anemia and later associated with various disorders including autosomal recessive dyskeratosis congenita (DC) and idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis (IPF). While there were contrasting reports on telomerase activity, it remained consistently linked to telomere biology disorders.
title: Evaluations of short telomere risk-associated single nucleotide polymorphisms in telomerase reverse transcriptase gene on telomere length maintenance

finding: The analysis of SNP rs1056893 in gene ERAP2 revealed that Ornaments provided more accurate allele-specific read counts at the transcript level compared to WASP, which only showed results at the gene level. This indicated improved sensitivity in detecting imprinted signals with Ornaments.
title: Ornaments for Accurate and Efficient Allele-Specific Expression Estimation with Bias Correction

finding: The SNP rs1805377 impacted the natural acceptor of the XRCC4 exon 8, reducing its strength from 11.5 to 0.6 bits while simultaneously strengthening a cryptic acceptor site. This resulted in a significant decrease in the use of the original acceptor site and a 6nt deletion in the processed mRNA, showing the A/A allele is used approximately 47-fold less compared to the downstream cryptic acceptor.
title: Expression changes confirm genomic variants predicted to result in allele-specific, alternative mRNA splicing

finding: The SNP rs121434579 in the GABRA1 gene was highlighted as deleterious in the context of Epilepsy. The study found that mutations at this locus may disrupt normal synaptic signaling mechanisms related to the disorder.
title: In silico analysis of the altered protein structure and functions caused by existing synaptic gene mutations in Indian population having neurological disorders

finding: The SNP rs10060196 was associated with the autoinhibitory mechanisms of PYK2 and FAK, which are relevant in the context of cancer development. This finding highlighted the role of Pyk2 in augmenting kinase activity through conformational rearrangements that are critical in tumorigenesis.
title: Activation loop phosphorylation tunes conformational dynamics underlying Pyk2 tyrosine kinase activation

finding: The SNP rs10040118 was associated with the roles of polyploid/multinucleated giant cancer cells in metastasis and disease relapse following anticancer treatment. This finding demonstrated that polyploid cancer cells, which are relevant in the context of cancer cell resistance to genotoxic therapies, showed significant findings related to cell cycle deregulation and telomere maintenance.
title: Role of the circadian clock ‘Death-Loop’ in the DNA damage response underpinning cancer treatment resistance

finding: The SNP rs17076061 on chromosome 5q35.2 was associated with the common neurobiological substrate (CCS) at genome-wide significance. The minor allele T of this SNP was associated with smaller CCS volumes. The association was replicated in a separate cohort, reinforcing its significance across multiple studies. Despite this strong association with CCS, rs17076061 did not demonstrate a direct link to major psychiatric disorders in other published GWAS.
title: Genetic factors influencing a neurobiological substrate for psychiatric disorders

finding: This SNP was associated with SCZ, demonstrating an HMP of 1.51×10<sup>-4</sup> for CT and 1.38×10<sup>-6</sup> for SA, highlighting its relevance in psychiatric disorder linked brain structure.
title: The overlapping genetic architecture of psychiatric disorders and cortical brain structure

finding: SNP rs12054920 was implicated in the reduction in SA associated with ADHD, further emphasizing its contribution to brain morphology.
title: The overlapping genetic architecture of psychiatric disorders and cortical brain structure

finding: Linked to greater thickness in MDD, rs4437406 reflected significant genetic associations with brain structure.
title: The overlapping genetic architecture of psychiatric disorders and cortical brain structure

finding: The missense SNP rs148833559 (A/C) was associated with an increase in appendicular lean mass (ALM) in the analysis involving a large population. The minor allele (A) had the largest effect size on ALM (beta = 0.877 ± 0.13 kg). Prediction tools suggested this SNP could have a detrimental impact on STC2 protein structure, and STC2 showed expression in human skeletal muscle.
title: Genome-wide associations reveal human-mouse genetic convergence and novel modifiers of myogenesis, CPNE1 and STC2

finding: The SNP rs2853677 was identified as the most significant variant in the 5p15.33 genomic region, which is associated with a dominant pan-cancer signal. Its GWAS p-value was recorded at 8E-20, and it is located in the intronic region of the TERT gene, a known cancer predisposition gene that plays an important role in telomerase activity and cell immortality.
title: Recessive effects in cancer predisposition exposed by genome-wide and proteome-wide association studies

finding: The SNP rs13174277 was found to influence the progression of multiple myeloma in the murine model. Analysis indicated that the variants related to this SNP affected the interactions within the bone marrow micro-environment, contributing to the immune system's ability to contain the tumor.
title: Immune-mediated tumor control in the 5TGM1 transfer model of multiple myeloma

finding: This SNP was associated with activated partial thromboplastin time (aPTT), demonstrating a significant result with a P-value of 3.29×10⁻⁸³. This finding pertained to the continuous phenotype of coagulation testing.
title: Phenome-wide association study of a comprehensive health check-up database in a Korea population: Clinical application & trans-ethnic comparison

finding: Associated with prothrombin time (PT; P = 1.12×10⁻¹⁰), this splice acceptor variant indicated potential implications in coagulation processes but lacked an established disease relationship.
title: Phenome-wide association study of a comprehensive health check-up database in a Korea population: Clinical application & trans-ethnic comparison

finding: The SNP rs13163311 was associated with the estimation of global trends in nocturnal power emissions, which revealed an acceleration of light pollution. This finding related to the broader impacts of light pollution on wildlife, specifically in seabirds, which have been noted for their sensitivity to artificial light. It supports the understanding of how genetic factors may influence behavioral responses to environmental changes, such as those caused by light pollution.
title: Do seabirds dream of artificial lights? Understanding light preferences of Procellariiformes

finding: The SNP rs10514299, associated with the gene TMEM161B-MEF2C, predicted activation in the putamen during reward processing in individuals with alcohol dependence. This finding related to the understanding of neural mechanisms underlining reward systems, which are known to be altered in major depressive disorder.
title: Regional expression profiles of risk genes for depression are associated with brain activation patterns in emotion and reward tasks

finding: The intronic variant rs56345976 in the TERT gene, noted for being in modest linkage disequilibrium with variants linked to increased risks of several cancers, highlighted a connection between LOY and non-haematological cancer risk.
title: Genetic predisposition to mosaic Y chromosome loss in blood is associated with genomic instability in other tissues and susceptibility to non-haematological cancers

finding: Identified as a caQTL in all immune cell types, rs1867687 had divergent effects where the G allele increased accessibility in B cells and monocytes (B cell π=0.66, q=0.02; monocyte π=0.66, q=4.8x10^-4) while the A allele increased accessibility in CD4+ and CD8+ T cells and NK cells.
title: Mapping genetic effects on cell type-specific chromatin accessibility and annotating complex trait variants using single nucleus ATAC-seq

finding: At the rheumatoid arthritis-associated 5q11.2 locus, rs28722705 was identified as one of the candidate variants but not as a significant caQTL as rs7731626 was.
title: Mapping genetic effects on cell type-specific chromatin accessibility and annotating complex trait variants using single nucleus ATAC-seq

finding: Identified as a significant caQTL in naive CD4+ T cells, rs7731626 was associated with accessibility at the IL6ST promoter and replicated previous findings linking it to multiple sclerosis and RA.
title: Mapping genetic effects on cell type-specific chromatin accessibility and annotating complex trait variants using single nucleus ATAC-seq

finding: This SNP was identified with a z-score of 8.37 in association with the left middle frontal cortex, contributing significantly to the connectivity metrics.
title: Genetic architecture of the white matter connectome of the human brain

finding: This SNP showed significant associations with LDL levels, indicating its relevance to lipid metabolism in relation to coronary artery disease.
title: A method to map and interpret pleiotropic loci using summary statistics of multiple traits

finding: The study highlighted rs26481 as a significant cfQTL affecting the ERAP2 gene in epithelial cells, with an FDR of 5.5e-69. It was determined to be an independent signal from another marginal eQTL for ERAP2 (rs2927610) suggesting separate genetic mechanisms at play in the tumor and microenvironment.
title: A novel method to identify cell-type specific regulatory variants and their role in cancer risk

finding: The rs2617503 SNP within the GABRB2 gene was implicated in ASD risk through existing research. This was linked to the alterations in miRNA expressions, which could influence the regulation of GABRB2, critical for inhibitory brain systems.
title: Unveiling the intricacies: Investigating the impact of paternal aging on murine sperm miRNA profiles and their potential link to autism spectrum disorder

finding: The SNP rs12187676 in the GABRB2 gene was noted for its association with ASD. This finding was connected with changes in miRNA that could alter GABRB2 expression, suggesting links between paternal aging and ASD risk profiles.
title: Unveiling the intricacies: Investigating the impact of paternal aging on murine sperm miRNA profiles and their potential link to autism spectrum disorder

finding: The SNP rs34316 was identified as genome-wide significant for intelligence (IQ) and educational attainment (EA) in the largest published GWAS. It was found to be in high linkage disequilibrium (LD) with another SNP, rs254781, with an r² of 0.98, indicating they likely have similar effects on IQ and EA.
title: Genes influenced by MEF2C contribute to neurodevelopmental disease via gene expression changes that affect multiple types of cortical excitatory neurons

finding: SNP rs254781 was associated with educational attainment (EA) and intelligence (IQ) in the significant findings from GWAS. It was in high LD with rs34316 (r² = 0.98) and was noted to be located at the 3’ end and downstream region of the MEF2C gene.
title: Genes influenced by MEF2C contribute to neurodevelopmental disease via gene expression changes that affect multiple types of cortical excitatory neurons

finding: The SNP rs639725 was reported as an expression quantitative trait locus (eQTL) for MEF2C in the context of Alzheimer’s disease. It was found to be in high LD with the IQ and EA associated SNPs (r² > 0.98), and it was associated with increased expression of MEF2C, which correlated with reduced IQ and EA.
title: Genes influenced by MEF2C contribute to neurodevelopmental disease via gene expression changes that affect multiple types of cortical excitatory neurons

finding: The finding associated with rs7732130 indicated that it was part of an enhancer hub, influencing gene expression changes in ZBED3, snoRA47, ZBED3-AS1, PDE8B, and WDR41. This intronic variant was linked to glucose metabolism through pathways involving Wnt/beta catenin signaling and insulin receptor suppression. Functional evidence from a mouse knock-out model of Zbed3 reflected elevated glucose levels, supporting the role of this variant in regulating glycaemic traits like HbA1c and fasting glucose.
title: Combining functional annotation and multi-trait fine-mapping methods improves fine-mapping resolution at glycaemic trait loci

finding: This intronic variant in PDE4D was newly identified as genome-wide significant in association with retinal detachment, indicating low frequency relevance.
title: Insight into the genetic aetiology of retinal detachment by combining small clinical and large population-based datasets

finding: This SNP, found in the intergenic region of FAM170A and PRR16, was associated with lower urinary abundances of Acinetobacter johnsonii (p=4.46×10^-10) and was correlated with blood metrics such as hemoglobin content and RBC volume.
title: Unraveling the impact of host genetics and factors on the urinary microbiome in a young population

finding: The SNP rs17070145 was associated with episodic memory, particularly in individuals at the early stages of a human neurodevelopmental disorder. This finding suggested that variations in the KIBRA gene, marked by this SNP, could influence cognitive functions relevant to memory, further connecting KIBRA with its role in synaptic plasticity and hippocampal function as highlighted in the main study.
title: KIBRA Regulates AMPA Receptor Expression, Synaptic Plasticity, and Memory in an Age-Dependent Manner

finding: The study hypothesized that the FAF2:rs374702773 mutation may act as a gain of function, as previous reports indicated its association with reduced alcohol-related cirrhosis. FAF2 was shown to play a role in triglyceride metabolism and homeostasis, suggesting that this SNP could be important in risk assessment for liver disease.
title: Investigating the role of lipid genes in liver disease using fatty liver models of alcohol and high fat in zebrafish (Danio rerio)

finding: Initially suggested as a signal of selection, further analysis confirmed its relevance in the genomic landscape examined.
title: Scalable probabilistic PCA for large-scale genetic variation data

finding: This SNP was recognized as a novel signal of selection, adding depth to the genetic variation story within the populations examined.
title: Scalable probabilistic PCA for large-scale genetic variation data

finding: The V609L/V609I mutation in succinate dehydrogenase (P31040-2) was identified in the high-confidence peptide TLNEADCAT[L/I]PPAIR with 88 confident and 3 semi-confident PSMs. This mutation was previously documented in the original study.
title: Quality control of variant peptides identified through proteogenomics- catching the (un)usual suspects

finding: The SNP rs13153853 was linked to the novel MYC-regulated long noncoding RNA lncMB3, which was characterized in the study as influencing apoptosis in Group 3 medulloblastoma through its modulation of the TGF-β pathway.
title: A circuit involving the lncRNA MB3 and the driver genes MYC and OTX2 inhibits apoptosis in Group 3 Medulloblastoma by regulating the TGF-β pathway via HMGN5

finding: The SNP rs11567705-G in the IL7R gene was associated with reduced risk of multiple sclerosis. This association was observed alongside a reduction in reactive lymphocyte subpopulations in blood. The findings suggested that the mechanism may relate to changes in the soluble and membrane-bound isoforms of the IL-7 receptor, indicating a therapeutic potential.
title: Genetic Analyses of Blood Cell Structure for Biological and Pharmacological Inference

finding: This SNP was linked to Crohn's disease and showed an association with the expression of TTC33 and PTGER4, with PTGER4's largest effect size in small intestine, highlighting its relevance to the disease's pathology.
title: Genome-Wide Large-Scale Multi-Trait Analysis Characterizes Global Patterns of Pleiotropy and Unique Trait-Specific Variants

finding: This SNP was associated with prostate cancer and showed a significant expression association with the IRX4 gene across 4 tissues, with the largest effect size observed in prostate tissue.
title: Genome-Wide Large-Scale Multi-Trait Analysis Characterizes Global Patterns of Pleiotropy and Unique Trait-Specific Variants

finding: This SNP was associated with Crohn's disease and linked to the expression of IRGM, ZNF300, and RBM22, with significant effects observed in colonic tissues.
title: Genome-Wide Large-Scale Multi-Trait Analysis Characterizes Global Patterns of Pleiotropy and Unique Trait-Specific Variants

finding: The SNP rs13153751 was demonstrated to play a significant role in tumor-immune interactions and the effectiveness of checkpoint inhibitor immunotherapy. This finding stemmed from the analyses performed using the spatial quantitative systems pharmacology (spQSP) platform, as elaborated by Gong et al. (2021). The model predictions were validated against real-world data, showing a correlation with treatment outcomes in HCC patients.
title: Informing virtual clinical trials of hepatocellular carcinoma with spatial multi-omics analysis of a human neoadjuvant immunotherapy clinical trial

finding: rs157845 was recognized as one of the lead SNPs with significant interactive effects linked to obesity traits, supported by evidence from the application of aLIT.
title: Identifying latent genetic interactions in genome-wide association studies using multiple traits

finding: The splice site variant rs7724759 in the CAST gene was identified as an ASE likely driven by exon-level regulation, supporting the notion of splicing QTLs operating in an exon-specific manner.
title: Regulatory sites for known and novel splicing in human basal ganglia are enriched for disease-relevant information

finding: The SNP rs11743851 was positively identified as influencing the causal link between eosinophil count and asthma. Despite not being significant when analyzed using other methods like LCV or MR-PRESSO (p > 0.5), it was detected as significant with a strong effect, indicating a direct relationship between eosinophil count and asthma.
title: Constraint-based analysis for causal discovery in population-based biobanks

finding: The rs2431320 variant was linked with PAM expression and was identified among GWAS variants indicating metabolic regulation.
title: Shared and distinct molecular effects of regulatory genetic variants provide insight into mechanisms of distal enhancer-promoter communication

finding: The SNP rs181578390 was identified within Component #181, mapping to the 5q31 region containing a dense cluster of protocadherin genes, which are implicated in synapse-to-synapse adhesion. This SNP had a z-score of 13.95 and contributed to a multivariate signal involving a total of 137 variants in high linkage disequilibrium (LD) that collectively affected various diffusion and cortical surface area phenotypes, suggesting its role in neuropsychiatric disorders.
title: Independent Genomic Sources of Brain Structure and Function

finding: The SNP rs201493000 was highlighted as the top SNP in the multivariate signal for Component #181, being a missense variant associated with the PCDHA11 gene (classifications Q61>P). This SNP was part of a total of 137 high LD variants within the 5q31 region and also linked to neuropsychiatric disorders, reflecting its involvement in neural adhesion molecule diversity and contributing to traits related to brain structure.
title: Independent Genomic Sources of Brain Structure and Function

finding: The original finding for rs35397 indicated it was also a large effect variant, located in the SLC45A2 gene, contributing to skin pigmentation when analyzing multi-ancestry genetic variance.
title: Interpreting SNP heritability in admixed populations

finding: It was reported that rs173686, a SNP located in the VCAN gene on chromosome 5, was associated with white matter integrity in previous studies. This SNP contributed to the understanding of how white matter microstructure integrity impacted cognitive function across various participants from the UK Biobank.
title: A new Mendelian Randomization method to estimate causal effects of multivariable brain imaging exposures

finding: The SNP rs35483733, also located in the VCAN gene on chromosome 5, was found to be related to white matter integrity in prior research. This association was significant in exploring the relationship between the integrity of white matter diffusion measures and cognitive abilities.
title: A new Mendelian Randomization method to estimate causal effects of multivariable brain imaging exposures

finding: rs78483393, a SNP within the VCAN gene on chromosome 5, had been previously linked to white matter integrity. Its association was relevant in assessing the impact of white matter microstructure on cognitive function, showing its importance among the selected imaging traits.
title: A new Mendelian Randomization method to estimate causal effects of multivariable brain imaging exposures

finding: Identified as a causal SNP in the SLC45A2 gene, linked to pigmentation traits, this variant was also reported to be under selection in European populations.
title: Ohana: detecting selection in multiple populations by modelling ancestral admixture components

finding: This SNP was associated with increased ANKRD55 transcript levels in PBMCs and CD4+ T cells, linking it to IL6ST expression regulation and Th17 differentiation, which are relevant in autoimmune disorders.
title: Integration of genetic and epigenetic data pinpoints autoimmune specific remodelling of enhancer landscape in CD4+ T cells

finding: This SNP was associated with stomatal index (SI) at Duclos, indicating its relevance in the genetic architecture of stress response traits.
title: Identification and analysis of genomic regions influencing leaf morpho-physiological traits related to stress responses in Dioscorea alata

finding: Identified on Chromosome 5, this SNP explained 11.36% of the variation in leaf dry matter content (LDMC). The GA allele was associated with higher LDMC compared to the GG genotype, linking it to improved photosynthetic efficiency.
title: Identification and analysis of genomic regions influencing leaf morpho-physiological traits related to stress responses in Dioscorea alata

finding: The SNP rs304152 was identified as an ALS-associated SNP located in the intronic region of the MEF2C gene. The study demonstrated that the enhancer mutation of rs304152 reduced MEF2C expression, resulting in impaired mitochondrial function in motor neurons. The T allele showed higher transcriptional activity than the G allele, which diminished ATF4 binding and subsequently disrupted MEF2C transcription. This dysregulation was linked to mitochondrial dysfunction and oxidative stress, which are critical in ALS pathogenesis.
title: Loss of MEF2C function by enhancer mutation leads to neuronal mitochondria dysfunction and motor deficits in mice

finding: The IBD risk variant rs7731626 was found to overlap an enhancer that was active specifically in T cell subsets and fetal thymus tissue. It was demonstrated that this enhancer regulated expression of IL6ST only in a T cell line (Jurkat), indicating that this variant specifically influenced gene expression in T cells, and not in B cells or monocytic cell lines.
title: Genome-wide maps of enhancer regulation connect risk variants to disease genes

finding: SNP rs6871146 was male-specific and associated with Lactococcus, highlighting distinct gender differences in associations with gut microbiome.
title: M-GWAS for the gut microbiome in Chinese adults illuminates on complex diseases

finding: The SNP rs1050152 was identified as a favored mutation associated with immune diseases in European populations, particularly Crohn's disease, asthma, and ulcerative colitis. It was also linked to drug responses, where genotype CT correlated with a greater response to Ustekinumab in psoriasis patients compared to CC (p-value = 0.037), and genotype TT was associated with a reduced response to Imatinib in individuals, especially Europeans, with various malignancies. The deep learning network computed a DFscore of 0.815, indicating a strong selection for the T mutation.
title: PopTradeOff: a database for exploring population-specific trade-offs between adaptive evolution, disease susceptibility, and drug responsiveness

finding: The SNP rs10514231 was associated with breast cancer predisposition by altering the expression of the ATP6AP1L gene. This finding highlighted its relevance to the phenotype of breast cancer.
title: Addressing the mean-variance relationship in spatially resolved transcriptomics data with spoon

finding: The SNP rs2291418 was associated with a G-Quadruplex structure in pre-miRNA-1229, which was characterized as a factor that influences the maturation of miRNA-1229. This finding was relevant in the context of Alzheimer's disease, indicating that the variant may impact miRNA biogenesis and subsequent gene regulation related to the disease.
title: G-quadruplexes regulate miRNA biogenesis in live zebrafish embryos

finding: The rs13187817 SNP, located outside the ZNF300 gene locus on chromosome 5, was found to mediate the effects of genotype on placenta perimeter, area, and maximum diameter. Causal inference testing showed that increased DNA methylation at the ZNF300 locus was significantly associated with increased placenta area (p=0.014) and thereby influenced the association of this SNP with placental morphology.
title: Placenta DNA methylation at ZNF300 is associated with fetal sex and placental morphology

finding: Demonstrated a significant association with both ASD and TS (p = 9.42 x 10^-9, m-values indicating strong shared effect), reinforcing common genetic pathways.
title: Cross-disorder GWAS meta-analysis for Attention Deficit/Hyperactivity Disorder, Autism Spectrum Disorder, Obsessive Compulsive Disorder, and Tourette Syndrome

finding: The SNP rs111896713 was shown to partially dampen the influence of R1 as a ZNF274-dependent cis-repressor. It was discovered that R1 exerts repressive effects on gene expression at the PCDH locus, and this SNP's presence diminished that repressive action, suggesting its functional relevance.
title: Clusters of lineage-specific genes are anchored by ZNF274 in repressive perinucleolar compartments

finding: This SNP was associated with the tumor suppressor function of Thyroid Hormone Receptor Beta (TRβ), which played a critical role in tumor suppression mechanisms in solid tumors, particularly in anaplastic thyroid cancer (ATC). The selective activation of TRβ through the agonist Sobetirome (GC-1) highlighted this SNP's relevance in the context of enhancing anti-cancer therapies.
title: TRβ Agonism Induces Tumor Suppression and Enhances Drug Efficacy in Anaplastic Thyroid Cancer in Female Mice

finding: The variant rs459193 was linked to increased abdominal obesity metrics and also exhibited protective effects against type 2 diabetes across multiple measurements, highlighting a discordance between these traits.
title: Predicting mechanisms of action at genetic loci associated with discordant effects on type 2 diabetes and abdominal fat accumulation

finding: The T allele of rs6860588 was associated with protection from type 2 diabetes, in addition to increased abdominal obesity, and influenced the expression of various eGenes linked to this discordance.
title: Predicting mechanisms of action at genetic loci associated with discordant effects on type 2 diabetes and abdominal fat accumulation

finding: The SNP rs2434531 was identified as an expression quantitative trait locus (eQTL) for the gene GALNT10, indicating that the derived allele was associated with higher expression levels. This upregulation of GALNT10 was found to be directly relevant to neurological diseases, as GALNT10 was overexpressed in individuals with schizophrenia.
title: Machine-learning dissection of Human Accelerated Regions in primate neurodevelopment

finding: SNP rs11740474 was linked to schizophrenia through its association with the 2xHAR.170 region that harbors this variant. This SNP was described as being in linkage disequilibrium with 2xHAR.170, which itself was noted for its involvement with GALNT10 and variable activity implicating it as a significant enhancer relevant to schizophrenia risk.
title: Machine-learning dissection of Human Accelerated Regions in primate neurodevelopment

finding: The SNP rs4073476 was strongly associated with standing height in the UK Biobank cohort, with a nominal p-value less than 10^-8. This finding replicated earlier studies that also indicated a link between this SNP and height, thus confirming its relevance to this phenotype.
title: Sex-specific phenotypic effects and evolutionary history of an ancient deletion polymorphism of the human growth hormone receptor

finding: The variant rs2549794 in the ERAP2 gene was associated with positive selection linked to the Black Death pandemic in northern Europe, with the strength of selection estimated at approximately 0.017. The age of selection was suggested to have occurred around 2,000 years ago, coinciding with significant historical plague events.
title: Deep estimation of the intensity and timing of selection from ancient genomes

finding: The splice region SNP rs2248374, which controls ERAP2 expression, showed signals of positive selection. The analysis indicated recent selection likely starting around 2,000 years ago, in line with historical disease pressures.
title: Deep estimation of the intensity and timing of selection from ancient genomes

finding: The SNP rs13184682 was found to have a significant association with MYC modulation. The study highlighted that this SNP was linked to the activity of the MYC-dependent cluster of epigenetic repressors, which are crucial in regulating the expression of pyruvate carboxylase (PC). Increased expression of PC was associated with metabolic dependencies observed in various cancers, implicating the role of rs13184682 in the context of glutamine addiction in tumors.
title: FBXW7 alleviates c-MYC repression of pyruvate carboxylase to support metabolic flexibility

finding: The SNP rs3747479 exhibited an extremely high probability of >99.9% of being an eQTL in both tumor and normal tissues. This finding contributed to the understanding of susceptibility loci in relation to complex phenotypes.
title: Primo: integration of multiple GWAS and omics QTL summary statistics for elucidation of molecular mechanisms of trait-associated SNPs and detection of pleiotropy in complex traits

finding: Similar to rs11552449 and rs3747479, SNP rs73134739 also presented an extremely high probability of >99.9% of being an eQTL in both tumor and normal tissues, highlighting its potential role in susceptibility to complex traits.
title: Primo: integration of multiple GWAS and omics QTL summary statistics for elucidation of molecular mechanisms of trait-associated SNPs and detection of pleiotropy in complex traits

finding: The SNP rs10040093 was associated with the role of Activator Protein-1 (AP-1) family members in CD30-positive lymphomas. Original findings demonstrated its relevance to this specific type of lymphoma, indicating potential implications in tumor biology and cellular signaling pathways.
title: SifiNet: A robust and accurate method to identify feature gene sets and annotate cells

finding: The SNP rs56235845, located at chr5:177371039 T/G, was significantly associated with the contribution to overall promoter activity for the decomposed promoters of the gene RGS14. Specifically, it showed strong associations with decomposed promoters 1 and 2, demonstrated by frQTL beta values of 0.210 and -0.181, respectively, suggesting its role in modulating expression variability of these promoters. Its limited association with decomposed promoter 3 nonetheless reflected a notable overall effect on promoter activity, evidenced by a prQTL beta of -2.47.
title: Promoter sequence and architecture determine expression variability and confer robustness to genetic variants

finding: An association was detected between the SNP rs159497 in the human gene Pde4d and forced expiratory volume in one second. This finding was significant with a p-value of 5E-8, highlighting a connection between variants in this gene and environmental exposures. The study referenced this association as part of the broader research into the cannabinoid response, indicating its relevance to the effects observed with THC in the context of heritability and drug response traits.
title: Genetic modulation of initial sensitivity to Δ9-tetrahydrocannabinol (THC) among the BXD family of mice

finding: The study reported that the SNP rs4415084 was identified as a breast cancer-associated genetic variant. The integrative genomic analysis suggested that this variant played a significant role in possible cis-regulatory mechanisms affecting gene expression, thereby contributing to tumor development.
title: Transcription Factor-Centric Approach to Identify Non-Recurring Putative Regulatory Drivers in Cancer

finding: The study found that rs2227282, located 6-bp upstream of the differentially methylated CpG-3 site within the IL4 gene, acted as a cis-eQTL influencing the transcript levels of several genes including PDLIM4, SLC22A4, SLC22A5, RAD50, IL4, KIF3A, and SEPT8 in peripheral blood monocytes. It was also associated with allergic diseases in GWAS.
title: A Differentially Methylated CpG Site in the IL4 Gene Associated with Anti-FVIII Inhibitor Antibody Development in Hemophilia A

finding: The SNP rs13164244 correlated with protective effects on intestinal tissues observed during FLASH proton therapy. The study showed that F-PRT reduced fibrosis and collagen deposition, linking the SNP with reduced normal tissue toxicity.
title: FLASH proton reirradiation, with or without hypofractionation, mitigates chronic toxicity in the normal murine intestine, skin, and bone

finding: The SNP rs2112347 was associated with COL4A3BP, which was scored as a 'positive hit' in the screen.
title: A multi-component screen for feeding behaviour and nutritional status in Drosophila to interrogate mammalian appetite-related genes

finding: The SNP rs1801020 was shown to modulate the liver expression of the coagulation factor XII (F12) gene, affecting F12 protein abundance. This association was replicated in the TwinGene cohort, demonstrating its impact on the severity of aPTT, confirming its importance in hemostasis.
title: Facets of individual-specific health signatures determined from longitudinal plasma proteome profiling

finding: A GWAS peak SNP for non-small cell lung cancer, this SNP showed specific ASM in GBMs and disrupted transcription factor motifs important in cancer progression.
title: Allele-specific DNA methylation is increased in cancers and its dense mapping in normal plus neoplastic cells increases the yield of disease-associated regulatory SNPs

finding: This SNP co-localized with GWAS peaks and was identified in ASM regions correlated with GBM, further implicating it in cancer-related transcriptional regulation.
title: Allele-specific DNA methylation is increased in cancers and its dense mapping in normal plus neoplastic cells increases the yield of disease-associated regulatory SNPs

finding: The lead variant rs28473516 was identified as having a posterior probability of >99% for being causal for both gene expression and isoform usage of B4GALT7, indicating shared eQTL signals for this gene and its associated isoform.
title: Fine mapping spatiotemporal mechanisms of genetic variants underlying cardiac traits and disease

finding: The lead eVariant rs2549009 was highlighted for IRF1 and its antisense RNA IRF1-AS1, indicating a shared eQTL signal potentially playing a role in cardiac remodeling.
title: Fine mapping spatiotemporal mechanisms of genetic variants underlying cardiac traits and disease

finding: The SNP rs2291702 at the AGXT2 locus was found to significantly influence AGXT2 expression in a genotype-dependent manner among NAFLD patients, showing a much lower expression in CC homozygous individuals compared to no-NAFLD subjects with the same genotype. The finding was corroborated with a combined P-value of 3.69 × 10⁻¹² from NAFLD patients and controls. The study demonstrated that AGXT2 expression correlated with clinical features of NAFLD and that knockdown of AGXT2 exacerbated liver conditions in mice, highlighting its role in NAFLD progression.
title: Disease-specific eQTL screening reveals an anti-fibrotic effect of AGXT2 in nonalcoholic fatty liver disease

finding: The SNP rs6897932, located in exon 6 of the interleukin-7 receptor-α gene (IL7R), was associated with increased skipping of exon 6 due to the strengthening of an exonic splicing silencer (ESS). This alternative splicing led to heightened production of soluble IL7R (sIL7R), which was identified as exacerbating the symptoms in models of multiple sclerosis (MS), specifically in the context of experimental autoimmune encephalomyelitis (EAE). The findings underscored the role of rs6897932 in MS susceptibility through its effects on IL7R transcript processing.
title: The RNA helicase DDX39B activates FOXP3 RNA splicing to control T regulatory cell fate

finding: The SNP rs13164148 was associated with PD-L1 overexpression, which characterized the cancer-dependent exhaustion of persistently activated CD4+ T cells, as described by Jancewicz et al. (2021). This finding highlighted the role of PD-L1 in immune evasion in melanoma.
title: Dynamical modelling of proliferative-invasive plasticity and IFNγ signaling in melanoma reveals mechanisms of PD-L1 expression heterogeneity

finding: The SNP rs13174250 was linked to transcriptional reprogramming and constitutive expression of PD-L1 in melanoma, associated with dedifferentiation and activation of interferon and tumor necrosis factor signaling pathways, as reported by Ahn et al. (2021). This study underscored the relevance of immune response in melanoma progression.
title: Dynamical modelling of proliferative-invasive plasticity and IFNγ signaling in melanoma reveals mechanisms of PD-L1 expression heterogeneity

finding: The SNP rs467095 was identified as an expression quantitative trait locus for TERT and CLPTM1L, and it was found to be inversely associated with lung cancer risk. This finding was part of a larger investigation into genetic variants associated with oral cavity/pharyngeal cancer risk.
title: Cross-Cancer Evaluation of Polygenic Risk Scores for 17 Cancer Types in Two Large Cohorts

finding: The SNP rs10462706 also served as an expression quantitative trait locus for TERT and CLPTM1L, showing an inverse association with lung cancer risk. This association underscored the genetic interplay between oral cavity/pharyngeal cancer and lung cancer.
title: Cross-Cancer Evaluation of Polygenic Risk Scores for 17 Cancer Types in Two Large Cohorts

finding: The SNP rs401681 (part of the CLPTM1L region) was associated with cervical cancer risk and confirmed previous suggestive associations, representing a novel risk variant in the context of cross-cancer analysis.
title: Cross-Cancer Evaluation of Polygenic Risk Scores for 17 Cancer Types in Two Large Cohorts

finding: The SNP rs114285050, a stop-gain variant in GPR151, was found to significantly contribute to obesity-related traits, exhibiting a strong association with waist circumference (beta = -0.065, p = 2.5 × 10^-8), whole-body fat mass (beta = -0.069, p = 1.4 × 10^-7), and trunk fat mass (beta = -0.071, p = 1.5 × 10^-7) in a phenome-wide association study. Heterozygous carriers showed a lower Body Mass Index (BMI) of 0.324 kg/m² compared to the average UK Biobank participant (p = 4.13 x 10^-7).
title: Components of genetic associations across 2,138 phenotypes in the UK Biobank highlight novel adipocyte biology

finding: The SNP rs254372 was located within the OPA1 gene, known to be under selection in the Fescue Belt ecoregion and implicated in metabolic adaptations. Its association reflects ongoing selection processes in cattle populations, particularly in response to environmental challenges associated with fescue.
title: Powerful detection of polygenic selection and environmental adaptation in US beef cattle populations

finding: The SNP rs6889822 was associated with the expression of SPINK9, showing low expression levels but higher abundance in brain tissue compared to others. The associations (LIBD dataset minimum p=0.0002; CMC dataset p=8.99 × 10^-7) support its role in MI phenotypes.
title: The genomic basis of mood instability: identification of 46 loci in 363,705 UK Biobank participants, genetic correlation with psychiatric disorders, and association with gene expression and function

finding: The C allele of rs13168867 was associated with decreased OSM receptor (OSMR) expression and increased overall plaque vulnerability (β=0.118, p=3.00×10⁻³), suggesting a genetic influence on plaque characteristics. This SNP was linked to increased intraplaque fat and decreased collagen content, positing reduced OSM signaling as a factor in plaque vulnerability.
title: Common variants associated with OSMR expression contribute to carotid plaque vulnerability, but not to cardiovascular disease in humans

finding: This missense variant located in the ADRB2 gene was associated with EHR-OSA in VUMC (beta=-0.07, p=2.71x10^-2).
title: Characterization of Genetic and Phenotypic Heterogeneity of Obstructive Sleep Apnea Using Electronic Health Records

finding: The SNP rs61160187 was linked to educational attainment, showing a significant causal association with the gene ERCC8 (P_MR=1.05×10^-13), which is previously connected to the monogenic Cockayne Syndrome A.
title: Mendelian Randomization integrating GWAS and eQTL data reveals genetic determinants of complex and clinical traits

finding: The study indicated that rs60311862 was highly associated with cognitive-related traits, with a p-value of 6.00E-6, showing that it is a cis-regulated genetic polymorphism in the human hippocampus.
title: Systems genetics identifies the association between Enc1 and cognitive function in the hippocampus

finding: The SNP rs76662990 demonstrated significant association with age-related cognitive changes, with a reported p-value of 8.00E-6, implicating its role in cognitive function.
title: Systems genetics identifies the association between Enc1 and cognitive function in the hippocampus

finding: This SNP, rs298387, was linked to both the PHF-tau measurement phenotype and the neurofibrillary tangles measurement phenotype, with significant p-values of 3E-8 and 1.00E-12 respectively, indicating its relevance to cognitive impairment.
title: Systems genetics identifies the association between Enc1 and cognitive function in the hippocampus

finding: The study provided insights into the PI3K pathway and its activity in human cancers, particularly focusing on pancreatic cancer where the mutational pattern of the PI3K pathway was analyzed. The specific SNP rs10060174 was identified in this context, providing a roadmap for understanding how different isoform-selective PI3K inhibitors could affect treatment outcomes, such as sensitivity to therapies and adaptive signaling responses. The findings underscored the importance of considering patient-specific genetic variations when developing combinative treatments for improved response rates.
title: Phosphoproteomics identifies PI3K inhibitor-selective adaptive responses in pancreatic cancer cell therapy and resistance

finding: The minor allele of rs7704909, along with rs12518194 and rs4307059, was significantly associated with autism spectrum disorder (ASD). These risk variants were observed to synergistically enhance the expression of the lncRNA MSNP1AS, which exhibited high enrichment in the postmortem cerebral cortex of ASD patients and contributed to the dysregulation of neuronal architecture by inhibiting the production of moesin.
title: Genetic regulation of lncRNA expression in the whole human brain

finding: Similar to rs7704909, the minor allele of rs12518194 was also associated with autism spectrum disorder (ASD). In conjunction with rs7704909 and rs4307059, it contributed to the upregulation of the lncRNA MSNP1AS in the cerebral cortex of ASD patients, affecting neuronal architecture through inhibition of moesin production.
title: Genetic regulation of lncRNA expression in the whole human brain

finding: The minor allele of rs4307059, along with the other two variants, was found to be significantly associated with autism spectrum disorder (ASD). Its presence contributed to the expression of the lncRNA MSNP1AS, resulting in pathological effects on neuronal architecture due to the inhibition of moesin production.
title: Genetic regulation of lncRNA expression in the whole human brain

finding: The study referenced SNP rs13153839 in relation to the pro-coagulatory activity of extracellular vesicles (EVs) in patients with coronary artery disease (CAD). The EVs from these patients displayed elevated thrombin generation capabilities, which could potentially be linked to coagulation factors that include the effects of rs13153839. The proteomic analysis of arterial-derived EVs identified several coagulation-associated proteins, suggesting that genetic factors like rs13153839 may contribute to the risk of cardiovascular events in CAD patients.
title: Extracellular vesicles from patients with coronary artery disease (CAD) demonstrate enhanced pro-coagulatory activity

finding: The derived allele of rs373863828 in the CREBRF gene was significantly associated with multiple adiposity traits in Native Hawaiians, with a notable impact on body mass index (BMI), exhibiting a standardized effect of 0.214 s.d. per allele (P = 7.55e-5) and explaining 0.52% of the phenotypic variance in BMI. The variant was found to increase risk for obesity (OR=1.096, P = 9.52E-5) and demonstrated a protective effect against type 2 diabetes (T2D, OR=0.935, P = 0.0162). Despite being monomorphic in other populations studied, this variant had a derived allele frequency of 5.9% in Native Hawaiians.
title: Population specific reference panels are crucial for the genetic analyses of Native Hawai’ians: an example of the CREBRF locus

finding: The SNP rs26279 was found to be associated with an increased risk for cancer, suggesting its role in the pathogenesis of certain malignancies. This finding was highlighted in a meta-analysis conducted by Miao et al. in 2015, indicating that polymorphisms in the MSH3 gene, such as rs26279, might contribute to cancer susceptibility.
title: Msh2-Msh3 DNA-binding is not sufficient to promote trinucleotide repeat expansions in Saccharomyces cerevisiae

finding: The SNP rs17622517, located in an intron of C5ORF56 and identified as a risk variant for autoimmune diseases, was found to enhance the expression of the transcription factor IRF1 under early immune stimulus conditions. This common genetic variant was demonstrated to regulate the expression of IRF1 in cis, which subsequently influenced numerous trans-eQTLs, particularly during late LPS stimulation. The study provided evidence that rs17622517 functions as an enhancer affecting immune response gene expression, reconciling the SNP as a causal variant linked to inflammatory bowel diseases and various autoimmune conditions.
title: An autoimmune disease risk variant has a trans master regulatory effect mediated by IRF1 under immune stimulation

finding: The polymorphism rs2853669 at the -245 bp position from the ATG site within the proximal promoter of the TERT gene was noted for modulating the effect of mutations on disease outcomes in different cancers. The variant allele disrupted a preexisting non-canonical ETS site adjacent to an E-box in the proximal region, impacting TERT transcription regulation.
title: Occurrence, functionality, and abundance of the TERT promoter mutations

finding: The SNP rs2069885 resulted in a T117M point mutation in human IL-9 and showed associations with asthma exacerbation, laryngeal squamous cell carcinoma (LSCC), gender-specific effects on lung function, cystic fibrosis, and RSV infections in infants. Despite being the most prevalent missense SNP in hIL-9 with an allele frequency of 0.11, it did not impact the kinetics or affinity of receptor binding in the formation of the binary or ternary complex, as the mutation was found to be situated far from the hIL-9Rα interface.
title: Structural basis for the mechanism and antagonism of receptor signaling mediated by Interleukin-9 (IL-9)

finding: The SNP rs35395 in the SLC45A2 gene was associated with lighter skin pigmentation. The analysis indicated that this derived allele was under strong selection approximately 2500 to 5000 years ago, consistent with selective pressures related to vitamin D synthesis in higher latitudes.
title: Fast and accurate estimation of selection coefficients and allele histories from ancient and modern DNA

finding: The variant rs736801 was associated with breast cancer risk at sub genome-wide significance levels (P = 8 x 10^-8) in large breast cancer GWAS. Molecular analyses indicated that the risk allele of rs736801 reduced expression of the IRF1 gene. This reduction in IRF1 expression negatively impacted T cell-mediated cytotoxicity against breast cancer cells, thereby influencing immune interactions.
title: Pooled genetic screens identify breast cancer risk genes involved in evasion from T cell-mediated killing

finding: Although specific details about rs11242115 were not directly linked to independent findings, it was shown to be in strong linkage disequilibrium (r^2 = 1) with rs736801. Its role as part of the risk haplotype linked to reduced IRF1 promoter activity indicates that it plays a significant part in breast cancer susceptibility.
title: Pooled genetic screens identify breast cancer risk genes involved in evasion from T cell-mediated killing

finding: Similar to rs11242115, rs10900809 was noted to be in strong linkage disequilibrium (r^2 = 1) with rs736801. It was included in the analysis of the risk haplotype affecting IRF1 promoter activity, suggesting a contribution to altered immune response in breast cancer.
title: Pooled genetic screens identify breast cancer risk genes involved in evasion from T cell-mediated killing

finding: The SNP rs10040537 was associated with land surface cover classification in urban domestic gardens, contributing to understanding how garden attributes can influence insect biodiversity. This was investigated in the context of urban green spaces and their management to support insect communities.
title: Vegetation density is the main driver of insect species richness and diversity in small private urban front gardens

finding: The SNP rs11950533 was identified as the index variant for a PD risk locus associated with multiple genes in the context of a study on dopaminergic neurons. The association was confirmed through scRNA-seq expression data, indicating a significant correlation between rs11950533 genotype and the expression of the gene CAMLG. This suggests that CAMLG might play a role in the molecular pathways affected in Parkinson's disease.
title: The Foundational data initiative for Parkinson’s disease (FOUNDIN-PD): enabling efficient translation from genetic maps to mechanism

finding: rs2282810, residing in CDX1, was associated with the regulatory functions affecting the SLC6A7 gene expression via an A-to-I RNA editing event in AD patients. This association indicated the variant could act as a biomarker for neurodegeneration linked to neurotransmitter recovery processes.
title: Genetic control of RNA editing in Neurodegenerative disease

finding: The expression QTL rs887343 in association with rs2282810 and its effect on SLC6A7 highlighted potential regulation mechanisms between RNA editing QTLs affecting neurodegenerative disease by altering gene expressions.
title: Genetic control of RNA editing in Neurodegenerative disease

finding: This RNA editing QTL was involved, along with rs2282810, in regulating expressions of SLC6A7, demonstrating its influence on RNA editing events and potential implications for neurodegenerative disease.
title: Genetic control of RNA editing in Neurodegenerative disease

finding: This QTL emerged as significant for the expressions of RPL13 and its relationship with RNA editing, suggesting its potential impact on neurodegenerative pathways.
title: Genetic control of RNA editing in Neurodegenerative disease

finding: The SNP rs187653 was shown to disrupt ARNT2 binding motifs. This finding related to the ASC gene signatures and its relationship with Schizophrenia, indicating that it may affect the molecular mechanisms underlying this neuropsychiatric condition.
title: Age-specific gene signatures underlying the transcriptomes and functional connectomes of human cerebral cortex

finding: The SNP rs2237077 was previously found to reach genome-wide significance in relation to white matter connectivity, specifically associated with forceps minor (FA), projection fibres (FA), and global FA measures. This indicates its potential relevance in the genetic understanding of white matter tract integrity.
title: Expression quantitative trait loci-derived scores and white matter microstructure in UK Biobank: a novel approach to integrating genetics and neuroimaging

finding: The study identified rs116171826 as a rare variant with a significant role in Alzheimer's disease (AD) pathobiology, showing a correlation between under-expression outliers in RNA and protein signals, which highlighted genes already linked to AD.
title: The functional impact of rare variation across the regulatory cascade

finding: Similar to rs116171826, rs149274963 was found to be part of the joint under-expression outliers in RNA and protein signals related to Alzheimer's disease, supporting its impact on AD pathobiology.
title: The functional impact of rare variation across the regulatory cascade

finding: rs10071918 was also associated with Alzheimer's disease (AD), as it was identified alongside other outlier variants, suggesting a relevant functional role in AD.
title: The functional impact of rare variation across the regulatory cascade

finding: The SNP rs2563297, located at chr5:140,097,072, was found to produce significant SMR colocalization results for 11 gene-tissue pairs representing 7 unique genes, including 5 protocadherin alpha (PCDHA) genes linked to brain cell-cell connections and the NDUFA2 gene associated with Leigh syndrome. This SNP was previously associated with schizophrenia, depressive symptoms, neuroticism, educational attainment, intelligence, and blood pressure, indicating it is a highly pleiotropic locus.
title: Identifying loci with different allele frequencies among cases of eight psychiatric disorders using CC-GWAS

finding: The SNP rs875741 was associated with mean corpuscular volume (MCV), highlighting its role in influencing hematological phenotypes. The research demonstrated that this locus had a significant correlation with the CPEB4 gene, particularly through changes in chromatin accessibility during erythroid differentiation.
title: Transcription factor networks disproportionately enrich for heritability of blood cell phenotypes

finding: Similarly, SNP rs875742 was analyzed in relation to CPEB4 expression in hematopoietic stem and progenitor cells (HSPCs) undergoing erythroid differentiation. The results suggested that genetic perturbation through targeting sgRNAs was linked to altered CPEB4 expression levels, thereby connecting this SNP to the regulation of erythroid lineage development.
title: Transcription factor networks disproportionately enrich for heritability of blood cell phenotypes

finding: Located in the 5q14.3 genomic region, rs34522 was associated with multiple functional connectivity traits, indicating its relevance in the genetic architecture of brain function.
title: Common variants contribute to intrinsic functional architecture of human brain

finding: The SNP rs10065372 was associated with severe sepsis, which has a high fatality rate, as indicated in the study. Although the context focused on the role of IRGM/Irgm1 and atherosclerosis, the presence of this SNP at position +313 in exon 2 of IRGM on chromosome 5q33.1 was highlighted, although it was noted that the implications for mouse models remain unclear.
title: IRGM/Irgm1 Aggravates Progression of Atherosclerosis by Inducing Macrophage Apoptosis

finding: The rs373979283 SNP, which causes the Y226D substitution, was previously reported in patients with Sandhoff disease. The mutation was predicted to be deleterious, affecting the protein's folding due to the change in physiochemical properties between Tyrosine and Aspartate.
title: Comprehensive Analysis of HEXB Protein Reveal Forty Two Novel nsSNPs That May Lead to Sandhoff disease (SD) Using Bioinformatics

finding: The rs121907985 variant, leading to the P504S substitution, was linked to pathogenicity in ClinVar. This mutation was reported by Hou et al. in two sisters with Sandhoff disease, demonstrating increased precursor/mature ratio and decreased protein heat stability.
title: Comprehensive Analysis of HEXB Protein Reveal Forty Two Novel nsSNPs That May Lead to Sandhoff disease (SD) Using Bioinformatics

finding: The rs764552042 SNP marks the R533C substitution, which was reported in several Sandhoff disease patients. It was noted that this mutation resulted in diminished activity of the affected protein and potential misfolding due to altered disulfide bond formation.
title: Comprehensive Analysis of HEXB Protein Reveal Forty Two Novel nsSNPs That May Lead to Sandhoff disease (SD) Using Bioinformatics

finding: The SNP rs116555563 was also recognized among the 42 novel SNPs shared between MS and IBD, further establishing its significance in the context of MS-IBD comorbidity.
title: Investigating the shared genetic architecture between multiple sclerosis and inflammatory bowel diseases

finding: Similarly, rs67111717 was included in the set of novel SNPs linked to the MS-IBD phenotype, reinforcing the genetic relationship between these conditions.
title: Investigating the shared genetic architecture between multiple sclerosis and inflammatory bowel diseases

finding: The SNP rs181826 was confirmed to be associated with the genetic relationship between MS and CD, contributing to the understanding of shared genetic risk factors.
title: Investigating the shared genetic architecture between multiple sclerosis and inflammatory bowel diseases

finding: The SNP rs351855 was associated with suppressed cytotoxic CD8+ T cell infiltration and promoted higher levels of immunosuppressive regulatory T cells through increased STAT3 signaling in murine models of breast and lung cancer.
title: Germline variants that influence the tumor immune microenvironment also drive response to immunotherapy

finding: The SNP rs10050691 was related to the research conducted by Kennedy et al. (2018), which focused on the implementation of the LandTrendr Algorithm on Google Earth Engine. This algorithm was utilized to analyze forest disturbances over time, contributing to the understanding of the status of primary forests in Europe as discussed in the abstract. Specifically, the algorithm played a significant role in assessing forest disturbance events, enabling researchers to validate that 94% of the identified primary forest patches had not undergone significant disturbances that could compromise their classification.
title: European Primary Forest Database (EPFD) v2.0

finding: This SNP was associated with two traits in opposite directions, which demonstrates its potential pleiotropic effect.
title: Multivariate Genomewide Association Analysis with IHT

finding: The SNP rs26279 in the MSH3 gene was identified as a polymorphism that increased cancer risk according to a meta-analysis conducted by Miao et al. in 2015. This finding suggested a correlation between the genetic variant and the likelihood of developing cancer, providing insights into the role of MSH3 in genomic stability and its contributions to cancer predisposition.
title: Msh2-Msh3 interferes with DNA metabolism in vivo

finding: The SNP rs12654448 was associated with cigarette consumption in two London cohorts (p=0.00125), and in heavy smokers (p=0.0003397), as well as with age at onset of weekly smoking (p=0.00105) in the Finnish twins cohort. Overall, the minor allele was linked to a lower degree of dependence and decreased cigarette consumption.
title: Identification of Slit3 as a locus affecting nicotine preference in zebrafish and human smoking behaviour

finding: The SNP rs17734503 demonstrated a significant association with cigarette consumption levels in the London cohorts (p=0.00227) and in heavy smokers (p=0.0008575). It was also linked to DSM-IV nicotine dependence symptoms (p=0.0322) and age at onset of weekly smoking (p=0.00116) in the Finnish cohort, further indicating a lower dependence level with the minor allele.
title: Identification of Slit3 as a locus affecting nicotine preference in zebrafish and human smoking behaviour

finding: The SNP rs11742567 was specifically noted to be associated with cigarette consumption in light smokers (less than 20 cigarettes per day; p=0.003909) and had implications for quitting behaviors, suggesting its relevance in smoking cessation.
title: Identification of Slit3 as a locus affecting nicotine preference in zebrafish and human smoking behaviour

finding: The SNP rs73801920 (A: 0.1214) was reported in D5S818 and had a minor allele frequency (MAF) that differed when compared to other populations.
title: The concordance of length- and sequence-based STRs used in forensic markers with guidance for practice

finding: Identified as a basal SNP-eQTL in myeloid cells, rs11950944 was shown to enhance the DNA binding of PU.1, aligning with increased local histone modifications and transcriptional output.
title: Customizable high-throughput platform for profiling cofactor recruitment to DNA to characterize cis-regulatory elements and screen non-coding single-nucleotide polymorphisms

finding: The SNP rs13184712 was positively linked to the expression of MIF (macrophage migration inhibitory factor), revealing its role in tumor aggressiveness and immune evasion mechanisms in melanoma, suggesting that higher expression levels contributed to immune suppression.
title: Temporal genomic analysis of melanoma rejection identifies regulators of tumor immune evasion

finding: The SNP rs1862416 was also recognized as a genome-wide significant locus associated with nicotine dependence (ND), though it was found to be not associated with the heaviness of smoking index (HSI) in the UK Biobank. It was identified as a lung-specific cis-eQTL for TENM2, implying its role in the regulation of genes associated with ND.
title: Expanding the Genetic Architecture of Nicotine Dependence and its Shared Genetics with Multiple Traits: Findings from the Nicotine Dependence GenOmics (iNDiGO) Consortium

finding: An intergenic locus marked by rs4532315 was also found to have genome-wide significance (p=9.80 × 10^-9), indicating its relevance to T2D.
title: A Novel Type 2 Diabetes Locus in sub-Saharan Africans, ZRANB3, is Implicated in Beta Cell Proliferation

finding: The genetic variant rs10052710, located in the VCAN gene, exhibited associations with white matter hyperintensities, implicating its role in extracellular matrix structure and implications for brain health.
title: Phenotypic and genetic associations of quantitative magnetic susceptibility in UK Biobank brain imaging

finding: The SNP rs17171731 was identified as a candidate genetic variant that controls FAM13B gene expression in the left atrium. The risk allele at this SNP exhibited less enhancer activity compared to the protective allele, indicating a regulatory influence on gene expression. Functional assays demonstrated that the risk allele bound to a transcriptional repressor protein, leading to decreased FAM13B expression and altered expression of over 1000 genes in cardiomyocytes, contributing to increased atrial fibrillation susceptibility.
title: Causal SNP regulating FAM13B expression identified for the Chr. 5q31 atrial fibrillation susceptibility locus

finding: The SNP rs3846662 was suggested to be associated with Alzheimer's disease in the context of dietary factors related to cholesterol. A study indicated its role in Alzheimer's Disease risk (PMID: 21867541). This finding connects dietary influences and genetic predispositions in AD.
title: PGSbuilder: An end-to-end platform for human genome association analysis and polygenic risk score predictions

finding: The SNP rs10040095 was associated with regulation mechanisms affecting stem cell plasticity and differentiation as highlighted in studies involving CBP/p300, contributing to the understanding of cellular processes related to tumorigenesis, cell death, and DNA damage response.
title: Planarian CREB-binding protein (CBP) gene family regulates stem cell maintenance and differentiation

finding: The SNP rs13153658 was associated with the function of SIK2 in ovarian cancer cells, linked to the effects of the small-molecule inhibitor MRIA9. This relationship suggested that rs13153658 played a role in cellular processes influenced by SIK2, particularly in the context of cell-cycle dynamics in ovarian cancer.
