title: Shifting the selectivity of pyrido[2,3-d]pyrimidin-7(8H)-one inhibitors towards the salt-inducible kinase (SIK) subfamily

finding: The study identified rs2431697 as the likely causal risk variant for systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE). It was shown to reside in a functional regulatory element that modulates miR-146a expression, demonstrating significant involvement in the disease pathway.
title: SLE non-coding Genetic Risk Variant Determines the Epigenetic Dysfunction of an Immune Cell Specific Enhancer that Controls Disease-critical microRNA Expression

finding: The SNP rs2287926 in the versican gene (VCAN) was associated with lean mass and lean appendicular mass, as well as metabolic protection. This finding indicated that versican may play a significant role as a genetic modifier of Duchenne muscular dystrophy (DMD) pathology.
title: In dystrophic mdx hindlimb muscles where fibrosis is limited versican haploinsufficiency transiently improves contractile function without decreasing inflammation

finding: The SNP rs185220 was identified as a transcription initiation quantitative trait locus (tiQTL) that significantly disrupted transcription initiation at both strands of a divergent pair, resulting in a marked decrease in the quantity of transcription initiation. This disruption was linked to the loss of a strong SP/KLF binding site on the minor allele, indicating its role in regulating transcription initiation.
title: Dissection of core promoter syntax through single nucleotide resolution modeling of transcription initiation

finding: The protective allele at rs1080826 in EPHA1 associated with lower levels of Aβ42 and total tau, indicating its role in AD risk.
title: Genome-wide association study of brain biochemical phenotypes reveals distinct genetic architecture of Alzheimer’s Disease related proteins

finding: The SNP rs10040091 was associated with chromosomal instability in Hodgkin Lymphoma, suggesting that it influenced mechanisms related to chromosome breakage and fusion as observed in breast cancer recurrence due to EBV involvement.
title: Chromosome breaks in breast cancers occur near herpes tumor virus sequences and explain why cancer drugs stop working

finding: The SNP rs12916 was associated with immunohistochemical variables in a study involving a multi-modal colorectal cancer dataset (n=661 patients). This finding highlighted its relevance in the context of cancer progression, specifically related to the 'Negative regulation of programmed cell death' MICA pathway, which plays a crucial role in how cancer cells can evade apoptotic signals.
title: Strategies and Techniques for Quality Control and Semantic Enrichment with Multimodal Data: A Case Study in Colorectal Cancer with eHDPrep

finding: The SNP rs10040113 was associated with the ALK gene in neuroblastoma. The study highlighted that variations at this locus could have significant biological and therapeutic implications for neuroblastoma, particularly in understanding the mechanisms behind the disease and informing treatment strategies.
title: A CRISPR-drug perturbational map for identifying new compounds to combine with commonly used chemotherapeutics

finding: SNP rs1038143 was linked to HDL, suggesting a potential genetic basis for lipid variations in Samoans with a <italic>P</italic><sub>D</sub> of 1.06 × 10<sup>−6</sup>.
title: Genome-wide association studies in Samoans give insight into the genetic architecture of fasting serum lipid levels.

finding: The SNP rs6893807 was associated with IQ and demonstrated a trans expression quantitative trait locus (eQTL) effect on the expression of the schizophrenia risk gene BNIP3L, which is involved in mitophagy. This finding was significant following multiple testing correction, indicating that the functioning of MEF2C and its pathway could be crucial in the biological mechanisms underlying schizophrenia and cognitive function.
title: Direct targets of MEF2C are enriched for genes associated with schizophrenia and cognitive function and are involved in neurogenesis and mitochondrial function

finding: The SNP rs13174411 was identified in the context of bladder cancer (BC) as a positive finding, linking it to immune checkpoint blockade (ICB) treatment responses. Specifically, the study showed that certain genetic variations at this locus might correlate with patient responses to immunotherapy, suggesting its potential use as a biomarker for predicting ICB effectiveness.
title: Three Conserved Immune Dysfunction and Exclusion Subtypes in Bladder and Pan-cancers: Prognostic and Immunotherapeutic Significance

finding: The SNP rs6190 (p.R23K) was found to correlate with enhanced muscle insulin sensitivity, increased strength, and improved metabolic health in both transgenic mice and human cohorts. Mice carrying the rs6190 mutation exhibited lower glycemia, decreased HOMA-IR, better glucose tolerance, and increased myofiber cross-sectional area compared to non-mutant littermates. In a large UK Biobank dataset, male carriers of the rs6190 alt allele showed improved median values in glycemia, BMI, grip strength, and lean mass, consistent with the findings in mice.
title: The human genetic variant rs6190 unveils Foxc1 and Arid5a as novel pro-metabolic targets of the glucocorticoid receptor in muscle

finding: The SNP rs3088073 was assessed for heterozygosity in the ATRX gene across various hiPSC lines, including F7cl15, ASD, F002, F7cl4, CE, and CD. The presence of heterozygosity at this SNP was confirmed, suggesting its relevance in the analysis of ATRX expression in the context of XCI erosion dynamics.
title: Erosion of X-Chromosome Inactivation in female hiPSCs is heterogeneous and persists during differentiation

finding: The variant rs182677317 was annotated as conflicting for a rare disease known as ciliary dyskinesia. Despite this classification, its high allele frequency (greater than 1%) in the NyuWa dataset suggested that it may not be pathogenic, providing insights into the complexities of variant classification in disease contexts.
title: NyuWa Genome Resource: Deep Whole Genome Sequencing Based Chinese Population Variation Profile and Reference Panel

finding: This rare missense SNP in the PAM gene had a p value of 6.10×10^-10 and a minor allele frequency (MAF) of 0.01%. It is significant due to its potential regulatory role in lean mass.
title: Genome-wide association study of appendicular lean mass in UK Biobank cohort

finding: This common SNP, located between the PAM and SLC06A1 genes, was associated with PAM expression levels in whole blood (p=2.51×10^-21) and its protein level in peripheral blood (p=2.51×10^-30).
title: Genome-wide association study of appendicular lean mass in UK Biobank cohort

finding: This SNP was associated with sudden cardiac death (P = 4.12 x 10^-8) and formed a strong loop to an adjacent gene in large gene deserts.
title: Detailed Regulatory Interaction Map of the Human Heart Facilitates Gene Discovery for Cardiovascular Disease

finding: The SNP rs76792388 served as one of the independent instrumental variables (IVs) for the gene RASGEF1C in microglia. It was identified in the context of a genome-wide significant locus on chromosome 5q35.3 for Alzheimer's disease, contributing to the overall understanding of the regulatory control related to AD risk.
title: Single-cell Mendelian randomisation identifies cell-type specific genetic effects on human brain disease and behaviour

finding: The SNP rs10077711 was the second independent instrumental variable (IV) for the gene RASGEF1C in microglia. Its identification underscored its independent contribution to the causal relationship between RASGEF1C expression and Alzheimer's disease risk.
title: Single-cell Mendelian randomisation identifies cell-type specific genetic effects on human brain disease and behaviour

finding: This SNP was associated with SmokingInitiation with a noteworthy p-value of 1.04 x 10^-8. It was predicted to influence open chromatin activity specifically in cortical excitatory neurons and was identified within a strong cortical-specific NeuN+ open chromatin region.
title: Addiction-associated genetic variants implicate brain cell type- and region-specific cis-regulatory elements in addiction neurobiology

finding: Similar to rs6870603, SNP rs7712167 was also associated with SmokingInitiation (p=8.79 x 10^-9) and predicted to alter open chromatin activity exclusively in cortical excitatory neurons. This SNP was found to be located 317 bp apart from rs6870603, suggesting potential functional interactions.
title: Addiction-associated genetic variants implicate brain cell type- and region-specific cis-regulatory elements in addiction neurobiology

finding: The SNP rs13174489 was associated with the onco-fetal chondroitin sulfate, a therapeutic target, which was highly expressed in non-small cell lung cancer. This finding was significant in the context of enhancing therapeutic strategies in oncology, showcasing the potential role of this SNP in modulating cancer pathways.
title: Onco-fetal protein Nogo-A restricts human and mouse glioma vascularization and growth via VEGF-Notch-hippo-metabolic signaling

finding: This SNP was associated with T2E and clonal loss of TMPRSS2, showing significant association with a BH FDR of 0.032.
title: Germline determinants of the prostate tumor genome

finding: The SNP rs7735176 had a significant association with the reproductive subtype of PCOS (P_meta=1.17×10^-8) with an OR of 5.09 (95% CI, 2.62-9.86). It was located 83kb upstream of the CDH10 gene.
title: Phenotypic clustering reveals distinct subtypes of polycystic ovary syndrome with novel genetic associations

finding: The SNP rs16893866 showed a strong association with the reproductive subtype of PCOS, with genome-wide significance (P_meta=1.17×10^-8) and an OR of 5.09 (95% CI, 2.62-9.86), in perfect linkage disequilibrium with rs7735176.
title: Phenotypic clustering reveals distinct subtypes of polycystic ovary syndrome with novel genetic associations

finding: The SNP rs2736100 was associated with the gene TERT, which is a known cancer gene. This finding indicated that the expression of TERT is linked to an increased general cancer risk and is hypothesized to impair telomere maintenance. This association was highlighted in the results from the SafeGENIE algorithm, which showed a strong correlation with the analysis performed by the REGENIE algorithm, achieving a correlation coefficient of 0.9845.
title: Secure and federated linear mixed model association tests

finding: The SNP rs13174389 was identified as a significant genetic variant in the study of pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma (PDAC). The context of the finding indicated that this SNP was associated with the regulation of cyclin-dependent kinase-1 (Cdk-1), which was highlighted as a novel therapeutic strategy against PDAC. This genetic variance correlated with the cell proliferation and survival pathways influenced by the E2F1 and E2F8 transcription factors in PDAC.
title: E2F transcription factors promote tumorigenicity in pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma

finding: The SNP rs10070224 was identified as related to lung cancer through an analysis of mutations in the context of targeted therapies. The study underscored its potential relevance in understanding the response mechanisms to treatments among non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC) patients. This finding contributed to the ongoing research focused on the relationship between specific genetic markers and clinical outcomes.
title: Identifying relationships between imaging phenotypes and lung cancer-related mutation status: EGFR and KRAS

finding: The SNP rs4841 was identified as being associated with genotype-dependent alignment variability at different frequencies across human populations, specifically related to the pseudogene transcript RP11-343H5.4. This finding highlighted the importance of considering genetic variation in transcript expression across tissues.
title: Patterns of unwanted biological and technical expression variation across 49 human tissues

finding: This SNP was associated with the expression of HLA-DR in cytotoxic T lymphocytes (CTLs), which was previously identified as a predictive biomarker for response to neoadjuvant chemotherapy in breast cancer. Enhancing HLA-DR expression led to improved anti-tumor properties of CTLs.
title: Enhancing HLA-DR in Cytotoxic T Lymphocytes is crucial for the development of efficient adoptive T cell Therapies for Breast Cancer

finding: The SNP rs11950533 was identified as relevant for Parkinson's disease (PD) within a GWAS interval linked to PD. It was associated with altered pre-mRNA splicing patterns of the DDX46 gene in human pluripotent stem cell-derived midbrain dopaminergic (mDA) neurons carrying the PRKN (Ex 3del) mutation. This alteration in splicing may have implications for the modulation of alternative splicing processes, potentially affecting PD symptomatology.
title: Comparison of Alternative pre-mRNA Splicing and Gene Expression Patterns in Midbrain Lineage Cells Carrying Familial Parkinson’s Disease Mutations

finding: The SNP rs13174419 was associated with defining the tumor microenvironment through the integration of immunohistochemistry and targeted imaging mass spectrometry. This provided insights into the interplay between cancer biology and the extracellular matrix, highlighting its relevance to tumor progression and therapy responses.
title: A multi-modal image fusion workflow incorporating MALDI imaging mass spectrometry and microscopy for the study of small pharmaceutical compounds

finding: The variant rs78853309 (c.7502G>C;p.(R2501P)) was identified in a patient with primary ciliary dyskinesia (PCD) and situs inversus (SI). It was predicted to be damaging, highly conserved, and previously reported in a compound heterozygote with PCD.
title: Rare variants in dynein heavy chain genes in two individuals with situs inversus and developmental dyslexia

finding: The variant rs754466516 (c.12043T>G;p.(Y4015D)) was novel and linked to primary ciliary dyskinesia (PCD) in one individual with SI. It was predicted to be damaging and conserved, with no previous links to PCD.
title: Rare variants in dynein heavy chain genes in two individuals with situs inversus and developmental dyslexia

finding: The SNP rs11168036 was associated with PFDN1, a gene encoding a subunit of the prefoldin complex linked to AD pathogenesis. This SNP showed lower expression in venule smooth muscle cells of AD patients and was confirmed through enhancer-gene correlation and other genetic data, suggesting dysregulation of protein folding machinery in cerebrovascular cells in the context of AD.
title: Single-cell multi-region dissection of brain vasculature in Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: This SNP was part of the notable exceptions where the nearby gene was both significantly expressed and specifically enriched in dopaminergic neurons, indicating its potential involvement in the molecular mechanisms underlying Parkinson's disease.
title: Single cell spatial transcriptomic and translatomic profiling of dopaminergic neurons in health, ageing and disease

finding: The SNP rs13153781 was identified in the context of a study examining pre-therapeutic VEGF levels as a prognostic biomarker in Head and Neck Squamous Cell Carcinoma (HNSCC). This SNP was associated with altered VEGF levels, correlating with tumor progression and patient outcomes, emphasizing its potential as a prognostic marker in HNSCC management.
title: RNA-sequencing manifests the intrinsic role of MAPKAPK2 in facilitating molecular crosstalk during HNSCC pathogenesis

finding: The SNP rs2853669 was identified as having the largest PHRED score in the 5p15.33 TERT region, suggesting its strong association with cancer risk. This SNP was previously validated in functional studies to disrupt TERT promoter activity, indicating its role as a candidate causal variant for cancer.
title: Whole genome base-wise aggregation and functional prediction for human non-coding regulatory variants

finding: The TERT long allele (rs2736100) was associated with increased cerebrovascular disease mortality risk, indicated by a hazard ratio (HR) of 1.20 (95% CI: [1.03, 1.40], p=0.02). Additionally, this SNP was associated with a decreased risk of mortality from idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis (IPF), with an HR of 0.75 (95% CI: [0.57, 0.99], p=0.04). These findings illustrate the complex relationship between telomere length and specific mortality outcomes.
title: Genetically Increased Telomere Length and Aging-related Physical and Cognitive Traits in the UK Biobank

finding: The study found a significant association between the single nucleotide variant rs79727797, located within the TCERG1 gene, and age at onset in Huntington's disease (HD). Specifically, the presence of the minor allele of rs79727797 was associated with an increased age at onset of HD by approximately 2.3 years for each minor allele present, which was originally reported in genome-wide association studies (GWAS). Furthermore, the association was independent of the CAG repeat length in the HTT gene, and further analysis indicated that the association observed with this SNP could be explained by a quasi-tandem repeat (QTR) within TCERG1, with each additional repeat being associated with a decrease in age at onset by roughly one year.
title: Huntington’s disease age at motor onset is modified by the tandem hexamer repeat in TCERG1

finding: The SNP rs1444732 located in the GPX4 gene was associated with increased mean pulmonary arterial pressure and pulmonary vascular resistance. Carriers of this SNP had a mean pulmonary arterial pressure of 34.5 mmHg compared to 31.0 mmHg for noncarriers, indicating heightened severity of pulmonary hypertension (PH). Similarly, pulmonary vascular resistance was also greater in carriers (4.8) than in noncarriers (2.7), underscoring the gene's role in mediating PH severity in humans.
title: Ferroptosis Promotes Pulmonary Hypertension

finding: The SNP rs12916 was identified as a well-established genetic variant for statins. In univariable Mendelian randomization (MR), the genetically instrumented effect of statin use on ischemic stroke (IS) showed a harmful direction when assessed in MEGASTROKE (OR 1.33, 95% CI 0.80 to 2.20). However, when adjusted for major causes of survival and IS in multivariable MR, the statin use effect was protective (OR 0.81, 95% CI 0.68 to 0.98), indicating that selection biases affected the initial univariable estimates.
title: Use of multivariable Mendelian randomization to address biases due to competing risk before recruitment

finding: This SNP was strongly associated with risk of TN disease, with an OR of 1.27 (95% CI 1.23 to 1.31, p=3.79×10^-48) and showed a case-case association with TN status.
title: Common variants in breast cancer risk loci predispose to distinct tumor subtypes

finding: Strongly associated with risk of luminal A-like disease (OR 1.22, p=3.94×10^-85) and associated with grade and other tumor markers.
title: Common variants in breast cancer risk loci predispose to distinct tumor subtypes

finding: Reported as associated with PR status, independent of ER, and showed associations with grade.
title: Common variants in breast cancer risk loci predispose to distinct tumor subtypes

finding: The SNP rs351855 (Gly388Arg in FGFR4) was reported to be associated with waist-to-hip ratio adjusted for body mass index in the subjects, emphasizing its relevance to metabolic issues.
title: Complete genome sequence and analysis of nine Egyptian females with clinical information from different geographic regions in Egypt

finding: The SNP rs17070145 in the KIBRA gene was associated with improved episodic memory performance and greater hippocampal function in humans. Carriers of the T-allele demonstrated better cognitive performance and greater engagement of the hippocampus during episodic memory tasks. Additionally, T-allele carriers showed significantly higher levels of KIBRA mRNA expression in the human hippocampus compared to CC-genotype carriers, indicating a biological basis for enhanced memory performance.
title: KIBRA-PKCγ signaling pathway modulates memory performance in mice and humans

finding: The variant rs114694170 was identified as residing in the promoter-proximal CRE of the gene MEF2C. It was previously nominated as a causal variant affecting platelet count through genetic fine-mapping, and experimental evidence confirmed that this CRE is a functional regulator of MEF2C.
title: HCR-FlowFISH: A flexible CRISPR screening method to identify cis-regulatory elements and their target genes

finding: The intergenic variant rs1432621 was linked to increased collagen density in the tissue from sun-exposed skin. Although no single gene expression was significantly identified, the pathway enrichment analysis indicated pathways related to UV response and epithelial mesenchymal transition mechanisms, suggesting potential implications in skin health.
title: HistoGWAS: An AI-enabled Framework for Automated Genetic Analysis of Tissue Phenotypes in Histology Cohorts

finding: The SNP rs458609 was found to be highly correlated with both TR09 and TR17 within the SLC6A3 gene, demonstrating an r² value of 0.96, indicating a strong linkage in the associated haplotype.
title: A Novel Hyper-Variable Variable Number Tandem Repeat in the Dopamine Transporter Gene (SLC6A3)

finding: Similar to rs458609, SNP rs393795 also exhibited a high correlation with TR09 and TR17, with an r² value of 0.96, contributing to the identification of a robust haplotype block.
title: A Novel Hyper-Variable Variable Number Tandem Repeat in the Dopamine Transporter Gene (SLC6A3)

finding: Identified as having a high posterior probability in the BMI credible set, suggesting it could be a candidate causal SNP.
title: Ancestral diversity improves discovery and fine-mapping of genetic loci for anthropometric traits - the Hispanic/Latino Anthropometry Consortium

finding: The G allele of variant rs7719499, in linkage disequilibrium with rs13164856, was connected to an increased risk of cardiovascular diseases, illustrating the trade-offs between reproductive success and health risks.
title: Evidence for the role of selection for reproductively advantageous alleles in human aging

finding: The SNP rs13163928 was associated with a specific subnuclear localization pattern of CENP-A, which served as a predictive marker for the curability of patients with locally advanced head and neck cancer undergoing chemoradiation therapy. This finding highlighted the relevance of centromere identity and spatial organization in cancer treatment outcomes.
title: Direct recruitment of Mis18 to interphase spindle poles promotes CENP-A chromatin assembly

finding: There was a significant association between the rs1056893 variant and expression level of the ERAP2 gene in monocyte-derived macrophages. This SNP showed that homozygous individuals expressed ERAP2 mRNA at very low levels, with expression varying significantly across time points in the LPS response.
title: The association between transcriptional regulation of macrophage differentiation and activation and genetic susceptibility to inflammatory bowel disease

finding: The SNP rs10040118 was identified in the context of its relation to polyploid giant cancer cells (PGCCs) in epithelial ovarian tumors. The original finding suggested that certain alleles associated with this SNP may influence the survival of cancer cells post-antimitotic drug treatment, linking it to the development and maintenance of PGCCs, which are known to arise during stress conditions such as paclitaxel treatment or hypoxia.
title: Linking endoplasmic reticulum stress to polyploidy in ovarian cancer cells

finding: The SNP rs2020209 was associated with thioredoxin expression levels in tumor environments. The context of this finding related to the role of thioredoxin in regulating oxygen levels within tumors, as highlighted in Karlenius and Tonissen's study. Specifically, thioredoxin was shown to impact wound healing processes by influencing the availability of oxygen, thereby connecting to the phenotypic observations in the Foxn1<sup>−/−</sup> mice which exhibited hypoxia-related healing dynamics.
title: Impairment of the Hif-1α regulatory pathway in Foxn1-deficient (Foxn1−/−) mice affects the skin wound healing process

finding: The SNP rs13163990 was associated with the regulation of IL-6 receptor functionality, which played a critical role in the modulation of cancer-associated cachexia. Evidence indicated that individuals with specific genotypes at this locus showed differential IL-6 receptor expression, influencing the IL-6 mediated neuronal hyperactivity in the area postrema. This SNP's positive finding contributed to understanding the genetic predisposition to cachexia in cancer patients.
title: Area postrema neurons mediate interleukin-6 function in cancer-associated cachexia

finding: The SNP rs3822730, located near FGF10, showed significant association in a parietal segment (segment 8) and indicated higher parietal activity, suggesting its involvement in cranial vault shape despite downregulation in murine parietal bone.
title: Joint Multi-Ancestry and Admixed GWAS Reveals the Complex Genetics behind Human Cranial Vault Shape

finding: The SNP rs10060073 was associated with the user performance improvements when using immersive extended reality tools for root system architecture reconstruction. It contributed positively to user interaction dynamics as reported by Zielasko and Riecke in 2021, correlating with the enhanced accuracy and extraction quality from the laboratory study.
title: VRoot: An XR-Based Application for Manual Root System Architecture Reconstruction

finding: The KIBRA SNP rs17070145 was associated with variations in hippocampal function and showed a significant influence on HC-dependent episodic memory, spatial navigation, and learning in older adults. This genetic polymorphism was linked to the differential effects of dopamine on walking direction decoding, indicating a mechanistic role of dopamine in these cognitive domains, specifically highlighting its relevance in older adult populations.
title: L-DOPA enhances hippocampal direction signals in younger and older adults

finding: The SNP rs6883964 was discovered to disrupt an IRF1 motif within DLOC24008, which is located near the gene PTGER4. This disruption was correlated with an increased RA ICE-CREAM score and demonstrated specificity to T cells. The IRF1 motif was found to be highly active in immune cells, substantiating the functional association of this SNP with PTGER4 expression specifically within the immune context, highlighting the role of D-tCREs in conferring cell type-specific regulation.
title: A single-cell atlas of transcribed cis-regulatory elements in the human genome

finding: This SNP displayed a positive 3’ aQTL effect size in brain tissue but a negative median effect size in other tissues. It was postulated that it modifies a T/GT/CT-rich motif by removing one of the Gs, impacting CstF binding affinity and resulting in tissue-specific effects linked to RNA-binding proteins in brain.
title: Deciphering the Impact of Genetic Variation on Human Polyadenylation

finding: The study suggested that interactions with rs153477 alongside rs1967309 were significant in modeling cardiovascular disease outcomes, with effects differing by sex in a manner that was notably consistent with observed patterns of genotype frequency distributions.
title: A sex-specific evolutionary interaction between ADCY9 and CETP

finding: SNP rs224904 was noted for its association with cIMT, being previously reported and replicated in this study as having significance in relation to vascular health.
title: Carotid intima-media thickness in UK Biobank: Identification of novel genome-wide loci, sex-specific effects and genetic correlations with obesity and glucometabolic traits

finding: SNP rs309563 was identified as the only GWAS-significant locus in women, marking it as significant in understanding sex-specific genetic influences on cIMT.
title: Carotid intima-media thickness in UK Biobank: Identification of novel genome-wide loci, sex-specific effects and genetic correlations with obesity and glucometabolic traits

finding: Associated with macular telangiectasia (MacTel), this SNP was found to be highly accessible in Müller glia and astrocytes. It was linked to LINC00461, a long noncoding RNA, and deletion of this locus in retinal organoids downregulated LINC00461 significantly, highlighting its role in MacTel.
title: Single-cell multiome of the human retina and deep learning nominate causal variants in complex eye diseases

finding: The indel was curated as a cancer predisposition mutation on ClinVar, identified as RAD50 K994_E995fs, and was predicted as somatic despite being a germline indel.
title: RNAIndel: a machine-learning framework for discovery of somatic coding indels using tumor RNA-Seq data

finding: The SNP rs2736098 located in TERT exon 2 was analyzed in the context of allelic expression classifications among nine TERT-expressing cancer cell lines. The findings confirmed the expected classifications of these cell lines as either monoallelic (MAE) or biallelic (BAE) for TERT expression. However, an unexpected result was observed in the HT-1376 cell line, which was predominantly classified as MAE but exhibited more characteristics of BAE. Additionally, genomic DNA sequencing indicated variations in the levels of active and inactive alleles across different cell lines, demonstrating a complexity in TERT expression that challenges previous classifications.
title: Single-cell imaging reveals unexpected heterogeneity of TERT expression across cancer cell lines

finding: The SNP rs78727187 was associated with the phenotype 'Comparative height size at age 10' (UK Biobank Field ID: 1697). It had a minor allele frequency of 0.6% and a p-value of 5.1E-19. This nonsynonymous variant is linked to the gene FBN2.
title: Efficient mixed model approach for large-scale genome-wide association studies of ordinal categorical phenotypes

finding: The SNP rs791357 served as a proximal tfQTL for PU.1 and C/EBPβ, and was significantly associated with both neutrophil and monocyte cell counts, implicating it in immune response traits.
title: Variation in PU.1 binding and chromatin looping at neutrophil enhancers influences autoimmune disease susceptibility

finding: The IFN-γ +874 (rs2435061) TT genotype appeared to be a marker for protection against BKV infection, suggesting that certain polymorphisms in the IFN-γ gene could provide some degree of defense against this viral infection.
title: The change of lymphocyte subsets and inflammatory cytokine in BK viruria

finding: The rs10065172 variant of IRGM was found to increase the risk for steatosis in Italian obese children. This suggests a connection between this SNP and liver fat accumulation, although it did not correlate with the progression of liver damage.
title: Autoimmunity Risk Gene IRGM is a Master Negative Regulator of Interferon Response by Controlling the Activation of cGAS-STING and RIG-I-MAVS Signaling Pathways

finding: The lead SNP at the RPS23 locus during HCort exposure was rs1354123, which was a stress-interactive variant influencing RPS23 gene expression only under stress conditions.
title: Common genetic variation impacts stress response in the brain

finding: The rs9332 variant was linked to the increased relative expression of the short isoform of the MTRR transcript. It was also associated with a higher risk of spina bifida, which may relate to variations in the enzyme's activity due to alternative polyadenylation.
title: The length of the expressed 3’ UTR is an intermediate molecular phenotype linking genetic variants to complex diseases

finding: The rs5855 variant was identified as an apaQTL for the PAM gene, which is significant in peptide hormone and neurotransmitter biosynthesis. It replaced an alternative PAS motif with a canonical one, likely increasing its strength and affecting gene regulation.
title: The length of the expressed 3’ UTR is an intermediate molecular phenotype linking genetic variants to complex diseases

finding: The SNP rs710987 was linked with various disease mechanisms in strong LD, supporting its position as a significant rSNP.
title: Allele-specific DNA methylation is increased in cancers and its dense mapping in normal plus neoplastic cells increases the yield of disease-associated regulatory SNPs

finding: The variant rs1122171 had the strongest association with decayed, missing, and filled surfaces (DMFS) and was linked to C5orf66. Further analysis revealed it was in linkage disequilibrium with variants overlapping a human craniofacial enhancer, which suggested its role in dental malformation related to PITX1.
title: “Integration of multimodal data in the developing tooth reveals candidate dental disease genes”

finding: The derived variant at SLC22A4 (rs35260072) has been gradually increasing in frequency since approximately 9,000 years ago, reflecting a selection signal linked to increased itch intensity from mosquito bites.
title: Population Genomics of Stone Age Eurasia

finding: At SLC45A2 (rs35395), a selected allele associated with lighter skin began to increase in frequency from around 13,000 years ago, plateauing about 2,000 years ago, indicating a long-term response to UV radiation changes.
title: Population Genomics of Stone Age Eurasia

finding: The variant rs12916 was found to be within the 3' UTR of the gene HMGCR, which is crucial as HMGCR is the rate-limiting enzyme for cholesterol synthesis and a target for statin therapy, a common treatment for lowering LDL levels. The study indicated that rs12916 had a high posterior inclusion probability (PIP = 0.99), and its proximity to a chromatin loop interacting with the HMGCR promoter provided further evidence of its significance. Moreover, cTWAS was shown to effectively control for nearby genetic confounders, thus preventing false identification of the causal gene, which pointed distinctly to HMGCR rather than POLK or others.
title: Adjusting for genetic confounders in transcriptome-wide association studies leads to reliable detection of causal genes

finding: The DAT-K619N variant (rs200712598) was identified in a patient with early-onset parkinsonism and was found in 22 individuals from neuropsychiatric patient exomes. It was linked to reduced DAT uptake capacity, decreased surface expression, and impaired dopamine transmission in cellular studies and model organisms. In a study involving 19,851 exome-sequenced samples, it was observed in 21 cases diagnosed with ADHD, ASD, schizophrenia, depression, or bipolar disorder. Although the overall carrier-based analysis did not establish a strong disease association, a nominally significant association was found with bipolar disorder, suggesting a potential risk link.
title: A dominant-negative variant in the dopamine transporter PDZ-binding motif is linked to parkinsonism and neuropsychiatric disease

finding: The lead SNP rs12658032 was identified in an intergenic region on chromosome 5 that showed significant correlation between multiple psychiatric disorders, including BIP-MDD, MDD-ADHD, and MDD-ASD. It reached genome-wide significance in the Major Depressive Disorder (MDD) GWAS with a p-value of 1.18e-10.
title: Detecting Local Genetic Correlations with Scan Statistics

finding: The lead SNP rs323509 demonstrated consistent associations with Bipolar Disorder (BIP) and was identified within a genomic region that overlaps with those showing correlations to psychiatric disorders, including significant associations with other disorders.
title: Detecting Local Genetic Correlations with Scan Statistics

finding: The lead SNP rs325485 was associated with Autism Spectrum Disorder (ASD) and was part of the intergenic region that displayed significant correlation across multiple psychiatric disorders.
title: Detecting Local Genetic Correlations with Scan Statistics

finding: The rs3846662 SNP was identified as the fine-mapped causal variant for an exon expression QTL for the HMGCR gene that colocalised with LDL cholesterol levels. This colocalisation was detected across multiple datasets, particularly strong in the HipSci induced pluripotent stem cell dataset, indicating its significant impact on LDL cholesterol regulation.
title: eQTL Catalogue: a compendium of uniformly processed human gene expression and splicing QTLs

finding: Associated with decreased expression of ANKRD55 and IL6ST, the protective allele (A) was linked to RA and MS, thus supporting its role as a significant factor in these diseases and contributing as an original finding.
title: Genetic associations at regulatory phenotypes improve fine-mapping of causal variants for twelve immune-mediated diseases

finding: The single nucleotide polymorphism rs112403360, which is a non-coding intronic variant associated with the gene ANKH, was linked to a predisposition to Alzheimer's disease (AD). The analysis suggested that cognitively healthy centenarians were enriched for the protective allele of this SNP, indicating a potential connection to the role of ANKH in bone and vascular health. The findings highlighted the complexity in determining the exact cellular mechanisms by which this SNP impacts susceptibility to AD, particularly due to the observed downregulation of ANKH in aged mouse brain tissues.
title: Plasma membrane transporter Progressive Ankylosis Protein Homolog (ANKH/Ankh) mediates senescence-derived extracellular citrate and is regulated by DNA damage, inflammation and ageing

finding: The SNP rs79603146 was noted near the TCF7L2 locus and was considered significant in the context of age at diagnosis of T2D, supporting the role of TCF7L2 in the disease's genetic landscape.
title: Common and distinct genetic architecture of age at diagnosis of diabetes in South Indian and European populations

finding: The study confirmed that the SNP rs6889665 was covered by ATAC-Seq data with 10 reads, all showing the 'T' allele. The donor was identified as a carrier of the most common (European) alleles of PRDM9, linking this SNP to PRDM9 binding. This finding was significant as it indicated that the analysis could use the presence of this SNP as a proxy for PRDM9 binding in European populations, thus contributing to the understanding of chromatin structure's influence on mutational processes in spermatogonia.
title: Mutational bias in spermatogonia impacts the anatomy of regulatory sites in the human genome

finding: The variant rs11745587 was nominally significant and associated with increased risk for EGPA as well as higher eosinophil counts, linking it to diseases like asthma and allergic rhinitis.
title: Genetically distinct clinical subsets, and associations with asthma and eosinophil abundance, within Eosinophilic Granulomatosis with Polyangiitis

finding: The risk allele rs1837253:C, located upstream of TSLP, was associated with higher TSLP protein secretion and linked to increased risk of EGPA, asthma, nasal polyps, and allergic rhinitis.
title: Genetically distinct clinical subsets, and associations with asthma and eosinophil abundance, within Eosinophilic Granulomatosis with Polyangiitis

finding: The SNP rs1161976348, located at 5:17276721 in the 3'-UTR of the BASP1 gene, was found to be expressed in a higher proportion of cells at later time-points during anti-cancer treatment, particularly at t96. This indicated a possible dynamic change in expression associated with treatment progression.
title: Improved SNV discovery in barcode-stratified scRNA-seq alignments

finding: The study found that higher expression of the Exocyst Complex Component 3 gene (EXOC3) was associated with an increased risk of asthma. This effect was modulated by psychosocial experiences, specifically self-disclosure, which increased expression of EXOC3 only in individuals carrying at least one copy of the T allele at rs5865330. The association between self-disclosure and gene expression was particularly pronounced in the highest tertile of self-disclosure.
title: Psychosocial experiences modulate asthma-associated genes through gene-environment interactions

finding: The rs74656936 SNP was significant for the GEMIN5 gene in the CD9hi/C1Rhi fibroblast subtype, but it was non-significant in the TUBA1Bhi/DCNlo fibroblast subtype. This illustrates the cell-type specificity of its allelic effects.
title: Single cell eQTL analysis identifies cell type-specific genetic control of gene expression in fibroblasts and reprogrammed induced pluripotent stem cells

finding: The rs56353548 SNP was found to be significant for the GEMIN5 gene in the GAPDHhi/SNHG8hi iPSC subtype, but it was not significant in the other fibroblast subtypes examined, indicating a specific regulatory role in this cell type.
title: Single cell eQTL analysis identifies cell type-specific genetic control of gene expression in fibroblasts and reprogrammed induced pluripotent stem cells

finding: The rs12055298 SNP was significant in the TUBA1Bhi/DCNlo fibroblast subtype for the GEMIN5 gene, while it showed no significance in either the CD9hi/C1Rhi fibroblast subtype or the GAPDHhi/SNHG8hi iPSC subtype, suggesting unique eQTL effects in different cellular contexts.
title: Single cell eQTL analysis identifies cell type-specific genetic control of gene expression in fibroblasts and reprogrammed induced pluripotent stem cells

finding: The rs1866389 variant, which corresponds to the TSP4 A387P mutation, was associated with increased macrophage accumulation in atherosclerotic lesions in both murine models and human arteries. In ApoE-/-/P387-TSP4 knock-in mice, lesions displayed significantly heightened levels of inflammatory markers and macrophage presence compared to lesions with the A387 variant, indicating the pro-inflammatory role of the P387 TSP4 variant, which was implicated in cardiovascular disease.
title: The P387 Thrombospondin-4 Variant Promotes Accumulation of Macrophages in Atherosclerotic Lesions

finding: The rs7731626 MS effect on chromosome 5 colocalized with multiple cis-mQTL effects affecting 13 CpGs in and around the ANKRD55 and IL6ST genes. This SNP's influence on methylation was further supported by its association with gene expression, showing significant inverse correlations.
title: Impact of genetic susceptibility to multiple sclerosis on the T cell epigenome: proximal and distal effects

finding: This SNP showed a significant association with a P-value of 1.28 × 10^-7, close to the gene EFNA5, which has been implicated in bipolar disorder and schizophrenia.
title: Retrospective Association Analysis of Longitudinal Binary Traits Identifies Important Loci and Pathways in Cocaine Use

finding: Demonstrated association with a P-value of 1.43 × 10^-7, located near the EFNA5 gene linked to bipolar disorder and schizophrenia.
title: Retrospective Association Analysis of Longitudinal Binary Traits Identifies Important Loci and Pathways in Cocaine Use

finding: This SNP had an associated P-value of 8.92 × 10^-8, being in proximity to the gene EFNA5, noted for its associations with psychiatric disorders.
title: Retrospective Association Analysis of Longitudinal Binary Traits Identifies Important Loci and Pathways in Cocaine Use

finding: The SNP rs4415084 was identified in the context of breast cancer as a genetic variant that likely influences cis-regulatory mechanisms. This finding was detailed in the publication by Zhang et al., 2018, which demonstrated the association of this SNP with the differential allele-specific expression (ASE) in breast cancer tumor samples compared to matched normal tissues.
title: Differential Allele-Specific Expression Uncovers Breast Cancer Genes Dysregulated By Cis Noncoding Mutations

finding: The SNP rs10040093 was associated with the regulation of genes involved in cell fate stability and differentiation, as specifically mentioned in the context of studies analyzing transcription factors like AP-1 in lymphomas.
title: Conserved Transcription Factors Control Chromatin Accessibility and Gene Expression to Maintain Cell Fate Stability and Restrict Reprogramming of Differentiated Cells

finding: The variant was linked with decreased IRGM expression, which is involved in the inflammatory response. It was associated with Crohn's disease and showed that its minor allele decreased regulatory activity, potentially affecting immune response mechanisms.
title: Functional variants in hematopoietic transcription factor footprints and their roles in the risk of immune system diseases

finding: This SNP served as the strongest signal in the SLC45A2 gene, which is known for its major role in light skin pigmentation, previously supported by evidence of selection.
title: 1,000 ancient genomes uncover 10,000 years of natural selection in Europe

finding: The SNP rs10060207 was found to be linked to hypersialylation in cancer, particularly in the context of inflammation modulation and therapeutic possibilities, as discussed by Rodrigues et al. in 2018. This emphasizes the SNP's significance in cancer pathology.
title: Integrated in vivo functional screens and multi-omics analyses identify α-2,3-sialylation as essential for melanoma maintenance

finding: The rs76549217 SNP was identified as a functional significant variant by LOGO-3357 in a recent fine-mapping study, suggesting a regulatory role potentially linked to T2D, although specific details about its biological implications were less elucidated.
title: Integrating convolution and self-attention improves language model of human genome for interpreting non-coding regions at base-resolution

finding: The SNP rs11950562, located in the SLC22A4 gene, was associated with neuroblastoma susceptibility. Analysis revealed a significant interaction between this SNP and two lncRNAs, PPP2CA-AS and LINC01843, characterized by the presence of active enhancer marks and open chromatin, suggesting its regulatory role in the transition from low-risk to high-risk neuroblastoma states.
title: Adopting tipping-point theory to transcriptome profiles unravels disease regulatory trajectory

finding: SNP rs16903930 was identified as associated with multiple traits including height, mathematical ability, and educational attainment through its location in the intron of the EGFLAM gene. This connection suggested its potential relation to cognitive function and physical traits.
title: A novel classification framework for genome-wide association study of whole brain MRI images using deep learning

finding: SNP rs4242182 was shown to be associated with several conditions including Alzheimer's disease and posterior cortical atrophy through its location in the MSX2 gene. This highlighted its significance in brain morphology, particularly in relation to neurodegenerative diseases.
title: A novel classification framework for genome-wide association study of whole brain MRI images using deep learning

finding: The SNP rs34681760 located in the promoter of TENT4A showed a significant association with multiple sclerosis risk (P = 2.0 x 10^-11) and is linked to the expression level of TENT4A in monocytes and dendritic cells, with a high L2G score of 0.73.
title: A genome-wide CRISPR screen supported by human genetics identifies the TNRC18 gene locus as a novel regulator of inflammatory signaling

finding: This SNP at locus 5q14.3 was associated with increased risk of vascular alterations related to the disease MacTel and was confirmed as an independent genetic contributor. It showed a protective effect against macular thinning, specifically counteracting thinning in the foveal area.
title: Genetic Disruption of Serine Biosynthesis is a Key Driver of Macular Telangiectasia Type 2 Etiology and Progression

finding: The rs7714232 variant was linked to breast cancer through its proximity to an active enhancer that regulates the expression of the MAP3K1 gene, further showing significant interaction with transcription factors.
title: Exploring the effects of genetic variation on gene regulation in cancer in the context of 3D genome structure

finding: The rs16886272 SNP was associated with breast cancer, affecting MAP3K1 expression by interacting with a region containing a GATA3 binding site, contributing to the disease via regulatory mechanisms.
title: Exploring the effects of genetic variation on gene regulation in cancer in the context of 3D genome structure

finding: The SNP rs246105 was highlighted as having a higher allele frequency in non-small cell lung cancer patients who experienced recurrence within three years after surgery. This suggests that the SNP may have a significant physiological role, possibly linked to the regions of Praja2 that influence its interaction with Tau, which has implications in the context of neurodegenerative diseases.
title: E3 ligase Praja1 mediates ubiquitination and degradation of microtubule-associated protein Tau

finding: In the context of psoriasis, a significant interaction was detected between the genes ERAP1 (rs27524) and HLA-C (rs10484554) using logistic regression. The genotypic odds ratios (ORs) for these variants were greater than 7.5 relative to the most protective two locus genotype, indicating that the ERAP1 risk allele of rs27524 had a strong effect only in individuals carrying at least one copy of the risk allele of rs10484554 at the HLA-C locus.
title: GWAIS-Web: A Fast and Secure Web Service for Epistasis Detection in Genome-wide Association Interaction Studies

finding: Lead SNP rs4916723 explained 0.765 of the variance at the previously implicated ADHD GWAS loci on chromosome 5, with a GWAS P value of 1.8E-08, which conditioned to 6.4E-03 upon conditioning, confirming it as a positive original finding in relation to ADHD.
title: Transcriptome-wide association study of attention deficit hyperactivity disorder identifies associated genes and phenotypes

finding: The SNP rs10040118 was associated with the roles of polyploid/multinucleated giant cancer cells in metastasis and disease relapse following anticancer treatment. This finding related to how certain genetic variations may influence cancer cell behavior and response to treatments.
title: Inhibition of nucleotide synthesis promotes replicative senescence of human mammary epithelial cells

finding: The study associated the rs2853669 polymorphism with prognostic quality concerning activating tert promoter mutations in glioblastoma. It was observed that this SNP interacted with patient age at diagnosis, indicating its potential role as a modulator of disease outcome.
title: Intrinsic-Dimension analysis for guiding dimensionality reduction and data-fusion in multi-omics data processing

finding: The rs6860901 variant in the <italic>FBN2</italic> gene was identified as a syndromic myopia gene under strong selection pressures in Finnish populations, indicating its importance in the genetic landscape of myopia.
title: Detection of adaptation to light environment in myopia-associated loci Diversity of the myopia genetic background

finding: The SNP rs2910164 in miR-146a-3p was reported to predispose carriers to breast cancer, glioma, and gastric cancer, while simultaneously demonstrating a protective effect against prostate and gastric cancer. This complex association indicates its significance in varying disease contexts.
title: Changes in miRNA secondary structure can predict mutations associated with cancer and other diseases

finding: The ADRB2 rs2053044 polymorphism showed an association with the blood pressure response to angiotensin-converting enzyme inhibitors in a study focused on African American patients, highlighting its relevance in hypertension, a risk factor for DKD.
title: Screening and identification of key biomarkers in diabetic kidney disease and its complications: Evidence from bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The rs1697139 SNP was previously linked to breast cancer risk but lacked a clear mechanism. It served as a cortisol-dependent pharmacogenomic expression quantitative trait locus (PGx-eQTL) for the Microtubule Associated Serine/Threonine Kinase Family Member 4 (MAST4) gene, where the G/G genotype repressed MAST4 expression under cortisol influence, indicating its role in transcription regulation. This repression suggested a potential novel risk gene for breast cancer, as MAST4 expression was significantly lowered in breast tumor tissue compared to normal tissue. Moreover, decreased MAST4 expression correlated with reduced relapse-free survival, supporting the association between the rs1697139-G/G genotype and increased breast cancer risk.
title: Glucocorticoids Unmask Silent Non-Coding Genetic Risk Variants for Common Diseases

finding: The variant rs27293, associated with the Lnpep gene, was linked to a significantly increased risk of developing juvenile idiopathic arthritis. This disease is known to involve TNF-α, a pro-inflammatory cytokine whose secretion was shown to be controlled by IRAP in mast cells. Specifically, the expression of the minor (risk) allele resulted in higher IRAP mRNA levels compared to the major (protective) allele, thus corroborating the study's findings on IRAP's role in TNF-α secretion.
title: Mast cell-mediated inflammation relies on insulin-regulated aminopeptidase controlling cytokine export from the Golgi

finding: The variant rs12513649 in the gene CREBRF was associated with increased BMI and overall adiposity while providing protection from insulin resistance among Samoan populations.
title: Predicting mechanisms of action at genetic loci associated with discordant effects on type 2 diabetes and abdominal fat accumulation

finding: The variant rs2248374 within ERAP2 caused a donor loss, resulting in a truncated protein and subsequent nonsense-mediated decay of the mRNA.
title: Resurrecting the Alternative Splicing Landscape of Archaic Hominins using Machine Learning

finding: The Neanderthal variant rs17486481 was identified as a donor gain that introduced a canonical 5' splice site leading to nonsense-mediated decay of the mRNA. It was a rare allele within modern human populations.
title: Resurrecting the Alternative Splicing Landscape of Archaic Hominins using Machine Learning

finding: The SNP rs373863828 was associated with increased odds of obesity, evidenced by an odds ratio of 1.305 per copy in Samoan populations. Importantly, this variant also suggested a paradoxical association with decreased odds of diabetes (odds ratio of 0.586 after controlling for BMI), indicating a dual role in obesity risk and protection against diabetes.
title: A murine model of the human CREBRFR457Q obesity-risk variant does not influence energy or glucose homeostasis in response to nutritional stress

finding: This SNP was the most significantly associated variant related to the age at onset of MS with a p-value of 6.9×10^-7, indicating its role in influencing earlier onset.
title: A higher burden of multiple sclerosis genetic risk confers an earlier onset

finding: The SNP rs55715053 was identified in the genome-wide association study (GWAS) related to thoracic aortic length and segment 1+2 length. It was one of the significant variants that overlapped with enhancer histone modification tracks, suggesting its potential role in aortic structure.
title: Thoracic Aortic 3-Dimensional Geometry: Effects of Aging and Genetic Determinants

finding: The SNP rs73348287 was similarly identified in GWAS results influencing thoracic aortic length and segment 1+2 length. It was highlighted as a significant variant that overlapped with enhancer histone modification tracks, linking it to aortic structural characteristics.
title: Thoracic Aortic 3-Dimensional Geometry: Effects of Aging and Genetic Determinants

finding: For SNP rs13184720, a significant finding indicated its association with the invasive phenotype of CAFs, suggesting a role in cancer metastasis in breast cancer. This provided insights into how genetic variations could impact fibroblast behavior in tumor progression.
title: Hybrid computational modeling highlights reverse Warburg effect in breast cancer-associated fibroblasts

finding: The study found that the SNP rs13164242 was associated with the expression levels of YAP, which was linked to the spindle assembly checkpoint mechanism in breast cancer. This relationship highlighted the SNP's role in the modulation of chromosomal instability (CIN) through the YAP/TEAD complex, thus demonstrating its significance in tumorigenesis associated with CIN.
title: YAP promotes chromosomal instability by transcriptionally activating AJUBA through its super enhancer in breast cancer

finding: The SNP rs1363974 displayed a significant eQTL effect (p = 1.33 x 10^-76) and was predicted to be shared across multiple immune cells. It served as a genetic determinant of neutrophil and lymphocyte percentages, indicating significant contributions to immune cell composition.
title: Natural Killer cells demonstrate distinct eQTL and transcriptome-wide disease associations, highlighting their role in autoimmunity

finding: Associated with NR2F1-AS1, this SNP influenced functional connectivity traits, marking its importance in brain activity regulation.
title: Common variants contribute to intrinsic human brain functional networks

finding: The SNP rs30187 was associated with the gene ERAP1, which has eQTLs noted to have connections to psoriasis GWAS hits. This demonstrated a significant link between this SNP and the gene's regulation in psoriasis.
title: BaseQTL: a Bayesian method to detect eQTLs from RNA-seq data with or without genotypes

finding: The SNP rs469758 was found to be a proxy with an r² of 1 to previously reported eQTLs in psoriasis, reinforcing its association with psoriasis-related gene expression and supporting its relevance in the genomic landscape of the condition.
title: BaseQTL: a Bayesian method to detect eQTLs from RNA-seq data with or without genotypes

finding: The apaQTL at rs56219066 in the ELL2 gene was linked to increased usage of an intronic polyadenylation site and was also correlated with an increased risk for multiple myeloma, highlighting the potential role of these genetic variants in cancer predisposition via effects on gene regulation.
title: Alternative polyadenylation mediates genetic regulation of gene expression

finding: The rs3822568 SNP in the HOMER1 gene was found to be associated with several polysomnographic parameters in a Brazilian population. Individuals with the GG genotype exhibited increased sleep latency (20.48 minutes), decreased sleep efficiency (80.56%), fewer arousals per hour (13.27), and a lower apnea-hypopnea index (6.63) compared to individuals with AG and AA genotypes. Additionally, GG carriers displayed lower theta spectral power during sleep, particularly in stages 1 and REM, indicating that the SNP might influence sleep quality and structure.
title: A single nucleotide polymorphism in the HOMER1 gene is associated with sleep latency and theta power in sleep electroencephalogram

finding: This SNP was associated with positive selection signals indicating adaptation to psychosocial stress during the spread of anatomically modern humans (AMHs). Its non-risk allele exhibited a positive selection signal with an estimated operation duration of 33,621 years in African populations.
title: Global adaptive evolution involved in neuroticism and educational behaviors through the spread of anatomically modern humans

finding: The DHFR variant rs434130 was associated with cancer survival as well as ICB response, indicating its relevance to outcomes in cancer therapy.
title: Germline modifiers of the tumor immune microenvironment implicate drivers of cancer risk and immunotherapy response

finding: The SNP rs10070213 was associated with the regulation of the p53 tumor suppressor pathway, which has been implicated in the adaptation of cancer cells to the tumor microenvironment. The presence of this SNP was observed in the context of oncovirus-induced cancers, indicating its potential role in modulating anti-cancer immune responses and contributing to cancer progression through features such as Epithelial-Mesenchymal Transition (EMT) and metabolic reprogramming.
title: Partial EMT and associated changes in cellular plasticity in oncovirus-positive samples

finding: SNP rs10472291 was associated with diverticular disease in the study, contributing to the identification of genetic risk factors for this condition.
title: Multi-ancestry Genome- and Phenome-wide Association Studies of Diverticular Disease in Electronic Health Records with Natural Language Processing enriched phenotype algorithm

finding: The variant chr5:132389258:T:C in the SLC22A5 locus was linked to CSF levels of hypaphorine (P=1.52e-12). This was noted as a novel finding for CSF analysis.
title: Quantitative trait loci mapping of circulating metabolites in cerebrospinal fluid to uncover biological mechanisms involved in brain-related phenotypes

finding: Possessing the alternative allele for SNP rs2736100 was associated with shorter telomeres, further emphasizing this SNP's role in biological aging through its effect on telomere length.
title: Markers, Mechanisms and Metrics of Biological Aging: A Scoping Review

finding: The SNP rs10040126 was associated with drug resistance mechanisms in triple negative breast cancer (TNBC) as inferred from the study on copy number variation and its effect on transcriptional states. While the specific relation to drug resistance was not directly detailed, the findings from related literature suggested that variations in this SNP may contribute to the development of resistance to chemotherapy, particularly in the context of hypoxia and other genomic factors.
title: Single cell decoding of drug induced transcriptomic reprogramming in triple negative breast cancers

finding: The SNP rs10061788 was associated with educational attainment (EA) and was related to cerebral cortex and hippocampal mossy fiber morphology. This finding highlighted its relevance in the context of brain development and indicated a genetic influence on educational outcomes.
title: Educational attainment impacts drinking behaviors and risk for alcohol dependence: results from a two-sample Mendelian randomization study with ~780 000 participants

finding: The MDD-specific deepSNP rs163105 contributed to the expression variation of SKIV2L2, demonstrating the potential regulatory mechanisms influencing MDD.
title: DeepWAS: Multivariate genotype-phenotype associations by directly integrating regulatory information using deep learning

finding: The variant rs154001 was identified as a missense change leading to the same amino acid change in both humans and cattle. It was associated with height and was part of 11 variants that were more likely to have direct orthologues in cattle, exhibiting the same effect direction.
title: The conservation of human functional variants and their effects across mammals

finding: The rs4704864 variant, an eQTL for NIPAL4, disrupted a JUN motif leading to reduced transcriptional activity in skin keratinocytes. Gene editing demonstrated that this SNV resulted in decreased NIPAL4 expression, implicating it in skin disease risk.
title: Disease-Linked Regulatory DNA Variants and Homeostatic Transcription Factors in Epidermis

finding: Located in an intron of VCAN, this SNP was strongly associated with diffusion measures in white matter.
title: Brain aging comprises multiple modes of structural and functional change with distinct genetic and biophysical associations

finding: Another SNP in VCAN associated with changes in brain structure, reinforcing the connection to white matter diffusion.
title: Brain aging comprises multiple modes of structural and functional change with distinct genetic and biophysical associations

finding: The G allele of rs35407, a 3 Prime UTR Variant in SLC45A2, was associated with a higher risk of not knowing how many times someone suffered painful sunburn as a child. This SNP was also linked to increased risk for melanoma and cutaneous squamous cell carcinoma, illustrating a potential health-related influence on the item nonresponse behavior.
title: Patterns of item nonresponse behavior to survey questionnaires are systematic and have a genetic basis

finding: The SNP rs4958561 was identified in a genomic region showing a positive relationship with morning person status (R = +0.91). The associated Neanderthal alleles were found to negatively regulate the expression of NMUR2, supporting a hypothesis that these introgressed variants contributed to increased morning person propensity.
title: Quantifying the contribution of Neanderthal introgression to the heritability of complex traits

finding: The study found that the SNP rs2287987, which corresponds to the 349V variant, exhibited significant frequency variations among different populations, particularly in the AFR population. While this SNP is associated with allotype 10, suggesting a link to lower ERAP1 activity, it was frequently found within uncharacterized allotypes in the AFR population. This implied a connection between the genetic variant and the predisposition to immune response variability.
title: Common allotypes of ER aminopeptidase 1 have substrate-dependent and highly variable enzymatic properties

finding: The SNP rs2549782 was noted to change a single amino acid near the catalytic center of the ERAP2 enzyme, which in turn influenced ERAP2's activity and specificity. This finding underlined the importance of this missense SNP in understanding the functional dynamics of ERAP2 in antigen processing.
title: Common allotypes of ER aminopeptidase 1 have substrate-dependent and highly variable enzymatic properties

finding: The SNP rs2248374 was associated with ERAP2 expression levels. The study highlighted that the G allele of this SNP led to no detectable expression of ERAP2 protein, suggesting significant repercussions for individuals homozygous for this variant. This loss of expression was particularly noteworthy, as it essentially eliminated the enzyme's contribution to immune function.
title: Common allotypes of ER aminopeptidase 1 have substrate-dependent and highly variable enzymatic properties

finding: The SNP rs4594899 had a significant association with urinary tyrosine levels (P = 6.6 × 10^-9, N = 5447). This SNP was located in the LINC02142 gene, which encodes a long intergenic non-coding RNA, although its specific functions were previously unknown. Past studies linked this region to cognitive and behavioral traits, with potential implications for dopamine synthesis.
title: Meta-Analysis of Urinary Metabolite GWAS Studies Identifies Three Novel Genome-Wide Significant Loci

finding: The SNP rs79053399 was significantly associated with urinary 3-aminoisobutyrate levels (P = 6.9 × 10^-10, N = 4656). It is an intronic variant of the RAI14 gene, which relates to cell motility and other cellular functions, suggesting a novel metabolic link to 3-aminoisobutyrate.
title: Meta-Analysis of Urinary Metabolite GWAS Studies Identifies Three Novel Genome-Wide Significant Loci

finding: The SNP rs10060194 was associated with TGF-β signaling in T cells, particularly implicating its role in cancer immunotherapy. This finding supported the notion that variations at this locus could influence T cell biology, thus impacting therapeutic approaches in oncology.
title: FLOW: maximum flow framework for the identification of factors mediating the signaling convergence of multiple receptors

finding: The variant rs78191176 was identified as having a high causal probability (PP=0.87) and was found to be associated with COVID-19 severity, showing regulatory activity specifically in CD14+ monocytes enriched for the risk variant. This variant overlapped with a region exhibiting strong regulatory signals in COVID-19 risk-variant enriched cells, but was absent in depleted cells. Additionally, two genes, MAT2B and CCNG1, located near this variant, were associated with COVID-19 severity and showed higher gene scores in enriched cells.
title: Variant to function mapping at single-cell resolution through network propagation

finding: The SNP rs13184510 was identified as a positive and original finding related to the role of NSD2 in the context of pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma (PDAC). Specifically, the study linked NSD2 with tumor suppression in Kras-driven pancreatic tumorigenesis, indicating that variations at this SNP could affect NSD2 expression levels. Consequently, low NSD2 levels, possibly associated with rs13184510 genotypes, correlated with more aggressive features of PDAC, emphasizing its potential as a biomarker and the critical mechanism underlying NSD2's regulation of inflammation and NF-κB signaling during pancreatic tumorigenesis.
title: Multilevel regulation of NF-κB signaling by NSD2 suppresses Kras-driven pancreatic tumorigenesis

finding: The CD-risk allele rs2188962 had an estimated selection coefficient of 0.022 and was noted for its increase in frequency, contributing to inflammatory bowel disease (IBD) risk.
title: Genetic adaptation to pathogens and increased risk of inflammatory disorders in post-Neolithic Europe

finding: The SNP rs6897932 (C/T) was associated with increased risk of multiple sclerosis (MS), primarily due to the MS risk 'C' allele which enhanced exclusion of exon 6 in IL7R transcripts. This exclusion increased the production of the soluble isoform of IL7R (sIL7R), thereby promoting T cell expansion and disease progression. This effect was shown to be dose-dependent, with homozygous 'C' allele individuals exhibiting the highest levels of exon 6 exclusion and sIL7R secretion.
title: Antisense modulation of IL7R splicing to control sIL7R expression in human CD4+ T cells

finding: The SNP rs2291418 was associated with a G-quadruplex structure in pre-miRNA-1229. The study indicated that this variation, which was linked to Alzheimer's disease, had implications for the maturation of miRNA-1229. This finding highlighted how alterations in miRNA maturation could be influenced by genetic variants, particularly in the context of neurodegenerative diseases.
title: The Apurinic/Apyrimidinic Endodeoxyribonuclease 1 is an RNA G-quadruplex binding protein and regulates miR-92b expression in cancer cells

finding: The rs1064793022 SNP was identified as a pathogenic intronic splice variant associated with the APC gene, which plays a crucial role in colorectal cancer (CRC) development. Its alterations were noted in patient-derived organoids and contributed to understanding the genetic landscape of CRC.
title: Utilizing a dual endogenous reporter system to identify functional regulators of aberrant stem cell and differentiation activity in colorectal cancer

finding: The SNP rs4307059, located in the intergenic region between CDH10 and CDH9, exhibited a strong association with ASD, as suggested by several genome-wide association studies (GWAS). However, this genotype did not correlate with the expression of CDH9 or CDH10 in adult brains, indicating that its role in ASD may not directly relate to these cadherins in adults.
title: Identification of CDH11 as an ASD risk gene by matched-gene co-expression analysis and mouse behavioral studies

finding: The SNP rs702634 was found in an FAP-specific caQTL colocalizing with the T2D GWAS signal for the ARL15 locus, suggesting it plays a role in the regulation of the FST gene, which is involved in muscle growth and metabolism.
title: Population-scale skeletal muscle single-nucleus multi-omic profiling reveals extensive context specific genetic regulation

finding: The SNP rs16901246 was associated with the family Barnesiellaceae in the GEM replication sample, showing a consistent causal effect direction (beta=-7.34×10^-3) and a significant p-value of 0.03. This SNP is located in the intron region of the CTNND2 gene on chromosome 5, further supporting its association with the family and trunk fat mass.
title: Mendelian randomization analysis revealed causal effects from gut microbiota to abdominal obesity

finding: SNP rs2563249 displayed both universal and testis-specific effects as an eQTL for the gene CD14, indicating a complex regulatory role in different tissues.
title: Mechanisms of tissue-specific genetic regulation revealed by latent factors across eQTLs

finding: The SNP rs16891982 at the SLC45A2 locus showed the strongest evidence for selection across analyses, indicating its substantial role in skin pigmentation. However, this finding did not necessarily imply continuous positive selection throughout the entire time transect.
title: The evolution of skin pigmentation associated variation in West Eurasia

finding: This SNP was tied to IL6ST expression, providing insights into its role in Treg function in autoimmune conditions.
title: 3DFAACTS-SNP: Using regulatory T cell-specific epigenomics data to uncover candidate mechanisms of Type-1 Diabetes (T1D) risk

finding: The SNP rs13174434 was associated with the PI3K pathway in pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma, indicating a genetic basis for targeted therapy strategies in managing this aggressive cancer.
title: Multi-omic analysis of HDAC1 function in pancreatic cancer reveals altered GTPase activity impacting chemoresistance

finding: This SNP caused a substitution from isoleucine (I) to threonine (T) in the FOXI1 transcription factor, impacting its function.
title: Same role but different actors: genetic regulation of post-translational modification of two distinct proteins

finding: In the study of pediatric patients with uveitis, the frequencies of the CC genotype and C allele of miR-146a's rs2910164 were significantly decreased in patients compared to healthy controls, indicating that miR-146a may be a susceptibility factor for pediatric uveitis.
title: Exploring MicroRNA Signatures in Pediatric Non-infectious Uveitis: Meta-Analysis and Molecular Profiling of Patient Samples

finding: The SNP rs6295 was associated with psychiatric illness and differences in transcription related to the functional serotonin 1A receptor. This finding linked the genetic variant to the neurobiological mechanisms indicated in the study of Early Life Adversity (ELA) and its effects on serotonin signaling, stress responses, and coping mechanisms.
title: Sex-specific and Developmental Effects of Early Life Adversity on Stress Reactivity are Rescued by Postnatal Knockdown of 5-HT1A Autoreceptors

finding: The SNP rs549656827 was noted as an intergenic variant on chromosome 5 associated with any psychotic experience as well. It displayed an odds ratio (OR) of 0.61 with a p-value of 3.30 x 10^-8, suggesting a potential protective effect against developing psychotic experiences.
title: Genetic association study of psychotic experiences in UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs2861139 was located in an intergenic region on chromosome 5 and had a p-value of 2.6×10−9. Its status as a significant finding highlighted its potential involvement in Lifetime Anxiety Disorder.
title: A Major Role for Common Genetic Variation in Anxiety Disorders

finding: The SNP rs7723509 was identified in an intergenic region on chromosome 5. This SNP was significant in the larger meta-analysis of Lifetime Anxiety Disorder cases, contributing further to the understanding of the genetic underpinnings of anxiety disorders.
title: A Major Role for Common Genetic Variation in Anxiety Disorders

finding: The rs28777 SNP in the <italic>SLC45A2</italic> gene was found to be significantly associated with average SpO<sub>2</sub> in individuals of European ancestry, with a combined p-value of 8.08 × 10<sup>−10</sup>. This SNP was noted for being in a splicing regulatory element showing high population differentiation.
title: Whole-Genome Association Analyses of Sleep-disordered Breathing Phenotypes in the NHLBI TOPMed Program

finding: The SNP rs190982 located at the MEF2C locus was significantly associated with ADHD risk, as indicated by its presence in the diagnostic gene panel of 396 autosomal ID genes tested in a large ADHD meta-analysis involving 19,210 individuals. This finding highlighted MEF2C as a novel candidate gene contributing to ADHD.
title: Intellectual Disability-related genes increase ADHD risk and locomotor activity in Drosophila

finding: The study indicated that a germline mutation in FGFR4, specifically the SNP rs351855, was shown to enhance STAT3 signalling, which promoted immune evasion in transgenic knock-in models of lung and breast cancers. This finding was relevant in the context of HIP1 overexpression, as it pointed towards a potential mechanism by which HIP1 may also contribute to immune evasion in cancer cells.
title: HIP1 mediates oncogenic transformation and cancer progression through STAT3 signalling

finding: The finding related to the SNP rs13174276 indicated that the overexpression of USP22, associated with the variant, did not enhance primary tumor formation in mice bearing the MMTV-NIC transgene but resulted in increased lung metastases. Importantly, the deletion of Usp22 significantly decreased tumor burden and increased the survival of these mice, correlating with reduced levels of both Erbb2 mRNA and protein. The study highlighted that while rs13174276 was connected to USP22 overexpression, it did not impact ERBB2 expression in various cellular contexts, suggesting a specific regulatory role that could be influenced by this SNP.
title: USP22 overexpression fails to augment tumor formation in MMTV-ERBB2 mice but loss of function impacts MMTV promoter activity

finding: The SNP rs2736100 was associated with multiple traits, including cancers such as lung cancer and glioma. It was identified in the current study as being associated with IEAA and was one of the four SNPs linked to 16 unique traits.
title: Genome-wide association studies identify 137 loci for DNA methylation biomarkers of ageing

finding: This SNP was established in the context of vitiligo-melanoma associations and demonstrated a relationship between the two conditions.
title: Autoimmune Alleles at the Major Histocompatibility Locus Modify Melanoma Susceptibility

finding: The SNP rs4704171, located in the ANKRD31 locus, was identified as a new genome-wide significant finding in the meta-analysis of the GR@ACE study combined with existing datasets for Alzheimer's Disease (AD). It showed an odds ratio (OR) of 1.19 and a p-value of 2.78 x 10^-8, indicating a potential association with late-onset Alzheimer's Disease (LOAD).
title: Genome-wide association analysis of dementia and its clinical endophenotypes reveal novel loci associated with Alzheimer’s disease and three causality networks of AD: the GR@ACE project

finding: The SNP rs10060180 was associated with high expression of the KIAA0100 gene, which was implicated in breast-cancer aggressiveness, particularly in the context of recurrent amplifications identified in Hispanic/Latina breast tumors. This finding highlighted a potential correlation between the genetic variant and cancer cell behavior, emphasizing the need for further research into its impact on treatment response and survival for this demographic.
title: Profile of the somatic mutational landscape in breast tumors from Hispanic/Latina women

finding: The SNP rs10060157 was associated with the response to targeted therapy in metastatic melanoma, particularly in the context of BRAF(V600E) inhibition. This finding related to the mechanisms of drug resistance, which implicate the signaling pathways involving ERK1/2 and their role in cancer progression.
