Specifically, the analysis tied the SNP to variations in treatment efficacy, suggesting that genetic variants may influence the outcome of therapies that target these pathways.
title: A Novel Selective ERK1/2 Inhibitor, Laxiflorin B, Targets EGFR Mutation Subtypes in Non-small-cell Lung Cancer

finding: The SNP in ERCC8 was assigned due to association with a conserved position related to breast cancer.
title: Predicting functionally important breast cancer SNPs using pleiotropy, conservation, and protein structure

finding: The SNP rs13175330 was positively associated with hypertension in a Korean population, indicating a significant genetic link between the PAM gene polymorphism and the risk of developing hypertension.
title: A Single Membrane Protein Required for Atrial Secretory Granule Formation

finding: The study identified that SNP rs494958 was located within a putative transcriptional enhancer region of the gene SRD5A1, which was significantly more methylated in the ovaries of DSS-treated mice than in controls. This SNP had been previously associated with age at natural menopause, suggesting a link between the methylation patterns observed and reproductive traits influenced by environmental factors.
title: Early-life environment programs reproductive strategies through epigenetic regulation of SRD5A1

finding: The rs75335466-T allele was associated with reduced expression of miR-146a-5p specifically upon stimulation by LPS and R848 in individuals of African ancestry, demonstrating a genetic variant that influences immune response in this population.
title: Population variation of miRNAs and isomiRs and their impact on human immunity to infection

finding: The rs2910164 G allele was linked to increased expression of miR-146a-3p and a significant shift in both the start and end sites of the mature miRNA, leading to a loss of 2,273 predicted targets (73%) and gain of 2,352 novel targets, significantly affecting immune response variability.
title: Population variation of miRNAs and isomiRs and their impact on human immunity to infection

finding: rs12658032 demonstrated a strong association with both ADHD (p=1.15×10⁻⁷) and MDD (p=1.18×10⁻¹⁰) in the meta-analysis, with an overall p-meta of 1.54×10⁻¹⁶. It was located in a genomic region with no protein-coding genes but showed associations with various health phenotypes, including depressive symptoms and bipolar disorder.
title: Investigating regions of shared genetic variation in attention deficit/hyperactivity disorder and major depressive disorder: A GWAS meta-analysis

finding: This SNP showed regulatory effects on SNHG18 gene expression when subjected to CRISPR interference, further confirming its role in CAD-associated loci.
title: Comprehensive identification of coronary artery disease-associated variants regulating vascular smooth muscle cell gene expression

finding: The variant rs77010315, a missense variant in SLC36A2, was found to increase the transport of alanine into cells, resulting in decreased blood levels of alanine but increased intracellular levels, thus leading to increased isoleucine levels contrary to the overall positive genetic correlation.
title: Integrative analysis of metabolite GWAS illuminates the molecular basis of pleiotropy and genetic correlation

finding: This variant was reported as being associated with other behavioral traits, thereby illustrating the shared genetic influences surrounding addiction traits, including nicotine dependence.
title: Expanding the Genetic Architecture of Nicotine Dependence and its Shared Genetics with Multiple Traits: Findings from the Nicotine Dependence GenOmics (iNDiGO) Consortium

finding: The rs6453393 variant was identified as the lead cis-eQTL for SCAMP1, a gene involved in cytokine secretion, vesicular trafficking, and membrane transport. It exhibited a strong genetic effect unique to CD14+ monocytes in COVID-19 patients, with a low false discovery rate (lfsr = 2.5 x 10^-7), indicating its significant role in shaping the monocyte response to SARS-CoV-2 infection.
title: Widespread gene-environment interactions shape the immune response to SARS-CoV-2 infection in hospitalized COVID-19 patients

finding: RS1216565 was found within the LNPEP/ERAP2 locus at chr5:96,929,854-96,931,091. It was similarly identified as an intergenic enhancer. Although data showed its influence on gene expression, the specific outcomes associated with CRISPRi modulation were not detailed.
title: A Systematic Strategy for Identifying Causal Single Nucleotide Polymorphisms and Their Target Genes on Juvenile Arthritis Risk Haplotypes

finding: The research demonstrated the role of LMP1 in altering metabolic dependencies in Burkitt lymphoma cells, which was supported by findings in the work of Shair et al. in 'Cancers', indicating that LMP1-induced metabolic changes could be targeted for therapeutic interventions.
title: Epstein-Barr Virus Latent Membrane Protein 1 Subverts IMPDH pathways to drive B-cell oncometabolism

finding: The SNP rs2445874 was identified in the gene VCAN, and showed significant linkage with parameters of white matter microstructure, suggesting possible causal effects.
title: The comprehensive genetic architecture of brain white matter

finding: Fine mapping revealed that SNP rs3852188, located in VCAN, was associated with white matter microstructural traits, contributing to the complex genetics of these traits.
title: The comprehensive genetic architecture of brain white matter

finding: The SNP rs3931702 was associated with traits assessed through DTI parameters in the VCAN locus, lending support to its role in white matter variations.
title: The comprehensive genetic architecture of brain white matter

finding: In the context of DTI parameters, rs7733216 was significant within the VCAN region, highlighting its relevance in white matter microstructure.
title: The comprehensive genetic architecture of brain white matter

finding: The rs4263535 SNP in the GABRA1 gene intron 4 was positively associated with deeper sedation effects when patients were administered intravenous midazolam. This finding suggested a functional impact of the SNP on GABRA1-related sedation response in the context of pharmacogenetics.
title: Characterization of the zebrafish gabra1sa43718/sa43718 germline loss of function allele confirms a function for Gabra1 in motility and nervous system development

finding: The male-specific locus rs2549003, located on chromosome 5, showed a significant association with asthma in the meta-analysis (overall P=2.0×10^-14). Notably, the association signal was derived equally from both men and women, suggesting balanced genetic contributions to asthma risk across sexes.
title: Large-scale Genetic Analysis Identifies 66 Novel Loci for Asthma

finding: The SNP rs13153825 was linked to the assessment of deep learning-based detection of ICOS protein expression in colon cancer. This finding indicated that genetic alterations detected through this SNP may correlate with protein expression profiles relevant to the prognosis and treatment response in colorectal tumors, suggesting its potential utility in computational pathology.
title: The future of artificial intelligence in digital pathology - results of a survey across stakeholder groups

finding: This SNP was linked to Barrett's oesophagus and identified within a peak unique to developmental epithelial cells. It was also shown to predict reduced regulatory activity by creating a potential repressor binding site for ZNF18, further implicating it in the regulatory networks of BO.
title: The metaplastic precursor state to oesophageal adenocarcinoma represents reversion to a transient epithelial cell state in the developing oesophagus

finding: The SNP rs11745375, located in FGF18, was significantly correlated with FEV1/FVC (p-value of 1.6×10^-11), supporting its contribution to lung function and pathways associated with lung cancer.
title: Immune-mediated genetic pathways resulting in pulmonary function impairment increase lung cancer susceptibility

finding: The SNP rs10040093 was identified as being significant in the context of activator protein-1 (AP-1) family members, which play a role in CD30-positive lymphomas. This finding connected to the study of how distinct pathways and mutations shared between neurodevelopmental disorders and cancers, suggesting a relationship between immune responses and these health conditions.
title: Neurodevelopmental disorders and cancer networks share pathways; but differ in mechanisms, signaling strength, and outcome

finding: The SNP rs17070145 was identified as being associated with episodic memory in the early stages of a human neurodevelopmental disorder, demonstrating KIBRA's role in memory-related cognitive functions.
title: PICK1 links KIBRA and AMPA receptors in coiled-coil-driven supramolecular complexes

finding: rs2736100 was identified as the lead variant associated with longer leukocyte telomere length, and it was also highly associated with increased MPN risk, showing a connection between telomere length and MPN acquisition.
title: Genetic predisposition to myeloproliferative neoplasms implicates hematopoietic stem cell biology

finding: This variant exhibited a strong association with MPN risk and was located within the TERT locus, demonstrating a potential common genetic signal with rs2736100 for both MPN and telomere length.
title: Genetic predisposition to myeloproliferative neoplasms implicates hematopoietic stem cell biology

finding: This SNP in the UGT3A1 gene was associated with 5alpha-pregnan-3beta, again linking it to steroid metabolism.
title: Genetic Architecture and Analysis Practices of Circulating Metabolites in the NHLBI Trans-Omics for Precision Medicine (TOPMed) Program

finding: The variant rs4957144, found in the intronic region of the C7 gene, served as a significant lead SNP in the analysis linking MSA with autoimmune diseases. It showed a CADD score indicative of potential deleterious effects. Additionally, substantial evidence of eQTL colocalization was noted, with this variant being linked to expression levels of several genes including TTC33 and RPL37, particularly in blood and brain tissues.
title: A genome-wide genetic pleiotropy approach identified shared loci between multiple system atrophy and inflammatory bowel disease

finding: The rs16891982 SNP was linked to dark hair and increased skin pigmentation. Fourteen of the 42 individuals analyzed carried only the C allele of this SNP.
title: Neolithic genomes reveal a distinct ancient HLA allele pool and population transformation in Europe

finding: The variant rs10463311, associated with the <italic>TNIP1</italic> gene, was included in the analysis to test its contribution to ALS genetic risk loci.
title: Genetic analysis of amyotrophic lateral sclerosis identifies contributing pathways and cell types

finding: The rs6450176 SNP was associated with serum lipid levels in the Jing and Han populations. This finding suggested a genetic influence of the ARL15 gene on lipid metabolism, which could implicate its role in cardiovascular diseases. The context of this association underscores the importance of genetic factors in regulating lipid profiles.
title: Arl15 upregulates the TGFβ family signaling by promoting the assembly of the Smad-complex

finding: This SNP tagged variants related to broadly defined depression, consistent with prior GWAS results.
title: Multivariate GWAS of psychiatric disorders and their cardinal symptoms reveal two dimensions of cross-cutting genetic liabilities

finding: The rs13175330 A>G polymorphism in the PAM gene was associated with hypertension in a population study from Korea.
title: The Identification of Key Genes and Biological Pathways in Polycystic Ovary Syndrome and its Complications by Next Generation Squancing (NGS) and Bioinformatics Analysis

finding: The Drosha rs10719 T>C polymorphism was associated with susceptibility to preeclampsia.
title: The Identification of Key Genes and Biological Pathways in Polycystic Ovary Syndrome and its Complications by Next Generation Squancing (NGS) and Bioinformatics Analysis

finding: The SNP rs72773986 functioned as a GTEx eQTL for the ERAP2 gene, which is implicated in immune response. It was predicted to affect transcription factor EPAS1 binding, critical for hypoxic response, and was associated with susceptibility to Crohn’s disease, thereby linking it to differential responses to infectious diseases.
title: A signature of Neanderthal introgression on molecular mechanisms of environmental responses

finding: This SNP was part of a haplotype that influenced statin efficacy, leading to an alternatively spliced HMGCR transcript that was less sensitive to inhibition by simvastatin/pravastatin.
title: MicroRNA-27a mitigates hyperlipidemia and atherosclerosis by modulating cholesterol homeostasis

finding: As part of the haplotype influencing statin efficacy, this SNP contributed to the generation of an HMGCR transcript that exhibited lower sensitivity to statin inhibition.
title: MicroRNA-27a mitigates hyperlipidemia and atherosclerosis by modulating cholesterol homeostasis

finding: Included in the haplotype associated with altered sensitivity to statins, this SNP was critical to understanding differential statin responses among individuals.
title: MicroRNA-27a mitigates hyperlipidemia and atherosclerosis by modulating cholesterol homeostasis

finding: The missense mutation rs373863828 in the CREBRF gene was found to be significantly associated with greater average height in Samoan adults, showing an increase of 0.77 cm in height for each copy of the minor A allele. This positive association was also corroborated in a separate cohort of Samoan children, wherein each copy of the A allele corresponded to an estimated increase of 0.38 in height z-score. Previously, this SNP was initially identified for its association with higher body mass index (BMI), highlighting its role in influencing overall body size and stature.
title: A missense variant in CREBRF is associated with taller stature in Samoans

finding: The study identified the GPR151 p.Arg95Ter loss-of-function variant (rs114285050) as associated with reduced BMI and lower risk of type 2 diabetes (T2D) in carrier individuals. These associations were validated by larger independent GWAS studies. Furthermore, carriers of this variant exhibited improved lipid profiles, demonstrated by reduced triglycerides and increased HDL cholesterol levels, as well as a reduced waist-hip ratio adjusted for BMI. Additionally, there was evidence suggesting the association of the GPR151 loss-of-function variant with favorable glycemic traits, including nominally reduced fasting glucose and fasting insulin. Therefore, the findings indicated that individuals possessing the GPR151 mutation experienced improved metabolic health.
title: G protein-coupled receptor 151 regulates glucose metabolism and hepatic gluconeogenesis

finding: This SNP was identified as a putative brain eQTL for SRA1, indicating its role in regulating noncoding RNA involved in nuclear receptor activation.
title: Sex significantly impacts the function of major depression-linked variants in vivo

finding: Similar to rs2563323, this SNP was linked to brain eQTL activity for SRA1, implicating its involvement in the regulation of noncoding RNA associated with nuclear receptors.
title: Sex significantly impacts the function of major depression-linked variants in vivo

finding: The SNP rs185531658 was identified as a significant risk factor for congenital heart disease (CHD) in a study population that included 4,034 Caucasian CHD patients. It reached genome-wide significance with an odds ratio (OR) of 2.16 and p-value of 5.28×10^-9. This SNP was also strongly associated with septal defects, indicating its relevance across multiple CHD phenotypes.
title: Genome-wide association study in European patients with congenital heart disease identifies risk loci for transposition of the great arteries and anomalies of the thoracic arteries and veins and expression of discovered candidate genes in the developing heart

finding: The SNP rs13153676 was associated with the research on targeted alpha-particle radiotherapy and immune checkpoint inhibitors, potentially influencing the response of malignant melanoma to such therapies. The context indicated cooperative inhibition on tumor growth, although the direct linkage to specific biomarker responses in chronic kidney disease (CKD) or acute kidney injury (AKI) mechanisms detailed in the findings of the study wasn’t explicitly detailed.
title: Pre-clinical Evaluation of Biomarkers for Early Detection of Nephrotoxicity Following Alpha-particle Radioligand Therapy

finding: The SNP rs10070219 was linked to the regulation of the inflammatory tumor microenvironment in relation to TP53 mutations. Specifically, the findings illustrated how TP53 mutations could potentially influence tumor suppression and interact with immune system pathways in non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC), correlating with previous insights that the TP53 gene frequently harbored mutations across various cancers.
title: A cellular and spatial atlas of TP53-associated tissue remodeling in lung adenocarcinoma

finding: The SNP rs10070213 was associated with the p53 tumor suppressor pathway's deregulation in human cancers. This was linked to the impact of human oncoviruses, including gammaherpesviruses, on the regulation of p53 activity, supporting the role of this pathway in viral manipulation and tumorigenesis.
title: Intrinsic p53 Activation Restricts Gammaherpesvirus-Driven Germinal Center B Cell Expansion during Latency Establishment

finding: The SNP rs10060178 was highlighted in findings that described the relationship between p53 and viral oncogenesis. Specifically, this SNP was associated with the reactivation of p53 pathways in response to gammaherpesviral infection, reinforcing the idea that p53 functions as a crucial host factor limiting viral proliferation and division in infected B cells.
title: Intrinsic p53 Activation Restricts Gammaherpesvirus-Driven Germinal Center B Cell Expansion during Latency Establishment

finding: This splicing variant in <italic>TERT</italic> resulted in the truncated protein INS1b, which decreased telomerase activity, associated with increased DNA damage response and breast cancer risk.
title: Fine-mapping of 150 breast cancer risk regions identifies 178 high confidence target genes

finding: The SNP rs16891982 in the gene SLC45A2, when analyzed alongside HERC2 (rs12913832), demonstrated a significant interaction affecting eye color in Europeans. This supported the concept that coordinated allelic differences are indicative of underlying epistatic relationships across populations.
title: Detection of complex genetic architecture using two-locus population differentiation: modeling epistasis

finding: The SNP rs10078588 within the TENM2 gene showed a significant association with food and liquid intake including alcohol and was linked to trunk fat percent and smoking. Additionally, it was associated with disorders of lipoprotein metabolism.
title: Evidence for Involvement of WDPCP Gene in Alcohol Consumption, Lipid Metabolism, and Liver Cirrhosis

finding: The SNP rs10070239 was associated with prostate cancer progression through mechanisms dependent and independent of S100A4, as presented in the study by Ruma et al. (2018). This finding contributed to the understanding of cancer biology, particularly in the context of how certain SNPs can influence tumor behavior.
title: Dual role of CASP8AP2/FLASH in regulating epithelial-to-mesenchymal (EMT) plasticity

finding: The SNP rs35278 exhibited a replicable association with familial schizophrenia, showing significant over-representation in affected individuals with a p-value of 0.0012 and an odds ratio (OR) of 1.18 (95% CI: 1.06-1.32). It also displayed significant association with bipolar disorder, particularly with liability class 2, indicating a role in psychotic disorders.
title: Variants in regulatory elements of PDE4D associate with Major Mental Illness in the Finnish population

finding: The SNP rs165940 was identified as a key variant associated with major mental illness, with a significant association to schizophrenia (p=0.0016, OR=1.27, 95% CI: 1.13-1.41) and was associated with cognitive domains including verbal learning and memory (p=0.0091). It was also shown to significantly correlate with mRNA expression levels of PDE4D in the cerebellum (p=0.04), suggesting its role as a functional mutation at the PDE4D locus.
title: Variants in regulatory elements of PDE4D associate with Major Mental Illness in the Finnish population

finding: The rs2910497 SNP located on chromosome 15 was associated with the SOHLH2 gene, known for its role in reproductive processes, and represented one of the significant SNPs connected with body height as per the GWAS findings.
title: pCMLM: Genome Wide Association Study of Body Size Traits in Multiple Regions of Yak Based on the Provided Compressed Mixed Linear Model

finding: The breast cancer-associated SNP rs16886397 was classified as a proximal insulator by CoRE-BED and was confirmed via functional validation to target the MAP3K1 gene, highlighting its critical role in breast cancer risk.
title: Minimum entropy framework identifies a novel class of genomic functional elements and reveals regulatory mechanisms at human disease loci

finding: The missense variant rs27895 in ERAP1 was significantly associated with IAV burden in cells and human volunteers. The T allele was linked to higher IAV burden in a human challenge study, correlating with more severe symptoms, particularly at day 6 of the infection.
title: Single-cell genome-wide association reveals a nonsynonymous variant in ERAP1 confers increased susceptibility to influenza virus

finding: The ADRB2 variant Gln27Glu (rs1042714) also did not show significant individual effects on BMI. Nonetheless, it exhibited a significant synergistic effect with LEPR Gln223Arg (rs1137101) for BMI, with a beta of 0.04 and a P value of 0.013. This interaction was even more pronounced in individuals with BMI > 25.
title: The perineurium integrates leptin with its sympathetic outflow to protect against obesity

finding: Mapped to the HBEGF gene, this SNP represented the strongest locus for mean thickness with a beta coefficient of -0.05 and a significant p-value of 8.20 × 10−18.
title: The Genetic Architecture of the Human Corpus Callosum and its Subregions

finding: The SNP rs10060182 was identified as a positive and original finding in relation to breast cancer metastasis, particularly concerning the regulation of cellular dormancy. This SNP was associated with factors influencing long-term quiescence in tumor cells, suggesting its role in the mechanisms of tumor dormancy and the propensity for metastasis.
title: Live Cell Lineage Tracing of Dormant Cancer Cells

finding: The SNP rs530936609 was identified as being associated with structural characteristics of the aortic arch. This association was derived from comprehensive analysis linking it to aortic geometric phenotypes (AGPs) reflective of structural degeneration, which are indicative of cardiovascular diseases (CVD). Specifically, this SNP showed overlap with enhancer histone modification tracks, underscoring its potential regulatory role in the context of aortic structure.
title: Three-dimensional aortic geometry: clinical correlates, prognostic value and genetic architecture

finding: The SNP rs73346354 was also found to be associated with the structure of the aortic arch, in line with findings related to cardiovascular health risks. Similar to rs530936609, it exhibited a significant relationship with AGPs and was linked to enhanced histone modifications, which may suggest functional implications in vascular biology and CVD pathology.
title: Three-dimensional aortic geometry: clinical correlates, prognostic value and genetic architecture

finding: The study found that hypertensive individuals younger than 51 years carrying the ERAP1 rs30187 risk allele exhibited increased salt sensitivity of blood pressure (SSBP) compared to non-carriers. Statistical analysis indicated a significant difference in SSBP elevation among carriers and non-carriers, confirming the earlier findings in animal models that indicated ERAP1's influence on blood pressure regulation.
title: ERAP1 Shows Distinct Regulatory Mechanisms on Blood Pressure Modulation Between Males and Females

finding: The variant rs74567345 was linked to the genetic signals regulating GIN1, PPIP5K2, and PAM, with evidence suggesting that this locus acts through subcutaneous adipose tissues to promote abdominal fat accumulation while concurrently reducing the risk for type 2 diabetes.
title: Predicting mechanisms of action at genetic loci associated with discordant effects on type 2 diabetes and abdominal fat accumulation

finding: This SNP was associated with several cancers, indicating its significant role in cancer susceptibility through its effects on the TP53 pathway.
title: Combining genome-wide studies of breast, prostate, ovarian and endometrial cancers maps cross-cancer susceptibility loci and identifies new genetic associations

finding: The SNP rs17421627 was identified as the lead sentinel SNP at the 5q14.3 locus, which was associated with macular thickness, retinal vascular caliber, and age-related macular degeneration (AMD). It was found to intersect an enhancer that was shown to drive gene expression in the vertebrate retina, and the risk SNP significantly decreased the activity of this enhancer. The cell-class-specific pattern of DNA accessibility at this enhancer was conserved between the human retina and retinal organoids, predominantly accessible in early and late retinal progenitor cells (RPCs) and Müller glia.
title: Multi-omic Analysis of Developing Human Retina and Organoids Reveals Cell-Specific Cis-Regulatory Elements and Mechanisms of Non-Coding Genetic Disease Risk

finding: The SNP rs13164242 was identified as having a positive original finding related to the transcriptional control by YAP and TAZ, which are known to induce various oncogenic processes.
title: Structure-based discovery of a novel small-molecule inhibitor of TEAD palmitoylation with anticancer activity

finding: The SNP rs10060178 related to p53 was identified as a part of the antiviral mechanism involving NRF2 activators and their interaction with the nuclear export factor XPO1. These findings indicated that disruptions in the p53 signaling pathway could influence the efficacy of antiviral treatments targeting influenza A virus.
title: NRF2 activators inhibit influenza A virus replication by interfering with nucleo-cytoplasmic export of viral RNPs in an NRF2-independent manner

finding: This SNP was significantly associated with IBD with the strongest p-value reported of 2.267e-23. The findings suggested that the CRE activities in spatial proximity to this SNP might play a role in the IBD pathology rather than characteristics strictly related to local methylation or chromatin accessibility.
title: GTAGMe-seq: joint profiling of genetic variants, DNA methylation, GpC methyltransferase footprints, and 3D genome in the same DNA molecules

finding: The SNP rs701383 was associated with an onset-hastening effect for HD, linked significantly to increased expression of MSH3, and displayed a deviation from Hardy-Weinberg equilibrium suggestive of its role in hastening onset.
title: Huntington’s disease onset is determined by length of uninterrupted CAG, not encoded polyglutamine, and is modified by DNA maintenance mechanisms

finding: The SNP rs79727797, located within the TCERG1 locus, was found to be associated with delayed onset of HD, supporting prior association claims for this region.
title: Huntington’s disease onset is determined by length of uninterrupted CAG, not encoded polyglutamine, and is modified by DNA maintenance mechanisms

finding: The SNP rs113361582, associated with modifier haplotype 5AM2, displayed robust associations with delayed onset signals in the context of genome-wide analyses.
title: Huntington’s disease onset is determined by length of uninterrupted CAG, not encoded polyglutamine, and is modified by DNA maintenance mechanisms

finding: The SNP rs1650742 defined haplotype 5AM3, linked to significant onset-delaying effects for HD, thus supporting its role as a modifier.
title: Huntington’s disease onset is determined by length of uninterrupted CAG, not encoded polyglutamine, and is modified by DNA maintenance mechanisms

finding: The rs6190 SNP, located within the GR gene (NR3C1), was associated with increased cholesterol levels in women from UK Biobank and All of Us datasets. This SNP, which causes a missense mutation resulting in the amino acid change from arginine to lysine at codon 23, was linked to higher total, LDL, and HDL cholesterol levels. Specifically, the presence of the SNP correlated with increased odds ratios for hypercholesterolemia (1.34) and cardiovascular disease mortality (2.37) in women, particularly highlighting the sex-specific effects of this variant. Mechanistic investigations in transgenic mice showed that the SNP enhanced GR activity, transactivating Pcsk9 and Bhlhe40, which lowered the liver's LDL receptor and Scarb1 levels, ultimately elevating circulating cholesterol and promoting atherosclerosis.
title: The human glucocorticoid receptor variant rs6190 promotes blood cholesterol and atherosclerosis

finding: rs188904275 was associated with mean activity levels during sleep with a p-value of 3.7×10^-8. This SNP was located in the gene JAKMIP2, previously linked to Body Mass Index (BMI) measurements and pulmonary diseases.
title: Automated Feature Extraction from Population Wearable Device Data Identified Novel Loci Associated with Sleep and Circadian Rhythms

finding: The SNP rs1501357, a polymorphism in the HCN1 gene, was associated with working memory both behaviorally and neurologically in studies involving schizophrenia patients and healthy controls. This finding highlighted the relevance of HCN1 in cognitive functions and its connection to schizophrenia.
title: Decoding frontotemporal and cell type-specific vulnerabilities to neuropsychiatric disorders and psychoactive drugs

finding: The SNP rs267949, an intron variant of the DAP gene on chromosome 5, was identified by the omnibus test despite not being noted in the original univariate GWAS. Previous studies have found associations between the DAP gene and Ulcerative Colitis (UC).
title: JASS: Command Line and Web interface for the joint analysis of GWAS results

finding: The study identified rs6874700 as the most significant marker within the ISL1 region associated with classic bladder exstrophy (CBE), achieving a p-value of 1.48 x 10-24 in a genome-wide association study (GWAS) meta-analysis. CBE is a major defect form of the bladder exstrophy-epispadias complex.
title: EZH2 specifically regulates ISL1 during embryonic urinary tract formation

finding: Marker rs2303751 was revealed through the analysis of genetic loci linked with rs6874700, showing a high regulatory effect predicted with a p-value of 8.12 x 10-20. This marker was demonstrated to have a binding site for EZH2 and was part of a newly identified promoter regulatory region important for ISL1 expression, thereby playing a significant role in the regulation of ISL1 during urinary tract formation.
title: EZH2 specifically regulates ISL1 during embryonic urinary tract formation

finding: The SNP rs13153692 was associated with tumor cell heterogeneity in human colorectal cancer, indicating its relevance in cancer biology and potential implications for understanding disease mechanisms.
title: Ring Array Illumination Microscopy: Combination of Super-Resolution with Large Field of View Imaging and long Working Distances

finding: The SNP rs116483731, which corresponds to a missense variant in the gene SPDL1 (p.Arg20Gln), was identified as a novel risk allele for IPF. The variant reached a combined p-value of 2.2 × 10^-20 across two cohorts, with an odds ratio of 2.87, suggesting a significant increase in IPF risk associated with this variant. It was noted that this locus had not been reported in previous large-scale genome-wide association studies (GWAS) for IPF.
title: Identification of a novel missense variant in SPDL1 associated with idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis

finding: The SNP rs12653308, situated at the 5q14.3 locus within the gene body of VCAN, was found to be strongly associated with N0, particularly in the hippocampus. The study reported associations with various diffusion metrics from white matter fiber tracts and cortical surface measurements, but notably emphasized the strong effect in the hippocampus. VCAN plays a critical role in astrocyte-mediated neuroinflammation and the findings indicated that genetic variants of genes encoding chondroitin sulfate proteoglycans (CSPGs) were linked to tissue features, particularly astrocytic processes in the human hippocampus.
title: Multivariate genome-wide association study on tissue-sensitive diffusion metrics identifies key molecular pathways for axonal growth, synaptogenesis, and astrocyte-mediated neuroinflammation

finding: In the analysis, SNP rs257899 was found to associate with the expression of the gene <italic>SLC27A6</italic> in human heart tissue, indicating a strong eQTL signal confirmed with an FDR of less than 0.1. However, no significant <italic>cis</italic> eQTL activity for this SNP was detected in chimpanzees, illustrating a difference in the regulatory effects of this SNP between the species.
title: Gene expression variability in human and chimpanzee populations share common determinants

finding: The SNP rs41545019, a low-frequency missense variant in MSH3, was associated with a significant increase in TCF4 repeat instability (0.24 [0.05] s.d.; p=5.7×10^-6). This variant also had a previously unidentified effect on hastening the onset of Huntington's disease by approximately 2.25 years (p=0.006), suggesting its crucial role in repeat expansion across different contexts.
title: Insights into the causes and consequences of DNA repeat expansions from 700,000 biobank participants

finding: The study identified a novel association of the A allele of rs33961405, located in an intron of the TERT gene, which was linked to decreased telomere length specifically in T-cells. This association was significant after permutation-based false discovery rate correction, showing an effect size of -0.19 with a standard error of 0.03.
title: Genetic, parental and lifestyle factors influence telomere length

finding: The SNP rs12517864 was identified as a PU.1 motif-altering variant that served as a secondary expression QTL (eQTL) for ZNF608 in lymphoblastoid cell lines (LCLs). This variant was found to colocalize with lymphocyte count associations and was indicated to increase PU.1 binding motif score significantly, which in turn suggested a regulatory relationship with ZNF608 expression levels.
title: Colocalization of blood cell traits GWAS associations and variation in PU.1 genomic occupancy prioritizes causal noncoding regulatory variants

finding: This SNP represented an intronic variant within the FGF18 gene, also contributing to height-associated variants that were previously undetected before this study.
title: Joint modelling of whole genome sequence data for human height via approximate message passing

finding: This GWAS variant was linked to decreased expression of PIK3R1 specifically in PBS-treated chondrocytes, suggesting condition-specific regulatory effects tied to OA.
title: Response eQTLs, chromatin accessibility, and 3D chromatin structure in chondrocytes provide mechanistic insight into osteoarthritis risk

finding: Associated with the PAPPA gene under PBS treatment, this eQTL exhibited the same direction of effect in both experimental conditions, reiterating its importance in OA pathology.
title: Response eQTLs, chromatin accessibility, and 3D chromatin structure in chondrocytes provide mechanistic insight into osteoarthritis risk

finding: The SNP rs2248374 was significantly associated with the presence or absence of full-length ERAP2 protein in individuals. Subjects genotyped as G/G at this SNP did not express the full-length ERAP2, while those with the A/A genotype did. Interestingly, a protein corresponding to a shorter form of ERAP2, approximately 55 kDa, was detected in differentiated monocytes regardless of the genotyping at this SNP. This suggests that the shorter ERAP2 form is expressed independently of the SNP alleles and is secreted by macrophages, particularly of the M2 type.
title: A short ERAP2 that binds IRAP is expressed in macrophages independently from gene variation

finding: The SNP rs13174402 was linked to the regulation of SUMO4's effects on DNA damage response and repair. It was found that this particular SNP was critical because it affected SUMO4 conjugation levels, which were determined to be deleterious for DNA repair processes, thereby highlighting its relevance in cancer therapeutic strategies.
title: SUMO4 promotes SUMO deconjugation required for DNA double-strand break repair

finding: The rs1173771 SNP was shown to be associated with higher mean arterial pressure (MAP), systolic and diastolic blood pressure (SBP, DBP) and pulse pressure, particularly through its linkage to various haplotypes that influenced the expression of the adjacent gene, NPR3. Animal models indicated that deletion of the noncoding region orthologous to rs1173771 led to a 9.4 mmHg reduction in SBP when on a high-salt diet. Additionally, the G allele of rs1173771 was identified as a significant risk factor for elevated blood pressure in multiple populations.
title: Physiological role and mechanisms of action for a long noncoding haplotype region

finding: The T allele of rs11750646 significantly increased the expression of the gene PIK3R1. This increase was attributed to enhanced binding affinity of the androgen receptor (AR) to an open chromatin region downstream of PIK3R1. The C allele disrupted the AR motif, which was linked to a higher risk of osteoarthritis (OA).
title: Comprehensive profiling of transcriptional regulation in cartilage reveals pathogenesis of osteoarthritis

finding: The SNP rs16891982 in SLC45A2 was associated with variation in skin and hair pigmentation among different human populations. It encoded a single amino acid change known as F374, which represented phenylalanine (F374) in light-skinned individuals and leucine (L374) in dark-skinned individuals. The finding indicated that the F374 variant was nearly fixed in light-skinned populations and significantly affected melanin synthesis. Experimental evidence suggested that the F374 variant had a markedly decreased transporter activity, which contributed to its association with pigmentation variation.
title: SLC45A2 protein stability and regulation of melanosome pH determine melanocyte pigmentation

finding: The SNP rs13184700 was implicated in the effects of vorinostat, showing an overview of its role in breast cancer and potentially affecting treatment outcomes with this HDAC inhibitor.
title: A bi-functional PARP-HDAC inhibitor with activity in Ewing sarcoma

finding: The SNP rs832582 in the MAP3K1 gene was found to be associated with a predisposition to a more intense inflammatory response in patients with colonic Crohn's Disease (cCD). This association suggested that the presence of this specific SNP could serve as a potential biomarker for Infliximab resistance, indicating that individuals carrying this SNP would likely not benefit from anti-TNF therapy. Thus, it highlighted the necessity for considering alternative therapeutic strategies for those with this genetic variation.
title: An Inter-Species Translation Model Implicates Integrin Signaling in Infliximab-Resistant Colonic Crohn’s Disease

finding: The rs374702773 SNP (delta T allele in intron) in the UBXN3B gene was found to be associated with protection against alcoholic liver cirrhosis, which is characterized as a chronic inflammatory condition in humans. This finding suggested a critical role of UBXN3B signaling in managing inflammation and potentially indicated that individuals with this allele may experience better outcomes in inflammatory diseases.
title: UBXN3B Restricts Viral Pathogenesis by Maintaining Hematopoietic Homeostasis

finding: The SNP rs7731626 was identified as the main risk SNP at the ANKRD55 locus associated with multiple sclerosis (MS) and rheumatoid arthritis (RA). It modulated the expression of ANKRD55 and its neighboring gene IL6ST in CD4+ T lymphocytes. This SNP also co-localized with the strongest cis-expression quantitative trait locus (eQTL) for ANKRD55 in whole blood and spleen. Furthermore, it was linked to higher expression levels of the gene in immune-relevant processes, suggesting its relevance to autoimmune conditions.
title: ANKRD55 interacts with an IFT-B-like complex in microglia

finding: The SNP rs11950533 was associated with the gene CATSPER3 at the C5orf24 locus and was highlighted as a putatively causal gene through rare coding variant burden analyses in the study of PD.
title: Expanding Parkinson’s disease genetics: novel risk loci, genomic context, causal insights and heritable risk

finding: SNP rs226198 was linked to two breast cancer-associated SNPs (rs146817970 and rs7707921) from the GWAS catalog. It overlapped a MYC:MAX dimer motif crucial for MYC's binding at the TF's binding site, with downstream impacts on genes such as ATP6AP1L, ATG10, and RPS23 plus significance due to its location within a chromatin accessibility region.
title: funMotifs: Tissue-specific transcription factor motifs

finding: The G388R SNP (rs351855) was implicated in promoting progression and mediating treatment resistance across multiple cancer types, including breast cancer. It was associated with aberrant activation of FGFR4 signaling due to receptor or ligand overexpression, as well as mutations. Furthermore, breast cancer displayed a significant enrichment of FGFR4 mutation in metastases (2.2%) compared to primary tumors (0.45%), indicating a potential role in therapy resistance.
title: Estrogen regulation and functional role of FGFR4 in estrogen receptor positive breast cancer

finding: The SNP rs2304058, located at the PDGFRB locus with a meta-P-value of 4.06 × 10^-9, was recognized for its role within the cytokine interaction network.
title: Multivariate genome-wide association analysis of a cytokine network reveals variants with widespread immune, haematological and cardiometabolic pleiotropy

finding: The SNP rs1131769, a non-synonymous polymorphism in the TMEM173 gene, was associated with a significant reduction in the IFNα response to vaccinia virus stimulation. The findings revealed that individuals carrying the H232 variant exhibited a 90% reduction in secreted IFNα compared to those with the R232 variant, indicating impaired STING-mediated innate immunity. This data clarified previous studies and highlighted the importance of distinct SNPs in modulating immune response to vaccination.
title: Polymorphisms in STING affect human innate immune responses to poxviruses

finding: SNP rs7380824 was linked to a statistically significant decrease in the IFNα response (p < 2E-16), independent of the effects of rs1131769. This finding further supported the hypothesis regarding multiple SNPs having individual effects on immune response phenotypes.
title: Polymorphisms in STING affect human innate immune responses to poxviruses

finding: The study referenced indicated that the SNP rs13184507 was associated with the progression of cutaneous squamous cell carcinoma (CSCC) through its influence on p53 activity. This finding was significant as it emphasized the role of p53 mutations in tumor development and the immune response, linking the SNP specifically to alterations in tumor cell behavior.
title: Generating serum-based antibodies from tumor-exposed mice: a new potential strategy for cutaneous squamous cell carcinoma treatment

finding: The SNP rs13163934 was associated with variations in the enzymatic metabolism of flavonoids by gut microbiota. This correlation was particularly important as it suggested a link between this genetic variant and the effectiveness of flavonoid-mediated anti-obesity treatments, thereby providing insights into the genetic factors influencing the response to microbial treatments involving compounds like rutin.
title: Inducing a synergistic anti-obesity effect by increasing the bioavailability of the flavonoid rutin with a L. plantarum species

finding: The SNP rs13174486 was associated with the gene CD82, which was identified as having altered abundance, polarization, and colocalization in the context of chemotherapy resistance related to acute lymphoblastic leukemia (ALL). This finding was considered original because it linked the genetic variation at this SNP to the functional dynamics of CD82 in response to fludarabine treatment, indicating its potential as a therapeutic target.
title: Mapping the Spatial Proteome of Leukemia Cells Undergoing Fludarabine Treatment

finding: The SNP rs13153798 was identified in the context of T Cell Factor-1 (TCF-7) and its influence on CD8 T cell function. The finding indicated that the allele associated with rs13153798 played a role in the regulation of peripheral CD8 T cell inflammatory cytokine production and activation, which is relevant for tumor clearance during immune responses.
title: TCF-7 is dispensable for anti-tumor response but required for persistent function of mature CD8 T cells

finding: The finding related to SNP rs13163940 demonstrated a significant association with the carcinogenic role of IQGAP1, as reported by Wei and Lambert in 2021. This association was linked to the activation of Rac1 in triple-negative breast cancer, contributing to tumor cell proliferation and migration. The study suggested that this SNP could serve as a potential therapeutic target by impacting the Integrin β4/TNFAIP2/IQGAP1/Rac1 axis, which plays a crucial role in DNA damage drug resistance.
title: Integrin β4 promotes DNA damage drug resistance in triple-negative breast cancer via TNFAIP2/IQGAP1/Rac1

finding: The variant rs10793810 was identified as a microglia (MG) specific sc-eQTL of SLC27A6, enhancing the binding of the transcription factor FOXP2, which was highly expressed in MG, to a MG-specific enhancer of SLC27A6.
title: Integrative single cell multiomics analysis of human retina indicates a role for hierarchical transcription factors collaboration in genetic effects on gene regulation

finding: The variant rs6859300 was recognized as a rod-specific sc-caQTL, augmenting the binding of EPAS1 to an OCR that was accessible in rods, cones, and bipolar cells, while being a sc-eQTL of WWC1 in rods.
title: Integrative single cell multiomics analysis of human retina indicates a role for hierarchical transcription factors collaboration in genetic effects on gene regulation

finding: As a lead variant at the TERT locus, rs7705526 was associated with a 1.3-fold increased risk of CHIP (OR 1.3, p=6.1x10<sup>-10</sup>; conditional OR 1.1, p=4.7x10<sup>-4</sup>). This variant is in strong linkage disequilibrium with rs34002450 (r<sup>2</sup>=0.55).
title: Inherited Causes of Clonal Hematopoiesis of Indeterminate Potential in TOPMed Whole Genomes

finding: The rs13167280 variant was identified as an independent association with CHIP status, conferring a 1.3-fold increased risk (OR 1.3, p=6.1x10<sup>-10</sup>).
title: Inherited Causes of Clonal Hematopoiesis of Indeterminate Potential in TOPMed Whole Genomes

finding: The variant rs31746 was associated with nicotine cravings and the likelihood of relapse based on self-reported smoking behavior. It was identified within the PCDHB12 gene, which is part of the protocadherin gene cluster responsible for intracellular signaling and cell adhesion. Furthermore, this variant was connected to differential expression of the PCDHβ8 gene in postmortem dorsolateral prefrontal cortex tissue of humans, suggesting a potential relevance to substance use disorders, including acute opioid intoxication.
title: Differential Expression of NPAS4 in the Dorsolateral Prefrontal Cortex Following Acute Opioid Intoxication

finding: This rare variant was associated with fluid intelligence and exhibited pleiotropic effects impacting HDL and glucose. The effects on fluid intelligence were diminished when controlling for these metabolic traits. This suggests metabolic factors might mediate its influence on cognitive function.
title: Exome-wide analysis reveals role of LRP1 and additional novel loci in cognition

finding: This intronic SNP in <italic>POLR3G</italic> was related to episodic memory and demonstrated control of expression across brain regions.
title: Exome-wide analysis reveals role of LRP1 and additional novel loci in cognition

finding: The SNP rs13163969 was associated with the kallikrein-related peptidase 6 (KLK6), which was found to be significantly upregulated in pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma (PDAC) compared to normal pancreatic tissue. This association highlighted KLK6's role in the tumor microenvironment of PDAC, emphasizing its potential as a diagnostic marker and its specific intertwining with the malignancy.
title: Targeted and Explorative Profiling of Kallikrein Proteases and Global Proteome Biology of Pancreatic Ductal Adenocarcinoma, Chronic Pancreatitis, and Normal Pancreas Highlights Disease-Specific Proteome Remodelling

finding: The SNP rs7730971 was found to be significantly associated with splice sites in the FBXO38 gene and demonstrated the highest degree of colocalization with GWAS data (CLPP=0.845). This SNP's association suggested it may be a causative variant influencing alternative splicing, leading to a protective effect against COPD by including a novel exon.
title: Analysis of genetically driven alternative splicing identifies FBXO38 as a novel COPD susceptibility gene

finding: The SNP rs10040093 was originally identified in relation to the role of Activator Protein-1 (AP-1) family members in CD30-positive lymphomas. In the study conducted by Garces de Los Fayos Alonso et al. (2018), it was found that variations at this SNP could influence the progression and characteristics of these lymphomas, highlighting its significance in cancer genetics.
title: EAP: a versatile cloud-based platform for comprehensive and interactive analysis of large-scale ChIP/ATAC-seq data sets

finding: The variant rs200373343 (p.Arg94Cys) in THBS4 exhibited a frequency 45 times higher in FinMetSeq relative to NFE and was associated with a mean decrease in body weight of 5.9 kg, linking it to metabolic traits.
title: Exome sequencing identifies high-impact trait-associated alleles enriched in Finns

finding: The SNP rs13153754 contributed to improved neo-antigen discovery in metastatic melanoma, indicating its potential role in immunopeptidomics.
title: Diagnostic Ion Data Analysis Reduction (DIDAR) allows rapid quality control analysis and filtering of multiplexed single cell proteomics data

finding: The SNP p.A279T (rs61748181) was identified as one of the common <italic>TERT</italic> variants, present in both MDS and NHL cohorts, with a frequency of 11.9% in MDS patients. This finding contributed to understanding the genetic landscape of MDS but was not specifically linked to any adverse outcomes.
title: The clinical and functional effects of TERT variants in myelodysplastic syndrome

finding: The SNP p.H412Y (rs34094720) was classified as a common <italic>TERT</italic> variant, occurring at a frequency of 12.0% in NHL cohorts. Similar to rs61748181, its association with clinical outcomes was not directly stated.
title: The clinical and functional effects of TERT variants in myelodysplastic syndrome

finding: The SNP p.A1062T (rs35719940) was mentioned as one of the common <italic>TERT</italic> variants with a frequency of 11.9% in MDS patients. Its specific role in MDS pathogenesis was not elaborated in the context.
title: The clinical and functional effects of TERT variants in myelodysplastic syndrome

finding: The SNP rs13153801 was associated with non-genetic resistance to platinum therapy in epithelial ovarian cancer. This finding highlighted the role of the MBD3-NuRD complex in the development of resistance, suggesting that genetic variations at this locus might influence the efficacy of platinum-based treatments.
title: CRISPR gene and transcriptome engineering (CRISPRgate) improves loss-of-function genetic screening approaches

finding: The study highlighted that the activating TERT promoter mutations in glioblastoma had prognostic value, particularly in relation to the rs2853669 polymorphism. This SNP was noted to interact with the patient age at diagnosis, suggesting that it might influence outcomes in GBM patients.
title: A liquid biopsy platform for detecting gene-gene fusions as glioma diagnostic biomarkers and drug targets

finding: The SNP rs112072727 was part of an LD block associated with left ventricular diameter (LVID), indicating its potential importance in cardiac morphology.
title: Trajectory analysis of cardiovascular phenotypes from biobank data uncovers novel genetic associations

finding: The SNP rs78565023 was identified in association with LVID, suggesting its role in influencing heart size and shape.
title: Trajectory analysis of cardiovascular phenotypes from biobank data uncovers novel genetic associations

finding: The SNP rs74669701 was significantly associated with LVID trajectory and linked to a putative SOX9 transcription factor binding site, indicating its regulatory potential.
title: Trajectory analysis of cardiovascular phenotypes from biobank data uncovers novel genetic associations

finding: The SNP rs17651767 was associated with LVID and showed enrichment in H3K27Ac marks, suggesting an active enhancer role in cardiac regulation.
title: Trajectory analysis of cardiovascular phenotypes from biobank data uncovers novel genetic associations

finding: The SNP rs76494545 demonstrated significant association with LVID and was found to be involved in regulatory enrichment in tissue-specific contexts.
title: Trajectory analysis of cardiovascular phenotypes from biobank data uncovers novel genetic associations

finding: The SNP rs113861938 was linked to LVID in the GWAS analysis, supporting its importance in cardiovascular outcomes.
title: Trajectory analysis of cardiovascular phenotypes from biobank data uncovers novel genetic associations

finding: The TIMD4 rs6882076 SNP was linked to decreased triglyceride levels and a lowered risk of coronary heart disease and ischemic stroke, which could relate to cardiovascular risk in kidney disease.
title: Identification of novel prognostic targets in acute kidney injury using bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The AGXT2 SNP rs37369 variant was identified as a risk factor for diabetes, which is relevant given the close relationship between diabetes and kidney injury.
title: Identification of novel prognostic targets in acute kidney injury using bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: Linked significantly to tumor grade (P=6.25×10⁻³).
title: Common breast cancer risk loci predispose to distinct tumor subtypes

finding: Associated exclusively with PR, showing significant results (P=5.46×10⁻³).
title: Common breast cancer risk loci predispose to distinct tumor subtypes

finding: The SNP rs13153678 was associated with the role of Follicular Helper T Cells (Tfh) in cancer immunity. Specifically, findings indicated that Tfh-like cells secreted IL-21, which promoted antitumor immunity against ovarian tumors, thus providing insight into differentiation pathways and immune response mechanisms relevant to tumor microenvironments.
title: Predicting developmental relationships of tumor resident and circulating T cells in ovarian cancer

finding: This SNP was identified as a ctVariant influencing NK cell proportions and also served as a cis-eVariant for the C6 gene, indicating its dual role in immune regulation.
title: Expression QTLs in single-cell sequencing data

finding: Similar to rs445118, rs12655804 was found to affect NK cell proportions, confirming its relevance in the genetic architecture of immune cell distribution.
title: Expression QTLs in single-cell sequencing data

finding: The ADRB2 rs1042713 variant was identified to be associated with obesity and its related phenotypes, influenced notably by dietary fat intake.
title: Screening and identification of key biomarkers associated with endometriosis using bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The SNP rs188427942 was found in the European American population and was associated with a non-response to phenylephrine, where carriers exhibited an average delta systolic blood pressure (ΔSBP) of -9 mmHg compared to 20 mmHg for non-carriers.
title: Rapid response to the Alpha-1 Adrenergic Agent Phenylephrine in the Perioperative Period is Impacted by Genomics and Ancestry

finding: Similar to rs188427942, rs147664194 was identified in European Americans as a non-responder SNP, with carriers also showing an average ΔSBP of -9 mmHg, further confirming its relation to diminished response to phenylephrine.
title: Rapid response to the Alpha-1 Adrenergic Agent Phenylephrine in the Perioperative Period is Impacted by Genomics and Ancestry

finding: This SNP was identified in both European American and Hispanic/Latino populations and corresponded to a subgroup of 'super-responders' who had a significant positive response to phenylephrine, indicated by an average ΔSBP of 37 mmHg in European Americans and 53 mmHg in Hispanic/Latinos.
title: Rapid response to the Alpha-1 Adrenergic Agent Phenylephrine in the Perioperative Period is Impacted by Genomics and Ancestry

finding: The variant near the <italic>PELO</italic> gene was associated with a four-fold risk for type 2 diabetes (odds ratio 4.3, 95% CI: 2.7 - 6.9, p = 1.75 × 10^-8). It was also linked to increased risk for metformin use under the recessive model, highlighting the importance of recessive analysis over additive models.
title: The impact of non-additive genetic associations on age-related complex diseases

finding: The CARTPT gene variant rs2239670 was associated with obesity, which is a known risk factor for T2DM, establishing its relevance in the metabolic disorder context.
title: Bioinformatics analysis of potential key genes and mechanisms in type 2 diabetes mellitus

finding: The CD14 gene polymorphism rs2569190 was associated with coronary artery disease, which has implications for T2DM-related cardiovascular risks.
title: Bioinformatics analysis of potential key genes and mechanisms in type 2 diabetes mellitus

finding: As a SNP within the PCDHB16 gene, rs2950846 showed lower expression levels in AUD subjects and in PASSPORT-seq analyses but exhibited higher levels after ethanol treatment in SK-N-BE(2) cells, demonstrating a conflicting effect based on treatment.
title: Allele-Specific Expression and High-Throughput Reporter Assay Reveal Functional Variants in Human Brains with Alcohol Use Disorders

finding: Located in a relevant gene, rs2338530 also demonstrated significant changes in expression levels with varying ethanol doses in SK-N-BE(2) cells, indicating its role in the response to alcohol and its effect on allelic imbalance.
title: Allele-Specific Expression and High-Throughput Reporter Assay Reveal Functional Variants in Human Brains with Alcohol Use Disorders

finding: Variant rs7719885 was predicted to decrease NKX2-5 binding affinity but was found to increase it instead when tested in vitro, resulting in a significant differential DNA binding.
title: Disease-Associated Non-Coding Variants Alter NKX2-5 DNA-Binding Affinity

finding: The G allele of rs185220 was associated with increased chromatin accessibility in neurons and progenitors within a caPeak overlapping the SETD9 TSS and corresponded to increased expression of SETD9. The SNP disrupted REST motifs, leading to a predicted increase in chromatin accessibility due to loss of REST binding, which is consistent with REST's role as a repressor.
title: Cell-type specific effects of genetic variation on chromatin accessibility during human neuronal differentiation

finding: SNP rs34220 was found significant for resistance to leaf rust on chromosome 6A. It was associated with three known Lr genes, Lr56, Lr62, and Lr64, which are seedling resistance genes. However, as these genes were not part of the GWAS panel, the locus may represent other unidentified loci for leaf rust resistance.
title: Identification of novel leaf rust seedling resistance loci in Iranian bread wheat germplasm using genome-wide association mapping

finding: The intergenic SNP rs6864758 was associated with age-dependent effects on surface area changes, indicating a broader role in brain morphology across the lifespan.
title: Dynamics of Brain Structure and its Genetic Architecture over the Lifespan

finding: The rs78393591 SNP in DROSHA was linked to breast cancer risk.
title: A pan-cancer atlas of somatic mutations in miRNA biogenesis genes

finding: The SNP rs6882046, located near LINC00461, was identified among outliers that contributed to the analysis of the causal relationship between years of schooling and BMI. It was associated with traits like alcohol intake frequency.
title: MR-TRYX: A Mendelian randomization framework that exploits horizontal pleiotropy to infer novel causal pathways

finding: The study confirmed the heterozygous knockin of the G251D variant (NM_001127644.2(GABRA1):c.752G>A (p.Gly251Asp)) in the GABRA1 gene using CRISPR/Cas9 gene editing in human iPSCs. This SNP was identified as causative for genetic epilepsy due to its loss of function characteristics, which involved decreased folding and surface trafficking of the α1 subunit of GABA<sub>A</sub> receptors. The variant highlighted a clinical link to mild to severe epilepsy phenotypes.
title: Pharmacological chaperones restore proteostasis of epilepsy-associated GABAA receptor variants

finding: The SNP rs10040093 was associated with increased expression of AP-1 network genes that were critical for tumor growth in small cell lung cancer (SCLC). This finding related to the role of AP-1 transcription factors in various malignancies, highlighting their importance in driving heterogeneity within tumors.
title: Single Cell lineage Tracing Identifies Cancer Testis Antigens as Mediators of Chemoresistance in Small Cell Lung Cancer

finding: The SNP rs10060178 was linked to the stabilization of TP53 upon SARS-CoV-2 infection. This finding was contextualized by the role of TP53 in mediating the cytopathic effects resulting from infection and how variant-induced syncytia formation modified chromatin accessibility and the release of inflammatory cytokines, also relating to cellular senescence.
title: Differences in syncytia formation by SARS-CoV-2 variants modify host chromatin accessibility and cellular senescence via TP53

finding: The SNP rs16891982 was highlighted as another locus influencing blue eye color, where homozygosity for the minor allele increased the tint of blue eyes, thus supporting the genetic basis of this trait.
title: A general model for two-locus assortative mating analysis and prediction

finding: The variant rs7726159 colocalized with a cell-type-specific candidate cis-regulatory element (cCRE) within the TERT gene in basal cells, which account for 1.8% of total lung cells. Reporter assays indicated significant allelic transcriptional activity, with the lung cancer risk-associated allele showing higher levels of activity.
title: Context-aware single-cell multiome approach identified cell-type specific lung cancer susceptibility genes

finding: Similar to rs7726159, the variant rs7725218 colocalized with the cCRE in TERT specific to basal cells. The variant also showed a trend towards significant allelic transcriptional activity, suggesting its functional relevance in lung cancer susceptibility.
title: Context-aware single-cell multiome approach identified cell-type specific lung cancer susceptibility genes

finding: The G>C substitution located in the 3p passenger strand of hsa-miR-146a was associated with an increased risk of papillary thyroid carcinoma. The C allele of this SNP altered the structure of the precursor, decreased the expression of the mature miRNA, and activated the passenger strand, which became a second mature miRNA that modulated many genes involved in apoptosis regulation.
title: Pan-Cancer analysis of somatic mutations in miRNA genes

finding: The SNP rs17555038, located in the sarcoglycan delta (SGCD) gene, was highlighted by the GLN model as having important contributions to T1D risk. This finding underscores its role in complex genetic interactions beyond traditional additive models.
title: Deep integrative models for large-scale human genomics

finding: The SNP rs702634 located near the ARL15 gene was found in a mesenchymal stem cell-specific ATAC-seq peak and was part of a credible set of SNPs associated with metabolic traits. It was noted for disrupting a MEF2 motif and had a probability of 48% of being the causal SNP, suggesting a role in type 2 diabetes risk.
title: Human and rat skeletal muscle single-nuclei multi-omic integrative analyses nominate causal cell types, regulatory elements, and SNPs for complex traits

finding: The locus rs7722456 demonstrated many unexpected adenine reads across all evaluations in the dilution series. The HSG's quality control only flagged 37 out of 108 atypical observations, indicating its limited ability to identify allelic imbalance issues. The SMLR model was shown to enhance the detection rate of allele imbalance, with 106 points falling into the no-call zone at a probability threshold of q = 0.99.
title: Enhanced SNP Genotyping with Symmetric Multinomial Logistic Regression

finding: The SNP rs153308 exhibited a significant association in the analyses comparing mild cognitive impairment (MCI) cases to controls (OR = 0.51, P = 1.25E-06). However, there was no evidence of association in the ADNI dataset, suggesting it may not reflect genuine association signals.
title: Genome-wide association study of Alzheimer’s disease CSF biomarkers in the EMIF-AD Multimodal Biomarker Discovery dataset

finding: This SNP was identified as a Tier-1 SNP in ZBED3-AS1, involved in mediating obesity risk through chromatin interactions and expression modulation in adipose tissue.
title: Epigenomic and transcriptomic prioritization of candidate obesity-risk regulatory GWAS SNPs

finding: This Tier-1 SNP for ZBED3-AS1 was shown to influence obesity risk, particularly through interactions with chromatin and neighboring genes in adipose tissue.
title: Epigenomic and transcriptomic prioritization of candidate obesity-risk regulatory GWAS SNPs

finding: The SNP rs351855 in the FGFR4 gene was noted in relation to responses to chemotherapeutics including doxorubicin, cyclophosphamide, and fluorouracil, indicating its relevance in the treatment context for DLBCL.
title: Epigenetic inhibitors sensitize DLBCL cells to rituximab and doxorubicin

finding: The SNP was identified as newly FDR significant through Flexible cFDR, leveraging functional genomic data.
title: Leveraging auxiliary data from arbitrary distributions to boost GWAS discovery with Flexible cFDR

finding: PTGER4 gene variant rs76523431 emerged as a candidate risk factor for radiological joint damage in rheumatoid arthritis patients, underscoring its relevance in joint diseases.
title: Identification of Key Genes and Underlying Mechanisms in Cystic Fibrosis and its Associated Complications Based on Bioinformatics Analysis of Next Generation Sequencing Data Analysis

finding: The finding related to the SNP rs13184579 indicated that it correlated with distinct tumor-associated macrophages (TAMs) subsets in melanoma. The study highlighted the role of macrophage heterogeneity in relation to their ontogeny and function, specifically how F4/80+ TAMs displayed differences in gene expression profiles that matched certain identified TAM clusters in other tumor models and human cancers, suggesting a potential link to tumor progression and prognosis.
title: Functionally and metabolically divergent melanoma-associated macrophages originate from common bone-marrow precursors

finding: The SNP rs13184609 was associated with metabolic differences in macrophages within the tumor microenvironment of colorectal cancer (CRC). Specifically, it showed a linkage to traits that augment the anti-tumor properties of M1 macrophages, thereby enhancing understanding of macrophage metabolism related to CRC and informing strategies aimed at modulating immune responses through metabolic pathways.
title: Ensemble-based genome-scale modeling predicts metabolic differences between macrophage subtypes in colorectal cancer

finding: The SNP rs2248374 was shown to be critical for the expression of the ERAP2 gene. Its genotype strongly correlated with ERAP2 expression, where the A allele led to full-length transcripts and functional protein, while the G allele was associated with reduced expression and the presence of premature termination codons. This finding established rs2248374 as a primary SNP influencing ERAP2 expression.
title: A cis-regulatory element regulates ERAP2 expression through autoimmune disease risk SNPs

finding: The SNP rs10060207 was identified in the context of hypersialylation in cancer, which has been linked to modulation of inflammation and poses therapeutic opportunities. This finding indicated that alterations in sialic acid binding, as influenced by genetic variations such as rs10060207, could significantly impact the development or progression of cancer-related inflammation.
title: A Versatile Soluble Siglec Scaffold for Sensitive and Quantitative Detection of Glycan Ligands

finding: The SNP rs73351608 was implicated in blood protein measurements and was associated with significant gene expression changes in response to Hepatocystis infection. This connection provided insights into how similar genetic factors may play a role in the resistance mechanisms observed in both humans and colobus monkeys.
title: Immunogenetic response to a malaria-like parasite in a wild primate

finding: The 'T' allele of the top eSNP (rs1295686) for IL13 was associated with greater IL13 expression in PHA-stimulated T cells and an increased risk of asthma, allergic sensitization, and allergic disease.
title: Neonatal genetics of gene expression reveal the origins of autoimmune and allergic disease risk

finding: The missense SNP (rs20541) in IL13 co-occurred with the reQTL rs1295686, which was linked to increased IL13 expression and risk for allergic diseases, highlighting its role in gene regulation under stimulation.
title: Neonatal genetics of gene expression reveal the origins of autoimmune and allergic disease risk

finding: This SNP was identified as a novel shared risk variant between ASD and ADHD, although it did not reach statistical significance in either disorder's GWAS. It is found in the genomic region associated with multiple traits such as depression and educational achievement.
title: Combining multivariate genomic approaches to elucidate the comorbidity between ASD and ADHD

finding: The SNP rs17448496 located at locus 5q32 showed a suggestive association with COVID-19 susceptibility in individuals of European ancestry. It was linked to the gene PPP2R2B, with an odds ratio (OR) of 0.173 and a p-value of 5.15 x 10^-6. This finding indicated a potential protective effect against SARS-CoV-2 infection, suggesting that higher presence of the G allele may relate to lower risk of severe COVID-19 outcomes.
title: Ancestral origins are associated with SARS-CoV-2 susceptibility and protection in a Florida patient population

finding: The SNP rs875741, which was linked to the trait mean corpuscular hemoglobin (MCH), showed a predicted ENCODE-rE2G connection to the gene CPEB4 specifically in hematopoietic progenitors. This connection was not observed in other closely related blood cell types such as B-cells and T-cells. The predictive model identified this enhancer-gene link which illustrated the cell-type specificity of regulation, indicating that the influence of rs875741 on MCH is mediated through CPEB4 in specific cell types.
title: An encyclopedia of enhancer-gene regulatory interactions in the human genome

finding: The SNP rs13164040 was associated with the PI3K/Akt signaling pathway, which played a significant role in the metabolic dysfunction observed in metastatic, castrate-resistant prostate cancer (mCRPC). This pathway was implicated in the therapeutic resistance observed among patients, particularly regarding the response to immune checkpoint inhibitors.
title: Suppression of tumor cell lactate-generating signaling pathways eradicates murine PTEN/p53-deficient aggressive-variant prostate cancer via macrophage phagocytosis

finding: The SNP rs3212227 in IL12B was significantly associated with tuberculosis (TB) severity, with a combined p-value of 0.0006 across two independent cohorts, supporting previous research linking IL12B to TB susceptibility.
title: Interaction between host genes and M. tuberculosis lineage can affect tuberculosis severity: evidence for coevolution

finding: The SNP rs3212220 was noted as having the most significant combined p-value of 0.0005, demonstrating its role in the association with TB severity alongside the other significant SNPs in IL12B.
title: Interaction between host genes and M. tuberculosis lineage can affect tuberculosis severity: evidence for coevolution

finding: The frequency of the derived allele at rs16891982 in the SLC45A2 gene was estimated at 0.7098 in the Mokrin sample, indicating a significant presence of this allele associated with skin depigmentation in Europeans. This finding closely aligned with similar frequencies found in modern populations in Spain.
title: Kinship, acquired and inherited status, and population structure at the Early Bronze Age Mokrin necropolis in northern Serbia

finding: Rs26134, a variant in the LIPC gene region, displayed a unique and potentially pleiotropic effect in AMD risk analysis, where it correlated negatively with the predicted risk associated with XL.HDL.C, unlike all other variants analyzed.
title: Selecting causal risk factors from high-throughput experiments using multivariable Mendelian randomization

finding: The SNP rs10060154 was associated with cancer phenotypes linked to p53 mutant aggregation. This was part of research that provided evidence suggesting that amyloidogenic mutations in p53 impact the aggregation process, which has implications in multiple types of cancer as discussed in the study by Kanapathipillai (2018). This relationship highlighted the role of protein aggregation in the pathology of cancer associated with p53 mutations.
title: P53 TAD2 Domain (38-61) Forms Amyloid-like Aggregates in Isolation

finding: The SNP rs10060166 was linked to cancer treatments as it appeared in the context of targeting mutant P53. It was associated with the enhancement of therapies that aimed to reactivate mutant forms of P53, specifically through the action of zinc metallochaperones, as detailed in a study by Kogan and Carpizo (2018). This underscores the significance of zinc's role in cancer therapeutics related to P53 pathways.
title: Phage libraries screening on P53 : yield improvement by zinc and a new parasites-integrating analysis and rationale

finding: This SNP was associated with the <italic>NPR3</italic> gene, located in enhancer chromatin. It was linked to eQTL data suggesting it plays a role in bone density regulation and was identified as an index SNP in blood pressure studies.
title: Prioritization of osteoporosis-associated GWAS SNPs using epigenomics and transcriptomics

finding: Located within regulatory regions for <italic>NPR3</italic>, this SNP had a significant association with gene expression and was indicated in enhancing bone growth through receptor signaling.
title: Prioritization of osteoporosis-associated GWAS SNPs using epigenomics and transcriptomics

finding: The SNP rs13174304 was associated with PIM kinases, as noted in the study by Wu et al., which indicated that these kinases might play a significant role in various diseases, including multiple myeloma. This context suggests that rs13174304 could influence pathways related to PIM kinase activity, potentially impacting antiviral responses in conditions such as infection with arboviruses like MAYV.
title: Targeting Host PIM Protein Kinases Reduces Mayaro Virus Replication

finding: This SNP was part of the Irisplex system which is related to eye color. It was also included in the Hirisplex-S system for determining various pigmentation traits, indicating its role in human pigmentation.
title: How to choose sets of ancestry informative markers: A supervised feature selection approach

finding: The rs12916 variant demonstrated a known causal association with LDL cholesterol, although it revealed complexities regarding its role in BMI and diabetes which were shown as alternative causal variants.
title: CoPheScan: phenome-wide association studies accounting for linkage disequilibrium

finding: The rs2549794 SNP near ERAP2 emerged as the strongest candidate for selection, achieving a p-value of 1.2×10⁻⁵, which was below the Bonferroni-corrected significance threshold of 2.8×10⁻⁵. This variant was linked to an enhanced immune response against Y. pestis, showing a significant allele frequency increase associated with protection against severe respiratory infections during the Black Death.
title: Reply to Barton et al: signatures of natural selection during the Black Death

finding: The study reported that the rs41115 polymorphism in the apc gene was associated with survival in Iranian colorectal cancer patients, indicating its potential significance in cancer prognosis and treatment response.
title: NestedBD: Bayesian Inference of Phylogenetic Trees From Single-Cell DNA Copy Number Profile Data Under a Birth-Death Model

finding: The association of rs3792876 in the SLC22A4 gene with autoimmune thyroid disease in a Chinese population may link it to pathways involved in autoimmune modifications relevant to Crohn's disease.
title: Identification of hub genes and key pathways in pediatric Crohn’s disease using next generation sequencing and bioinformatics analysis
